 21359                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21360                                  
 21361                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21362                                  
 21363                                  modify_spc:
 21364 00003373 50                      	push	ax			; ax = sectors per cluster
 21365 00003374 52                      	push	dx
 21366 00003375 F7E1                    	mul	cx			; bytes per sector
 21367                                  	;cmp	dx,0
 21368 00003377 21D2                    	and	dx,dx
 21369 00003379 7503                    	jnz	short mspc_1
 21370 0000337B 3D0040                  	cmp	ax,16384		; 16 kilobytes (per cluster)
 21371                                  					; ***
 21372                                  					; actual disk size limit
 21373                                  					; without invalidating cluster counts is
 21374                                  					; 2 GB (512K clusters * 8 sectors per cluster)
 21375                                  					;      (128K clusters * 32 sectors per cluster)
 21376                                  mspc_1:
 21377 0000337E 5A                      	pop	dx
 21378 0000337F 58                      	pop	ax
 21379 00003380 760E                    	jbe	short mspc_3		; bytes per cluster <= 16 KB
 21380                                                                          ; ***
 21381                                                                          ; bytes per cluster > 16 KB
 21382 00003382 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; 0
 21383 00003384 BBFEFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFEh		; (invalidated)
 21384 00003387 09F6                    	or	si,si			; hw of free cluster count
 21385 00003389 7404                    	jz	short mspc_2		; si = 0
 21386 0000338B 89FE                    	mov	si,di			; si = 0
 21387 0000338D 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx			; dx = bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated)
 21388                                  mspc_2:
 21389 0000338F C3                      	retn
 21390                                  
 21391                                  mspc_3:
 21392 00003390 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1			; sectors per clust = sectors per clust * 2
 21393                                  					; (ax <= 32768) -modified spc limit-
 21394 00003392 D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; cluster count = cluster count /2
 21395                                  					; di:bx = modified value of total clusters
 21396                                  mspc_4:
 21397 00003394 D1DB                    	rcr	bx,1
 21398 00003396 D1EE                    	shr	si,1			; free clusters = free clusters / 2
 21399 00003398 D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1			; si:dx = modified value of free clusters
 21400                                  
 21401                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21402                                  
 21403                                  	; 03/02/2024
 21404                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7431h
 21405                                  
 21406                                  modify_cluster_count:
 21407 0000339A 09FF                    	or	di,di			; hw of cluster count
 21408 0000339C 75D5                    	jnz	short modify_spc
 21409 0000339E C3                      	retn
 21410                                  
 21411                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 21412                                  
 21413                                  ; write FSINFO sector onto disk
 21414                                  
 21415                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21416                                  ; --------------------------------
 21417                                  ; FAT32 FSInfo Sector Structure
 21418                                  ; --------------------------------
 21419                                  ; ref: Microsoft FAT32 File System Specification (2000)
 21420                                  
 21421                                  struc FSINFO		; Offset ;
 21422 00000000 ????????                .LeadSig:	resb 4	  ; 0		; Value 0x41615252. Lead Signature.
 21423 00000004 <res 1E0h>              .Reserved1:	resb 480  ; 4		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21424 000001E4 ????????                .StrucSig:	resb 4	  ; 484		; Value 0x61417272. Fields Signature.
 21425 000001E8 ????????                .Free_Count:	resb 4	  ; 488		; Last known free cluster count. (*) 
 21426 000001EC ????????                .Nxt_Free:	resb 4	  ; 492		; Start clus for free clus srch. (**)
 21427 000001F0 <res Ch>                .Reserved2:	resb 12	  ; 496		; Reserved. Must be 0. Never be used.
 21428 000001FC ????????                .TrailSig:	resb 4	  ; 508		; Value 0xAA550000. Trail Signature.
 21429                                  .size:
 21430                                  endstruc
 21431                                  
 21432                                  ; (*) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then the free count is unknown
 21433                                  ;     and must be computed.
 21434                                  ; (**) If the value is 0xFFFFFFFF, then free cluster search must be started
 21435                                  ;     from cluster 2.
 21436                                  ; Lead Signature, Fields (Structure) Signature and Trail Signature
 21437                                  ; are used to validate FSInfo sector.
 21438                                  
 21439                                  ; --------------------------------
 21440                                  
 21441                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 21442                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7436h
 21443                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7227h)
 21444                                  
 21445                                  update_fat32_fsinfo:
 21446 0000339F 51                      	push	cx
 21447 000033A0 52                      	push	dx
 21448 000033A1 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21449                                  	;mov	dx,[es:bp+25h]
 21450 000033A3 268B5625                	mov	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FSINFO_SECTOR]
 21451                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],cx
 21452 000033A7 26394E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],cx ; 0
 21453                                  				; (16bit FAT size field = 0 for FAT32 fs)
 21454 000033AB 7505                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_1
 21455 000033AD 83FAFF                  	cmp	dx,0FFFFh ; -1
 21456 000033B0 7508                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_2
 21457                                  
 21458                                  u_fat32_inf_1:
 21459 000033B2 5A                      	pop	dx
 21460 000033B3 59                      	pop	cx
 21461                                  	;and	byte [es:bp+18h],0F4h
 21462 000033B4 26806618F4              	and	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],0F4h ; clear bit 0,1 and 3
 21463                                  					; bit 0 - FSINFO update (dirty) bit
 21464                                  					; bit 1 - BPB_RootClus update bit
 21465                                  					; bit 3 - BPB_ExtFlags update bit
 21466 000033B9 C3                      	retn
 21467                                  
 21468                                  u_fat32_inf_2:
 21469 000033BA 50                      	push	ax
 21470 000033BB 53                      	push	bx
 21471 000033BC 57                      	push	di
 21472 000033BD 56                      	push	si
 21473 000033BE 1E                      	push	ds
 21474 000033BF 36803E[7900]00          	cmp	byte [ss:BuffInHMA],0	; is buffers in HMA?
 21475 000033C5 740A                    	jz	short u_fat32_inf_3	; no
 21476 000033C7 36C53E[7A00]            	lds	di,[ss:LoMemBuff]	; read it into scratch buffer
 21477                                  	;sub	di,24
 21478 000033CC 83EF18                  	sub	di,BUFINSIZ		; space for buffer header
 21479                                  					; (buffer header size = 24)
 21480                                  	;clc
 21481 000033CF EB0E                    	jmp	short u_fat32_inf_4
 21482                                  
 21483                                  u_fat32_inf_3:
 21484 000033D1 06                      	push	es
 21485 000033D2 55                      	push	bp
 21486 000033D3 E85231                  	call	GETCURHEAD		; ds:di = first buffer in queue
 21487 000033D6 52                      	push	dx
 21488 000033D7 E8B133                  	call	BUFWRITE		; BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk,
 21489                                  					;  if it's dirty.
 21490 000033DA 5A                      	pop	dx
 21491 000033DB 5D                      	pop	bp
 21492 000033DC 07                      	pop	es
 21493                                  ;u_fat32_inf_4:
 21494 000033DD 726A                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21495                                  u_fat32_inf_4:
 21496 000033DF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21497                                  	;lea	bx,[di+24]
 21498 000033E1 8D5D18                  	lea	bx,[di+BUFINSIZ]	; buffer data address
 21499                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],18h
 21500 000033E4 36C606[4B03]18          	mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 21501 000033EA 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21502 000033EF 41                      	inc	cx			; cx = sector count = 1
 21503                                  					; es:bp = DPB
 21504 000033F0 53                      	push	bx			; ds:bx = buffer (data) address
 21505 000033F1 52                      	push	dx			; HIGH_SECTOR:dx = disk sector address
 21506 000033F2 E8930A                  	call	DREAD		 	; read fs info sector
 21507 000033F5 5A                      	pop	dx
 21508 000033F6 5B                      	pop	bx
 21509 000033F7 7250                    	jc	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21510                                  
 21511                                  	;cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig],5252h	
 21512 000033F9 813F5252                	cmp	word [bx],5252h		; 'RR'
 21513 000033FD 754A                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21514                                  	;cmp	word [bx+2],4161h	; 'aA' ; (NASM syntax)
 21515 000033FF 817F026141              	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.LeadSig+2],4161h
 21516 00003404 7543                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21517                                  	
 21518                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E4h],7272h	; 'rr' at offset 484
 21519 00003406 81BFE4017272            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig],7272h
 21520 0000340C 753B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21521                                  
 21522                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1E6h],6141h	; 'Aa' at offset 486
 21523 0000340E 81BFE6014161            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.StrucSig+2],6141h
 21524 00003414 7533                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21525                                  
 21526                                  	;cmp	word [bx+1FEh],0AA55h	; boot signature at offset 510
 21527 00003416 81BFFE0155AA            	cmp	word [bx+FSINFO.TrailSig+2],0AA55h
 21528 0000341C 752B                    	jne	short u_fat32_inf_5
 21529                                  	
 21530                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+1Fh]
 21531 0000341E 268B461F                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT]
 21532                                  	;mov	[bx+1E8h],ax 
 21533 00003422 8987E801                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count],ax ; at offset 488
 21534                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+21h]
 21535 00003426 268B4621                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT+2]
 21536                                  	;mov	[bx+1EAh],ax
 21537 0000342A 8987EA01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Free_Count+2],ax
 21538                                  
 21539                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+39h]
 21540 0000342E 268B4639                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE]
 21541                                  	;mov	[bx+1ECh],ax
 21542 00003432 8987EC01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free],ax	; at offset 492
 21543                                  	;mov	ax,[es:bp+3Bh]
 21544 00003436 268B463B                	mov	ax,[es:bp+DPB.FAT32_NXTFREE+2]
 21545                                  	;mov	[bx+1EEh],ax
 21546 0000343A 8987EE01                	mov	[bx+FSINFO.Nxt_Free+2],ax
 21547                                  
 21548 0000343E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21549 00003440 36890E[0706]            	mov	[ss:HIGH_SECTOR],cx ; 0
 21550 00003445 41                      	inc	cx	; 1
 21551 00003446 E8A40A                  	call	DWRITE
 21552                                  
 21553                                  u_fat32_inf_5:
 21554 00003449 1F                      	pop	ds
 21555 0000344A 5E                      	pop	si
 21556 0000344B 5F                      	pop	di
 21557 0000344C 5B                      	pop	bx
 21558 0000344D 58                      	pop	ax
 21559 0000344E E961FF                  	jmp	u_fat32_inf_1

 21561                                  ;============================================================================
 21562                                  ; ISEARCH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 21563                                  ;============================================================================
 21564                                  ; 22/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21565                                  
 21566                                  ;	TITLE	DOS_SEARCH - Internal SEARCH calls for MS-DOS
 21567                                  ;	NAME	DOS_SEARCH
 21568                                  
 21569                                  ;**	Low level routines for doing local and NET directory searches
 21570                                  ;
 21571                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21572                                  ;	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT
 21573                                  ;	RENAME_NEXT
 21574                                  ;
 21575                                  ;	Revision history:
 21576                                  ;
 21577                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 21578                                  ;	    A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 21579                                  ;	    A001	PTM 3564 -- search for fastopen
 21580                                  
 21581                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 21582                                  
 21583                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21584                                  ;
 21585                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21586                                  ;
 21587                                  ; Inputs:
 21588                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 21589                                  ;		terminated)
 21590                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 21591                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 21592                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 21593                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 21594                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 21595                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 21596                                  ;	[DMAADD] Points to 53 byte buffer
 21597                                  ; Function:
 21598                                  ;	Initiate a search for the given file spec
 21599                                  ; Outputs:
 21600                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 21601                                  ;	    The 53 bytes ot DMAADD are filled in as follows:
 21602                                  ;
 21603                                  ;	LOCAL
 21604                                  ;	    Drive Byte (A=1, B=2, ...) High bit clear
 21605                                  ;		NEVER STORE DRIVE BYTE AFTER  found_it
 21606                                  ;	    11 byte search name with Meta chars in it
 21607                                  ;	    Search Attribute Byte, attribute of search
 21608                                  ;	    WORD LastEnt value
 21609                                  ;	    WORD DirStart
 21610                                  ;	    4 byte pad
 21611                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21612                                  ;	NET
 21613                                  ;	    21 bytes First byte has high bit set
 21614                                  ;	    32 bytes of the directory entry found
 21615                                  ;
 21616                                  ;	CARRY SET
 21617                                  ;	    AX = error code
 21618                                  ;		error_no_more_files
 21619                                  ;			No match for this file
 21620                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 21621                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 21622                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 21623                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 21624                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 21625                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 21626                                  
 21627                                  ; 03/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 21628                                  ; 24/01/2024
 21629                                  %if 0
 21630                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21631                                  GET_FAST_SEARCH:
 21632                                  	; 22/07/2018
 21633                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21634                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21635                                  	OR	byte [ss:DOS34_FLAG+1],(SEARCH_FASTOPEN>>8)  ; 04h
 21636                                  	;OR	word [ss:DOS34_FLAG],SEARCH_FASTOPEN  ; 400h
 21637                                  					;FO.trigger fastopen ;AN000;
 21638                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21639                                  	;retn
 21640                                  	; 24/01/2024
 21641                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21642                                  	;jmp	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 21643                                  %endif
 21644                                  
 21645                                  	; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 21646                                  	; DOSCODE:6C22h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 21647                                  
 21648                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 21649                                  	; DOSCODE:74E9h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 21650                                  
 21651                                  DOS_SEARCH_FIRST:
 21652                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3 kernel) - Offset 3826h
 21653                                  
 21654 00003451 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 21655 00003455 83FFFF                  	CMP	DI,-1
 21656 00003458 7506                    	JNZ	short TEST_RE_NET2
 21657

 21659                                  ;	transfer NET_SEQ_SEARCH_FIRST
 21660                                  ;ELSE
 21661                                  	;mov	ax,1119h
 21662 0000345A B81911                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|25
 21663 0000345D CD2F                    	INT	2Fh
 21664 0000345F C3                      	retn
 21665                                  ;ENDIF
 21666                                  
 21667                                  TEST_RE_NET2:
 21668                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 21669                                  	; 17/12/2022
 21670                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 21671                                  	; 28/12/2022
 21672 00003460 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8
 21673                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 21674 00003465 7406                    	JZ	short LOCAL_SEARCH_FIRST
 21675                                  
 21676                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 21677                                  ;	transfer NET_SEARCH_FIRST
 21678                                  ;ELSE
 21679                                  	;mov	ax,111Bh
 21680 00003467 B81B11                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|27
 21681 0000346A CD2F                    	INT	2FH
 21682 0000346C C3                      	retn
 21683                                  ;ENDIF
 21684                                  	; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21685                                  LOCAL_SEARCH_FIRST:
 21686 0000346D E828E4                  	call	ECritDisk
 21687                                  
 21688                                  	; 03/03/2025 (miniDOS)
 21689                                  	;; MSDOS 6.0
 21690                                  	;;;test	word [DOS34_FLAG],400h
 21691                                  	;; 17/12/2022
 21692                                  	;;test	byte [DOS34_FLAG+1],04h
 21693                                  	;test	byte [DOS34_FLAG+1],(SEARCH_FASTOPEN>>8)
 21694                                  	;;TEST	word [DOS34_FLAG],SEARCH_FASTOPEN ;AN000;
 21695                                  	;JZ	short NOFN			;AN000;
 21696                                  	;;or	byte [FastOpenFlg],1
 21697                                  	;OR	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set	;AN000;
 21698                                  
 21699                                  NOFN:						;AN000;
 21700 00003470 C606[4C03]01            	MOV	byte [NoSetDir],1	; if we find a dir, don't change to it
 21701                                  
 21702                                  ; 03/02/2024
 21703                                  %if 0
 21704                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21705                                  	CALL	CHECK_QUESTION		;AN000;;FO. is '?' in path
 21706                                  	JNC	short norm_GETPATH	;AN000;;FO. no
 21707                                  %else
 21708                                  	; 03/02/2024
 21709 00003475 16                      	push	ss
 21710 00003476 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;;FO. ds:si -> final path
 21711 00003477 8B36[B205]              	mov	si,[WFP_START]		;AN000;;FO.
 21712                                  getnext:				;AN000;
 21713 0000347B AC                      	lodsb				;AN000;;FO. get char
 21714 0000347C 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000;;FO. is it null

 21728                                  ;_getdone:
 21729 00003487 7312                    	JNC	short find_check_dev

 21732 0000348D 7407                    	JZ	short bad_path3

 21752                                  find_check_dev:
 21753 0000349B 08E4                    	OR	AH,AH
 21754 0000349D 790A                    	JNS	short found_entry
 21755 0000349F C706[4803]FFFF          	MOV	word [LASTENT],-1	; Cause DOS_SEARCH_NEXT to fail
 21756 000034A5 FE06[7005]              	INC	byte [FOUND_DEV]	; Tell DOS_RENAME we found a device
 21757                                  found_entry:
 21758                                  
 21759                                  ; We set the physical drive byte here Instead of after found_it; Doing
 21760                                  ; a search-next may not have wfp_start set correctly
 21761

 22070                                  ;============================================================================
 22071                                  ; ABORT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22072                                  ;============================================================================
 22073                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22074                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22075                                  
 22076                                  ;**
 22077                                  ;
 22078                                  ; Internal Abort call closes all handles and FCBs associated with a process.
 22079                                  ;  If process has NET resources a close all is sent out over the net.
 22080                                  ;
 22081                                  ;   DOS_ABORT
 22082                                  ;
 22083                                  ;   Modification history:
 22084                                  ;
 22085                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 22086                                  ;
 22087                                  ;	M038	SR	10/16/90	Free SFT with the PSP of the process
 22088                                  ;				being terminated only if it is busy.
 22089                                  ;
 22090                                  
 22091                                  ;Break   <DOS_ABORT -- CLOSE all files for process>
 22092                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22093                                  ;
 22094                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ABORT
 22095                                  ;
 22096                                  ; Inputs:
 22097                                  ;       [CurrentPDB] set to PID of process aborting
 22098                                  ; Function:
 22099                                  ;       Close all files and free all SFTs for this PID
 22100                                  ; Returns:
 22101                                  ;       None
 22102                                  ; All destroyed except stack
 22103                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22104                                  
 22105                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22106                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7685h
 22107                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:74F4h) 
 22108                                  
 22109                                  DOS_ABORT:
 22110 000035AA 368E06[3003]            	MOV     ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]	; SS override
 22111 000035AF 268B0E3200              	MOV     CX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]  ; Number of JFNs
 22112                                  reset_free_jfn:
 22113 000035B4 89CB                    	MOV     BX,CX
 22114 000035B6 51                      	PUSH    CX
 22115 000035B7 4B                      	DEC     BX                      ; get jfn (start with last one)
 22116                                  
 22117 000035B8 E8003E                  	CALL	_$CLOSE
 22118 000035BB 59                      	POP     CX
 22119 000035BC E2F6                    	LOOP    reset_free_jfn          ; and do 'em all
 22120                                  
 22121                                  ; Note: We do need to explicitly close FCBs. Reasons are as follows: If we
 22122                                  ; are running in the no-sharing no-network environment, we are simulating the
 22123                                  ; 2.0 world and thus if the user doesn't close the file, that is his problem
 22124                                  ; BUT... the cache remains in a state with garbage that may be reused by the
 22125                                  ; next process. We scan the set and blast the ref counts of the FCBs we own.
 22126                                  ;
 22127                                  ; If sharing is loaded, then the following call to close process will
 22128                                  ; correctly close all FCBs. We will then need to walk the list AFTER here.
 22129                                  ;
 22130                                  ; Finally, the following call to NET_Abort will cause an EOP to be sent to all
 22131                                  ; known network resources. These resources are then responsible for cleaning
 22132                                  ; up after this process.
 22133                                  ;
 22134                                  ; Sleazy, eh?
 22135                                  
 22136                                  	;context DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 22137 000035BE 16                      	push	ss
 22138 000035BF 1F                      	pop	ds  ; 09/09/2018
 22139                                  
 22140                                  	;CallInstall Net_Abort, MultNET, 29
 22141 000035C0 B81D11                  	mov	ax,111Dh
 22142 000035C3 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR 
 22143                                  			;	    - CLOSE ALL REMOTE FILES FOR PROCESS
 22144                                  			; DS???, SS = DOS CS
 22145                                  ;if installed
 22146 000035C5 FF1E[A000]              	call	far [JShare+(4*4)]	; 4 = MFTCloseP
 22147                                  ;else
 22148                                  ;	call 	MFTCloseP
 22149                                  ;endif
 22150                                  
 22151                                  ; Scan the FCB cache for guys that belong to this process and zap their ref
 22152                                  ; counts.
 22153                                  					; SS override
 22154 000035C9 36C43E[4000]            	les     di,[ss:SFTFCB]		; grab the pointer to the table
 22155                                  
 22156                                  	;;;
 22157                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22158                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22159                                  SFTFCB_check:
 22160 000035CE 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 22161 000035D0 09F9                    	or	cx,di
 22162 000035D2 E325                    	jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22163 000035D4 57                      	push	di
 22164                                  SFTFCB_OK:
 22165                                  	;;;
 22166                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 22167 000035D5 268B4D04                	mov     cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]
 22168                                  	;jcxz	FCBScanDone
 22169                                  	; 27/06/2024
 22170                                  	;;;
 22171 000035D9 E315                    	jcxz    SFTFCB_check2	
 22172                                  	;;;
 22173                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 22174 000035DB 8D7D06                  	LEA     DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]	; point at table
 22175 000035DE 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22176                                  FCBTest:
 22177                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22178 000035E2 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax ; is this one of ours
 22179 000035E6 7503                    	jnz	short FCBNext		; no, skip it
 22180                                  
 22181                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22182                                  %if 0
 22183                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22184                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; yes, blast ref count
 22185                                  %else
 22186                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22187                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22188 000035E8 E87A13                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22189                                  %endif
 22190                                  
 22191                                  FCBNext:
 22192 000035EB 83C73B                  	add     di,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59 (for MSDOS 6.0)
 22193 000035EE E2F2                    	loop    FCBTest
 22194                                  
 22195                                  	; 27/06/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 22196                                  	;;;
 22197                                  SFTFCB_check2:
 22198 000035F0 5F                      	pop	di
 22199 000035F1 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di]
 22200 000035F4 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22201 000035F7 75D5                    	jne	short SFTFCB_check
 22202                                  	;;;
 22203                                  
 22204                                  FCBScanDone:
 22205                                  
 22206                                  ; Walk the SFT to eliminate all busy SFT's for this process.
 22207                                  
 22208 000035F9 31DB                    	XOR     BX,BX
 22209                                  Scan:
 22210 000035FB 53                      	push    bx
 22211 000035FC E8383D                  	call	SFFromSFN
 22212 000035FF 5B                      	pop     bx
 22213                                  	;jnc	short Scan1
 22214                                  	;retn
 22215                                  
 22216                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22217                                  	;jc	short NO_Question ; retn
 22218                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22219 00003600 7232                    	jc	short RET2
 22220                                  
 22221                                  ;M038
 22222                                  ; Do what the comment above says, check for busy state
 22223                                  
 22224                                  Scan1:
 22225                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0
 22226                                  	;jz	short scan_next  ; MSDOS 3.3
 22227                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22228 00003602 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1
 22229                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 22230                                  				; Is Sft busy? ;M038
 22231 00003606 7517                    	jnz	short scan_next ; no
 22232                                  ;
 22233                                  ; we have a SFT that is busy. See if it is for the current process
 22234                                  ;
 22235 00003608 36A1[3C03]              	mov     ax,[SS:PROC_ID]		; SS override
 22236                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 22237 0000360C 26394531                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 22238 00003610 750D                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22239 00003612 36A1[3E03]              	mov     ax,[SS:USER_ID]		; SS override
 22240                                  	;sub	ax,[es:di+2Fh] ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 03/02/2024
 22241                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 22242 00003616 2639452F                	cmp	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 22243 0000361A 7503                    	jnz	short scan_next
 22244                                  
 22245                                  ; This SFT is labelled as ours.
 22246                                  
 22247                                  ; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22248                                  %if 0
 22249                                  	mov	word [es:di],0
 22250                                  	;mov	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 22251                                  %else
 22252                                  	; 03/02/2024
 22253                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 22254 0000361C E84613                  	call    SFT_FREE
 22255                                  %endif
 22256                                  
 22257                                  scan_next:
 22258 0000361F 43                      	inc     bx
 22259 00003620 EBD9                    	jmp     short Scan
 22260                                  
 22261                                  ;============================================================================
 22262                                  ; CLOSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 22263                                  ;============================================================================
 22264                                  ; 23/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 22265                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22266                                  
 22267                                  ;**	Internal Close and Commit calls to close a local or NET SFT.
 22268                                  ;
 22269                                  ;	DOS_CLOSE
 22270                                  ;	DOS_COMMIT
 22271                                  ;	FREE_SFT
 22272                                  ;	SetSFTTimes
 22273                                  ;
 22274                                  ;	Revision history:
 22275                                  ;
 22276                                  ;	   AN000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 22277                                  ;	   A005   PTM 3718 --- lost clusters when fastopen installed
 22278                                  ;	   A011   PTM 4766 --- C2 fastopen problem
 22279                                  
 22280                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 22281                                  
 22282                                  ;Break <DOS_CLOSE -- CLOSE FILE from SFT>
 22283                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22284                                  ;
 22285                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_CLOSE
 22286                                  ;
 22287                                  ; Inputs:
 22288                                  ;	[THISSFT] set to the SFT for the file being used
 22289                                  ; Function:
 22290                                  ;	Close the indicated file via the SFT
 22291                                  ; Returns:
 22292                                  ;	sf_ref_count decremented otherwise
 22293                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 22294                                  ;	Carry set if error
 22295                                  ;	    AX has error code
 22296                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 22297                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22298                                  
 22299                                  ;hkn; DOS_CLOSE called from fcbio.asm and handle.asm. DS alreday set up.
 22300                                  
 22301                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22302                                  ; DOSCODE:6E2Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22303                                  
 22304                                  ; 14/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 22305                                  ; DOSCODE:6E1Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 22306                                  
 22307                                  ; 23/07/2018 - IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987 - Offset 39D0h
 22308                                  
 22309                                  	; 03/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22310                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:76FEh
 22311                                  	; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7579h) 
 22312                                  
 22313                                  DOS_CLOSE:
 22314 00003622 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22315                                  	;mov	bx,[ES:DI+5]
 22316 00003626 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22317                                  
 22318                                  ; Network closes are handled entirely by the net code.
 22319                                  
 22320                                  	;;test	bx,8000h
 22321                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet
 22322                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22323                                  	;test	bh,80h
 22324 0000362A F6C780                  	test	bh,(sf_isnet>>8)
 22325 0000362D 7406                    	JZ	short LocalClose
 22326                                  
 22327                                  	;CallInstall Net_Close,MultNET,6
 22328 0000362F B80611                  	mov     ax,1106h
 22329 00003632 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - CLOSE REMOTE FILE
 22330                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22331                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22332                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22333                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22334                                  RET2:		; 03/02/2024
 22335 00003634 C3                      	retn
 22336                                  
 22337                                  ; All closes release the sharing information.
 22338                                  ; No commit releases sharing information
 22339                                  ;
 22340                                  ; All closes decrement the ref count.
 22341                                  ; No commit decrements the ref count.
 22342                                  
 22343                                  LocalClose:
 22344 00003635 E860E2                  	call	ECritDisk
 22345 00003638 E87301                  	CALL	SetSFTTimes
 22346 0000363B E8F600                  	CALL	FREE_SFT		; dec ref count or mark as busy
 22347                                  
 22348                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 22349                                  	;Context DS
 22350 0000363E 16                      	push	ss
 22351 0000363F 1F                      	pop	ds
 22352                                  
 22353 00003640 50                      	push	ax
 22354 00003641 53                      	push	bx
 22355 00003642 E88D4A                  	call	ShareEnd
 22356 00003645 5B                      	pop	bx
 22357 00003646 58                      	pop	ax
 22358                                  
 22359                                  ; Commit enters here. AX from commit MUST be <> 1, BX is flags word
 22360                                  
 22361                                  CloseEntry:
 22362 00003647 50                      	PUSH	AX
 22363                                  
 22364                                  ; File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 22365                                  
 22366                                  	;test	bx,0C0h

 22756                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22757                                  ;
 22758                                  ; Procedure Name : FREE_SFT
 22759                                  ;
 22760                                  ; ES:DI -> SFT. Decs sft_ref_count. If the count goes to 0, mark it as busy.
 22761                                  ; Flags preserved. Return old ref count in AX
 22762                                  ;
 22763                                  ; Note that busy is indicated by the SFT ref count being -1.
 22764                                  ;
 22765                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22766                                  
 22767                                  FREE_SFT:

 22776                                  	;XCHG	AX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 22777 0000373F 9D                      	POPF

 22783                                  ;
 22784                                  ; Procedure Name : DirFromSFT
 22785                                  ;
 22786                                  ;   DirFromSFT - locate a directory entry given an SFT.
 22787                                  ;
 22788                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT

 22794                                  ;		    ES:DI point to entry

 22869                                  ;**	DOS_Commit - UPdate Directory Entries
 22870                                  ;

 22872                                  ;		(DS) = DOSGROUP

 22880

 22884                                  DOS_COMMIT:
 22885                                  	;hkn; called from srvcall. DS already set up.
 22886 0000377F C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 22887                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+5]
 22888 00003783 268B5D05                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 22889                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 22890                                  	; 17/12/2022

 22892                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device ;Clears carry
 22893 0000378A 75F2                    	jnz	short PopDone_retn
 22894                                  	;test	bx,8000h
 22895                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22896                                  	;test	bh,80h

 22898                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_isnet ; 8000h

 22902                                  ;	transfer NET_COMMIT
 22903                                  ;ELSE
 22904                                  	;mov	ax,1107h
 22905 00003791 B80711                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|7
 22906 00003794 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - COMMIT REMOTE FILE
 22907                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 22908                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 22909                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 22910                                  			; CF clear if successful
 22911                                  localcommit_retn: ; 18/12/2022	
 22912 00003796 C3                      	retn
 22913                                  ;ENDIF
 22914                                  
 22915                                  ; Perform local commit operation by doing a close but not releaseing the SFT.
 22916                                  ; There are three ways we can do this. One is to enter a critical section to
 22917                                  ; protect a potential free. The second is to increment the ref count to mask
 22918                                  ; the close decrementing.
 22919                                  ;
 22920                                  ; The proper way is to let the caller's of close decide if a decrement should
 22921                                  ; be done. We do this by providing another entry into close after the
 22922                                  ; decrement and after the share information release.
 22923                                  
 22924                                  ; DOSCODE:6FA0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 22925                                  ; DOSCODE:6F8Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 22926                                  
 22927                                  LOCAL_COMMIT:
 22928 00003797 E8FEE0                  	call	ECritDisk
 22929                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22930 0000379A E8FBE0                  	call	ECritDisk	;PTM.
 22931 0000379D E80E00                  	call	SetSFTTimes
 22932 000037A0 B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 22933 000037A3 E8A1FE                  	call	CloseEntry
 22934                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 22935 000037A6 9C                      	PUSHF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 22936 000037A7 E81617                  	call	DEV_OPEN_SFT	;PTM.  increment device count	;AN000;
 22937 000037AA 9D                      	POPF			;PTM.				;AN000;
 22938                                  	;call	LCritDisk	;PTM.				;AN000;
 22939                                  	; 18/12/2022
 22940 000037AB E917E1                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 22941                                  ;localcommit_retn:
 22942                                  ;	retn

 22944                                  ;Break	<SetSFTTimes - signal a change in the times for an SFT>
 22945                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22946                                  ;
 22947                                  ; Procedure Name : SetSFTTimes
 22948                                  ;
 22949                                  ;   SetSFTTimes - Examine the flags for a SFT and set the time appropriately.
 22950                                  ;   Reflect these times in other SFT's for the same file.
 22951                                  ;
 22952                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 22953                                  ;		BX = sf_flags set appropriately
 22954                                  ;   Outputs:	Set sft times to current time if File & dirty & !nodate
 22955                                  ;   Registers modified: All except ES:DI, BX, AX
 22956                                  ;
 22957                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22958                                  
 22959                                  	; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 22960                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM 
 22961                                  
 22962                                  SetSFTTimes:
 22963                                  
 22964                                  ; 04/02/2024
 22965                                  %if 0
 22966                                  ;	File clean or device does not get stamped nor disk looked at.
 22967                                  	
 22968                                  	;test	bx,0C0h
 22969                                  	; 17/12/2022
 22970                                  	test	bl,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22971                                  	;TEST	BX,devid_file_clean+devid_device
 22972                                  	;retnz				; clean or device => no timestamp
 22973                                  	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 22974                                  
 22975                                  ;	file and dirty. See if date is good
 22976                                  
 22977                                  	;test	bx,4000h
 22978                                  	; 17/12/2022

 22980                                  	test	bh,(sf_close_nodate>>8)
 22981                                  	;TEST	BX,sf_close_nodate
 22982                                  	;retnz				; nodate => no timestamp
 22983                                  	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 22984                                  %else
 22985                                  	; 04/02/2024
 22986                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 22987                                  	;test	bx,40C0h

 22989 000037B2 75E2                    	jnz	short localcommit_retn
 22990                                  %endif
 22991                                  
 22992 000037B4 50                      	push	ax
 22993 000037B5 53                      	push	bx
 22994 000037B6 E898D3                  	call	DATE16			; Date/Time to AX/DX
 22995                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax
 22996 000037B9 2689450F                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_date],AX
 22997                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Dh],dx
 22998 000037BD 2689550D                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_time],DX
 22999 000037C1 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 23000                                  ;if installed
 23001                                  	;call	JShare + 14 * 4
 23002 000037C3 FF1E[C800]              	call	far [JShare+(14*4)]	; 14 = ShSU
 23003                                  ;else
 23004                                  ;	call	ShSU
 23005                                  ;endif
 23006 000037C7 5B                      	pop	bx
 23007 000037C8 58                      	pop	ax

 23032                                  ;BREAK <DOS_MkDir - Make a directory entry>
 23033                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23034                                  ;
 23035                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_MkDir
 23036                                  ;
 23037                                  ; Inputs:
 23038                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 23039                                  ;		terminated)
 23040                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 23041                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 23042                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 23043                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 23044                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 23045                                  ; Function:
 23046                                  ;	Make a new directory
 23047                                  ; Returns:
 23048                                  ;	Carry Clear
 23049                                  ;		No error
 23050                                  ;	Carry Set
 23051                                  ;	    AX is error code
 23052                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 23053                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 23054                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 23055                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 23056                                  ;		error_access_denied
 23057                                  ;			Already exists, device name
 23058                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 23059                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23060                                  
 23061                                  ;hkn; called from path.asm. DS already set up.
 23062                                  
 23063                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23064                                  ; DOSCODE:6FC6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23065                                  
 23066                                  ; 04/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23067                                  ; DOSCODE:78FFh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)

 23079                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 23080                                  			; SDA first filename pointer -> fully-qualified directory name
 23081                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory
 23082                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AX = DOS error code
 23083                                  			; CF clear if successful

 23317                                  ;
 23318                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_ChDir
 23319                                  ;
 23320                                  ; Inputs:

 23322                                  ;		terminated)

 23681                                  ;	TITLE	DISK - Disk utility routines
 23682                                  ;	NAME	Disk
 23683                                  
 23684                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 23685                                  ;
 23686                                  ;	SWAPCON
 23687                                  ;	SWAPBACK
 23688                                  ;	DOS_READ
 23689                                  ;	DOS_WRITE
 23690                                  ;	get_io_sft
 23691                                  ;	DirRead
 23692                                  ;	FIRSTCLUSTER
 23693                                  ;	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 23694                                  ;	FATSecRd
 23695                                  ;	DREAD
 23696                                  ;	CHECK_WRITE_LOCK
 23697                                  ;	CHECK_READ_LOCK
 23698                                  ;
 23699                                  ;	Revision history:
 23700                                  ;
 23701                                  ;		A000   version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 23702                                  ;
 23703                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23704                                  ;
 23705                                  ; M065 : B#5276. On raw read/write of a block of characters if a critical
 23706                                  ;		error happens, DOS retries the entire block assuming that
 23707                                  ;		zero characters were transferred. Modified the code to take
 23708                                  ;		into account the number of characters transfered before
 23709                                  ;		retrying the operation.
 23710                                  ;
 23711                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23712                                  ;
 23713                                  
 23714                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 23715                                  
 23716                                  ;Break	<SwapCon, Swap Back - Old-style I/O to files>
 23717                                  
 23718                                  ; **** Drivers for file input from devices ****
 23719                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23720                                  ;   Indicate that there is no more I/O occurring through another SFT outside
 23721                                  ;   of handles 0 and 1
 23722                                  ;
 23723                                  ;   Inputs:	DS is DOSDATA
 23724                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set to false.
 23725                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 23726                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23727                                  
 23728                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 3CF8h
 23729                                  
 23730                                  ; DOSCODE:71E3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23731                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23732                                  
 23733                                  ; DOSCODE:71CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23734                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23735                                  
 23736                                  SWAPBACK:
 23737 000039F7 C606[5703]00            	MOV	BYTE [CONSWAP],0	; signal no conswaps
 23738 000039FC C3                      	retn
 23739                                  
 23740                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23741                                  ;
 23742                                  ; Procedure Name : SWAPCON
 23743                                  ;
 23744                                  ;   Copy ThisSFT to CONSFT for use by the 1-12 primitives.
 23745                                  ;
 23746                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT as the sft of the desired file
 23747                                  ;		DS is DOSDATA
 23748                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set.  CONSFT = ThisSFT.
 23749                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 23750                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23751                                  
 23752                                  SWAPCON:
 23753                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 23754                                  	;push	es
 23755                                  	;push	di
 23756                                  	;mov	byte [CONSWAP],1
 23757                                  	;les	di,[THISSFT]
 23758                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT],di
 23759                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT+2],es
 23760                                  	;pop	di
 23761                                  	;pop	es
 23762                                  	;retn
 23763                                  
 23764                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 23765 000039FD C606[5703]01            	mov	byte [CONSWAP],1	; ConSwap = TRUE
 23766 00003A02 50                      	push	ax
 23767 00003A03 A1[9E05]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT]
 23768 00003A06 A3[E605]                	mov	[CONSFT],ax
 23769 00003A09 A1[A005]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT+2]
 23770 00003A0C A3[E805]                	mov	[CONSFT+2],ax
 23771 00003A0F 58                      	pop	ax
 23772 00003A10 C3                      	retn

 23774                                  ; DOSCODE:71FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 23775                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23776                                  
 23777                                  ;Break	<DOS_READ -- MAIN READ ROUTINE AND DEVICE IN ROUTINES>
 23778                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23779                                  ;
 23780                                  ; Inputs:
 23781                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 23782                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 23783                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to read
 23784                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 23785                                  ; Function:
 23786                                  ;	Perform read operation
 23787                                  ; Outputs:
 23788                                  ;    Carry clear
 23789                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 23790                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes read
 23791                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 23792                                  ;    Carry set
 23793                                  ;	AX is error code
 23794                                  ;	CX = 0
 23795                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 23796                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 23797                                  ;
 23798                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23799                                  
 23800                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is be set up.
 23801                                  
 23802                                  ; DOSCODE:71E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 23803                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 23804                                  
 23805                                  ; 07/02/2024
 23806                                  ; 06/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 23807                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7B76h
 23808                                  
 23809                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7997h)

 24342                                  ;Break	<DOS_WRITE -- MAIN WRITE ROUTINE AND DEVICE OUT ROUTINES>
 24343                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24344                                  ;
 24345                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_WRITE
 24346                                  ;
 24347                                  ; Inputs:
 24348                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 24349                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 24350                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to write
 24351                                  ; Function:
 24352                                  ;	Perform write operation
 24353                                  ;	NOTE: If CX = 0 on input, file is truncated or grown
 24354                                  ;		to current sf_position
 24355                                  ; Outputs:
 24356                                  ;    Carry clear
 24357                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24358                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes written
 24359                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24360                                  ;    Carry set
 24361                                  ;	AX is error code
 24362                                  ;	CX = 0
 24363                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24364                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24365                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24366                                  	
 24367                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24368                                  ; DOSCODE:742Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24369                                  
 24370                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24371                                  ; DOSCODE:7418h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24372                                  
 24373                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24374                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7D8Fh
 24375                                  
 24376                                  DOS_WRITE:
 24377 00003C12 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24378                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 24379 00003C16 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 24380                                  	;;and	al,0Fh
 24381                                  	;AND	AL,access_mask

 24388                                  BadMode:
 24389 00003C20 E96304                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 24390                                  
 24391                                  ; NOTE: The following check for writting to a Read Only File is performed
 24392                                  ;	    ONLY on FCBs!!!!
 24393                                  ;	We ALLOW writes to Read Only files via handles to allow a CREATE
 24394                                  ;	    of a read only file which can then be written to.
 24395                                  ;	This is OK because we are NOT ALLOWED to OPEN a RO file via handles
 24396                                  ;	    for writting, or RE-CREATE an EXISTING RO file via handles. Thus,
 24397                                  ;	    CREATing a NEW RO file, or RE-CREATing an existing file which
 24398                                  ;	    is NOT RO to be RO, via handles are the only times we can write
 24399                                  ;	    to a read-only file.
 24400                                  
 24401                                  Check_FCB_RO:
 24402                                  	;;test	word [es:di+2],8000h
 24403                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],sf_isFCB
 24404                                  	;JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB
 24405                                  	
 24406                                  	;test	byte [es:di+3],80h

 24408 00003C28 7407                    	JZ	short WRITE_NO_MODE	; Not an FCB
 24409                                  
 24410                                  	;test	byte [es:di+4],1
 24411 00003C2A 26F6450401              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],attr_read_only
 24412 00003C2F 75EF                    	JNZ	short BadMode 		; Can't write to Read_Only files via FCB
 24413                                  WRITE_NO_MODE:

 24415 00003C34 E8FCDB                  	call	IsSFTNet
 24416 00003C37 7406                    	JZ	short LOCAL_WRITE
 24417                                  
 24418                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 24419                                  ;	transfer NET_WRITE
 24420                                  ;ELSE
 24421                                  	;mov	ax,1109h
 24422 00003C39 B80911                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|9
 24423 00003C3C CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - WRITE TO REMOTE FILE
 24424                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 24425                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 24426                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 24427                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes written
 24428 00003C3E C3                      	retn
 24429                                  ;ENDIF

 24671                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24672                                  ;
 24673                                  ; Procedure Name : get_io_sft
 24674                                  ;
 24675                                  ;   Convert JFN number in BX to sf_entry in DS:SI We get the normal SFT if
 24676                                  ;   CONSWAP is FALSE or if the handle desired is 2 or more. Otherwise, we
 24677                                  ;   retrieve the sft from ConSFT which is set by SwapCon.
 24678                                  ;
 24679                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24680                                  
 24681                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24682                                  ; DOSCODE:7583h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24683                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24684                                  ; DOSCODE:756Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24685                                  
 24686                                  GET_IO_SFT:
 24687                                  	;test	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0FFh
 24688 00003D63 36803E[5703]00          	cmp	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0			;smr;SS Override
 24689 00003D69 7512                    	JNZ	short GetRedir
 24690                                  GetNormal:
 24691 00003D6B 16                      	push	ss
 24692 00003D6C 1F                      	pop	ds
 24693 00003D6D 06                      	PUSH	ES
 24694 00003D6E 57                      	PUSH	DI
 24695 00003D6F E8AF35                  	call	SFFromHandle
 24696 00003D72 7206                    	JC	short RET44P
 24697 00003D74 8CC6                    	MOV	SI,ES
 24698 00003D76 8EDE                    	MOV	DS,SI
 24699 00003D78 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 24700                                  RET44P:
 24701 00003D7A 5F                      	POP	DI
 24702 00003D7B 07                      	POP	ES
 24703 00003D7C C3                      	retn
 24704                                  GetRedir:
 24705 00003D7D 83FB01                  	CMP	BX,1

 24709                                  get_io_sft_retn:

 24712                                  ;Break	<DIRREAD -- READ A DIRECTORY SECTOR>
 24713                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24714                                  ;
 24715                                  ; Procedure Name : DIRREAD
 24716                                  ;
 24717                                  ; Inputs:
 24718                                  ;	AX = Directory block number (relative to first block of directory)
 24719                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 24720                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = First sector of first cluster of directory
 24721                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster
 24722                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 24723                                  ; Function:
 24724                                  ;	Read the directory block into [CURBUF].
 24725                                  ; Outputs:
 24726                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM] = Next cluster (after the one skipped to)
 24727                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] Set
 24728                                  ;	ES:BP unchanged
 24729                                  ;	[CURBUF] Points to Buffer with dir sector
 24730                                  ;	Carry set if error (user said FAIL to I 24)
 24731                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed.
 24732                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24733                                  
 24734                                  ;hkn; called from dir.asm. DS already set up to DOSDATA.
 24735                                  
 24736                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24737                                  
 24738                                  DIRREAD:
 24739                                  
 24740                                  ; Note that ClusFac is the sectors per cluster. This is NOT necessarily
 24741                                  ; the same as what is in the DPB! In the case of the root directory, we have
 24742                                  ; ClusFac = # sectors in the root directory. The root directory is detected
 24743                                  ; by DIRStart = 0.
 24744                                  
 24745 00003D89 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 24746                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 24747 00003D8B 3916[DC0A]              	cmp	[DIRSTART_HW],dx
 24748 00003D8F 7509                    	jnz	short SubDir
 24749                                  	;CMP	word [DIRSTART],0
 24750                                  	; 21/09/2023
 24751 00003D91 3916[C205]              	cmp	[DIRSTART],dx ; 0
 24752 00003D95 7503                    	jnz	short SubDir
 24753 00003D97 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 24754 00003D98 EB0C                    	JMP	short DoRead
 24755                                  
 24756                                  ; Convert the sector number in AX into cluster and sector-within-cluster pair
 24757                                  
 24758                                  SubDir:
 24759 00003D9A 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 24760                                  	;and	dl,[es:bp+4]
 24761 00003D9C 26225604                	AND	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 24762                                  
 24763                                  ;	(DX) = sector-in-cluster
 24764                                  
 24765                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 24766 00003DA0 268A4E05                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 24767 00003DA4 D3E8                    	SHR	AX,CL
 24768                                  
 24769                                  ;	(DX) = position in cluster
 24770                                  ;	(AX) = number of clusters to skip
 24771                                  
 24772                                  DoRead:
 24773 00003DA6 8816[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],DL
 24774 00003DAA 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 24775 00003DAC 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 24776                                  
 24777                                  ;	(CX) = number of clusters to skip.
 24778                                  ;	(AH) = remainder
 24779                                  
 24780                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24781                                  
 24782                                  ; 08/02/2024
 24783                                  %if 0
 24784                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24785                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC+2]	     	  ;>32mb
 24786                                  	;MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	  ;>32mb
 24787                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC]
 24788                                  	;ADD	DL,AH
 24789                                  	;ADC	DH,0
 24790                                  	;ADC	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	  ;>32mb
 24791                                  	; 21/09/2023
 24792                                  	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 24793                                  	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 24794                                  	add	dl,ah
 24795                                  	adc	dh,bl ; 0
 24796                                  	adc	bx,[DIRSEC+2]

 24798

 24800                                  	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 24801                                  	JCXZ	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24802                                  %else

 24809 00003DC2 8B16[BE05]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 24810 00003DC6 00E2                    	add	dl,ah
 24811 00003DC8 80D600                  	adc	dh,0

 24814 00003DD4 891E[DC05]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM],bx
 24815 00003DD8 E339                    	jcxz	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24816                                  %endif
 24817                                  
 24818                                  SKPCLLP:
 24819 00003DDA E87321                  	call	UNPACK
 24820 00003DDD 72A9                    	jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 24821                                  	;;;
 24822                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
