 24978                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24979                                  ;
 24980                                  ; Procedure Name : DREAD
 24981                                  ;
 24982                                  ; Inputs:
 24983                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 24984                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 24985                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	      (LOW)
 24986                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 24987                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 24988                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case call to HARDERR needed
 24989                                  ; Function:
 24990                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk read. If BIOS reports
 24991                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 24992                                  ; Outputs:
 24993                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILED to INT 24)
 24994                                  ; DS,ES:BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 24995                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 25000 00003E8B 7497                    	jz	short dirread_retn	; Carry clear
 25001                                  ;hkn; SS override

 25003 00003E93 E89A00                  	call	HARDERRRW

 25061 00003EAF E9D201                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25062

 25064 00003EB2 51                      	PUSH	CX			;save reg

 25068                                  Not_Truncate:				;

 25074 00003EC3 73ED                    	JNC	short write_cont	;retry

 25125                                  ;	TITLE	DISK2 - Disk utility routines
 25126                                  ;	NAME	Disk2
 25127                                  
 25128                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 25129                                  ;
 25130                                  ;	DskRead
 25131                                  ;	DWRITE
 25132                                  ;	DSKWRITE
 25133                                  ;	HarderrRW
 25134                                  ;	SETUP
 25135                                  ;	BREAKDOWN
 25136                                  ;	READ_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25137                                  ;	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25138                                  ;	DISKREAD
 25139                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25140                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR
 25141                                  ;	SETSFT
 25142                                  ;	SETCLUS
 25143                                  ;	AddRec
 25144                                  ;
 25145                                  ;	Revision history:
 25146                                  ;
 25147                                  ;		AN000 version 4.00 Jan. 1988
 25148                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk read/write optimization
 25149                                  
 25150                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25151                                  ; DOSCODE:7699h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 25152                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 25153                                  ; DOSCODE:7685h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 25154                                  
 25155                                  ;Break	<DSKREAD -- PHYSICAL DISK READ>
 25156                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25157                                  ;
 25158                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKREAD
 25159                                  ;
 25160                                  ; Inputs:
 25161                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25162                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25163                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25164                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25165                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25166                                  ; Function:
 25167                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25168                                  ; Outputs:
 25169                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25170                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25171                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25172                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25173                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 25174                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 25175                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25176                                  
 25177                                  DSKREAD:
 25178 00003EDD 51                      	PUSH	CX
 25179                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 25180 00003EDE 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 25181                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 25182 00003EE2 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 25183 00003EE6 53                      	PUSH	BX
 25184 00003EE7 06                      	PUSH	ES
 25185 00003EE8 E8D710                  	call	SETREAD
 25186 00003EEB EB22                    	JMP	short DODSKOP
 25187                                  
 25188                                  ;Break	<DWRITE -- SEE ABOUT WRITING>
 25189                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25190                                  ;
 25191                                  ; Procedure Name : DWRITE
 25192                                  ;
 25193                                  ; Inputs:
 25194                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 25195                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25196                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25197                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25198                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25199                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case HARDERR called
 25200                                  ; Function:
 25201                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk write. If BIOS reports
 25202                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 25203                                  ; Output:
 25204                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently, user FAILed to I 24)
 25205                                  ; BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 25206                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25207                                  
 25208                                  	;entry	DWRITE
 25209                                  DWRITE:
 25210 00003EED E81100                  	CALL	DSKWRITE
 25211 00003EF0 74EA                    	jz	short dw_ret_label	; Carry clear (retz)
 25212                                  
 25213                                  ;hkn; SS override
 25214 00003EF2 36C606[7505]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],1	; Write
 25215 00003EF8 E83500                  	call	HARDERRRW
 25216 00003EFB 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1			; Check for retry
 25217 00003EFD 74EE                    	JZ	short DWRITE
 25218                                  
 25219                                  ; 09/02/2024
 25220                                  %if 0
 25221                                  	CMP	AL,3			; Check for FAIL
 25222                                  	CLC
 25223                                  	JNZ	short NO_CAR2 		; Ignore
 25224                                  	STC
 25225                                  NO_CAR2:
 25226                                  dw_ret_label:
 25227                                  	retn
 25228                                  %else
 25229                                  	; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 25230 00003EFF EB99                    	jmp	short fail_ignore
 25231                                  %endif
 25232                                  
 25233                                  ;Break	<DSKWRITE -- PHYSICAL DISK WRITE>
 25234                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25235                                  ;
 25236                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKWRITE
 25237                                  ;
 25238                                  ; Inputs:
 25239                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25240                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25241                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25242                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25243                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25244                                  ; Function:
 25245                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25246                                  ; Outputs:
 25247                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25248                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25249                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25250                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25251                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)

 25347                                  ;Break	<SETUP -- SETUP A DISK READ OR WRITE FROM USER>
 25348                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25349                                  ;
 25350                                  ; Procedure Name : SETUP
 25351                                  ;
 25352                                  ; Inputs:
 25353                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT (value also in THISSFT)
 25354                                  ;	DMAAdd contains transfer address
 25355                                  ;	CX = Byte count
 25356                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 25357                                  ;   WARNING Stack must be clean, two ret addrs on stack, 1st of caller,
 25358                                  ;		2nd of caller of caller.
 25359                                  ; Outputs:
 25360                                  ;	    CX = byte count
 25361                                  ;	    [THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters if file
 25362                                  ;		      = Pointer to device header if device or NET
 25363                                  ;	    ES:DI Points to SFT
 25364                                  ;	    [NEXTADD] = Displacement of disk transfer within segment
 25365                                  ;	    [TRANS] = 0 (No transfers yet)
 25366                                  ;	    BytPos = Byte position in file
 25367                                  ;
 25368                                  ;	The following fields are relevant to local files (not devices) only:
 25369                                  ;
 25370                                  ;	    SecPos = Position of first sector (local files only)
 25371                                  ;	    [BYTSECPOS] = Byte position in first sector (local files only)
 25372                                  ;	    [CLUSNUM] = First cluster (local files only)
 25373                                  ;	    [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector within first cluster (local files only)
 25374                                  ;	    [THISDRV] = Physical unit number (local files only)
 25375                                  ;
 25376                                  ;      RETURNS ONE LEVEL UP WITH:
 25377                                  ;	   CX = 0
 25378                                  ;	   CARRY = Clear
 25379                                  ;	IF AN ERROR IS DETECTED
 25380                                  ; All other registers destroyed
 25381                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25382                                  
 25383                                  ;hkn; called from disk.asm. DS has been set up to DOSDATA.
 25384

 26108                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 26109                                  ;Break   <DskRdBufScan -- Disk Read Buffer Scan>
 26110                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26111                                  ;
 26112                                  ; Procedure Name : DskRdBufScan
 26113                                  ;
 26114                                  ; Inputs:
 26115                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
 26116                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 26117                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 26118                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
 26119                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 26120                                  ;
 26121                                  ; Function:
 26122                                  ;	The Buffer Queue is scanned: the contents of any dirty buffers are
 26123                                  ;	"read" into the transfer memory block, so that the transfer memory
 26124                                  ;	reflects the most recent data.
 26125                                  ;
 26126                                  ; Outputs:
 26127                                  ;       Transfer memory updated as required.
 26128                                  ;
 26129                                  ; Uses:
 26130                                  ;       DS,AX,BX,CX,SI,DI destroyed.
 26131                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 26132                                  ;
 26133                                  ; Notes:
 26134                                  ;       FIRST_BUFF_ADDR is set-up to contain the LAST buffer to check, rather
 26135                                  ;	than the FIRST.
 26136                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26137                                  ;M039: Created
 26138                                  
 26139                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26140                                  ; DOSCODE:78F0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 26141                                  
 26142                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26143                                  ; DOSCODE:78DCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 26144                                  
 26145                                  ; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26146                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8313h
 26147                                  
 26148                                  ;procedure DskRdBufScan,NEAR
 26149                                  ;
 26150                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 26151                                  
 26152                                  DskRdBufScan:
 26153 0000416F 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0 ; Any dirty buffers?
 26154 00004175 743C                    	je	short bufx		     ; -no, skip all work.
 26155                                  
 26156 00004177 368B1E[0706]            	mov     bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 26157 0000417C 89DE                    	mov     si,bx
 26158 0000417E 01D1                    	add     cx,dx
 26159 00004180 83D600                  	adc     si,0
 26160                                  
 26161 00004183 E8A223                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> 1st buf in queue.
 26162                                  	;mov	ax,[di+2]
 26163 00004186 8B4502                  	mov     ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]
 26164 00004189 36A3[1711]              	mov     [ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],ax
 26165                                  		
 26166                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 26167                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 26168                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 26169                                  	; 15/12/2022
 26170 0000418D 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 26171                                  
 26172                                  ;       BX:DX = Extent start.
 26173                                  ;       SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 26174                                  ;          AL = Drive #.
 26175                                  ;       DS:DI-> 1st buffer in queue.
 26176                                  ;[FIRST_BUFF_ADDR] = Address offset of last buffer in queue.
 26177                                  
 26178                                  bufq:	
 26179                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 26180 00004191 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 26181 00004194 7514                    	jne	short bufq1        	;  -no, jump.
 26182                                  
 26183                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26184                                  ;       ja	short bufq1		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 26185                                  
 26186                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 26187 00004196 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26188 00004199 7503                    	jne	short bufq01
 26189                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 26190 0000419B 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 26191                                  bufq01:
 26192 0000419E 770A                    	ja	short bufq1
 26193                                  
 26194                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26195                                  ;       ja	short bufq2		;Jump if Extent end >= buffer sector.
 26196                                  
 26197                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 26198 000041A0 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26199 000041A3 7503                    	jne	short bufq02
 26200                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 26201 000041A5 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 26202                                  bufq02:
 26203 000041A8 770A                    	ja	short bufq2
 26204                                  bufq1:	
 26205 000041AA 363B3E[1711]            	cmp     di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 26206 000041AF 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 26207                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ; Set-up for next buffer.
 26208 000041B1 75DE                    	jne	short bufq		; -no, do next buffer

 27312                                  ;Break   <DskWrtBufPurge -- Disk Write Buffer Purge>
 27313                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27314                                  ;
 27315                                  ; Procedure Name : DskWrtBufPurge
 27316                                  ;
 27317                                  ; Inputs:
 27318                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
 27319                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 27320                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 27321                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 27322                                  ;
 27323                                  ; Function:
 27324                                  ;       Purge the Buffer Queue and the Secondary Cache of any buffers which
 27325                                  ;	are in Extent; they are being over-written.
 27326                                  ;
 27327                                  ; Outputs:
 27328                                  ;       (Same as Input.)
 27329                                  ; Uses:
 27330                                  ;       All registers except DS,AX,SI,DI preserved.
 27331                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 27332                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27333                                  ;M039: Created
 27334                                  
 27335                                  ;procedure   DskWrtBufPurge,NEAR
 27336                                  ;
 27337                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 27338                                  
 27339                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27340                                  ; DOSCODE:7C0Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27341                                  
 27342                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27343                                  ; DOSCODE:7BD4h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27344                                  
 27345                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27346                                  ; DOSCODE:8714h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27347                                  
 27348                                  ; NOTE: Secondary (Buffer) Cache is not used in PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27349                                  
 27350                                  ; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:BB93h)
 27351                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - DOSCODE:7C0Eh)
 27352                                  
 27353                                  DskWrtBufPurge:
 27354                                  	;SaveReg <bx,cx>
 27355 0000453F 53                      	push	bx
 27356 00004540 51                      	push	cx
 27357                                  
 27358 00004541 368B1E[0706]            	mov	bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]	;BX:DX = Extent start (sector #).
 27359 00004546 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 27360 00004548 01D1                    	add	cx,dx
 27361 0000454A 83D600                  	adc	si,0                    ;SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27362                                  
 27363                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27364                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 27365                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 27366                                  	; 15/12/2022
 27367 0000454D 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 27368                                  
 27369                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27370                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27371                                  %if 0
 27372                                  
 27373                                  ;	BX:DX = Extent start.
 27374                                  ;	SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27375                                  ;	AL = Drive #
 27376                                  
 27377                                  	cmp	word [ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT],0 ;Secondary cache in-use?
 27378                                  	je	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27379                                  
 27380                                  ;	If any of the sectors to be written are in the secondary cache (SC),
 27381                                  ;	invalidate the entire SC. (This is an optimization; we really only
 27382                                  ;	need to invalidate those sectors which intersect, but that's slower.)
 27383                                  
 27384                                  	cmp	al,[ss:CurSC_DRIVE]	;Same drive?
 27385                                  	jne	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27386                                  
 27387                                  	push    ax
 27388                                  	mov     ax,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR]
 27389                                  	mov     di,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR+2]	;DI:AX = SC start.
 27390                                  
 27391                                  	;Cmp32	si,cx,di,ax		;Extent end < SC start?
 27392                                  	;jbe	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27393                                  
 27394                                  	cmp	si,di
 27395                                  	jne	short sc01
 27396                                  	cmp	cx,ax
 27397                                  sc01: 
 27398                                  	jbe	short sc5
 27399                                  
 27400                                  	add	ax,[ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT]
 27401                                  	adc	di,0                    ;DI:AX = SC end + 1.
 27402                                  	
 27403                                  	;Cmp32	bx,dx,di,ax             ;Extent start > SC end?
 27404                                  	;jae	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27405                                  
 27406                                  	cmp	bx,di
 27407                                  	jne	short sc02
 27408                                  	cmp	dx,ax
 27409                                  sc02:
 27410                                  	jnb	short sc5
 27411                                  
 27412                                  	mov	word [ss:SC_STATUS],0	;Extent intersects SC: invalidate SC.
 27413                                  sc5:	
 27414                                  	pop     ax
 27415                                  
 27416                                  %endif
 27417                                  
 27418                                  ;	Free any buffered sectors which are in Extent; they are being over-
 27419                                  ;	written.
 27420                                  
 27421                                  nosc:	
 27422 00004551 E8D41F                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> first buffer in queue.
 27423                                  
 27424                                  _bufq:	
 27425                                  	;cmpo	al,[di+4]
 27426 00004554 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 27427 00004557 7527                    	jne	short bufq5		; -no, jump.
 27428                                  
 27429                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27430                                  ;       ja	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 27431                                  
 27432                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 27433 00004559 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27434 0000455C 7503                    	jne	short bufq04
 27435                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 27436 0000455E 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27437                                  bufq04:
 27438 00004561 771D                    	ja	short bufq5
 27439                                  
 27440                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27441                                  ;       jbe	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent end < buffer sector.
 27442                                  
 27443                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 27444 00004563 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27445 00004566 7503                    	jne	short bufq05
 27446                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 27447 00004568 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27448                                  bufq05:
 27449 0000456B 7613                    	jbe	short bufq5
 27450                                  
 27451                                  ;	Buffer's sector is in Extent, so free it; it is being over-written.
 27452                                  
 27453                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 27454 0000456D F6450540                	test	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ;Buffer dirty?
 27455 00004571 7403                    	jz	short bufq4		; -no, jump.
 27456 00004573 E8C922                  	call	DEC_DIRTY_COUNT		; -yes, decrement dirty count.
 27457                                  bufq4:
 27458                                  	;mov	word [di+4],20FFh
 27459 00004576 C74504FF20              	mov     word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],((buf_visit<<8)|0FFh)
 27460                                  
 27461 0000457B E8BC1F                  	call	SCANPLACE
 27462 0000457E EB02                    	jmp     short bufq6
 27463                                  bufq5: 
 27464 00004580 8B3D                    	mov     di,[di]
 27465                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 27466                                  bufq6: 
 27467 00004582 363B3E[1711]            	cmp	di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 27468 00004587 75CB                    	jne	short _bufq		; --no, go do next buffer.
 27469                                  	
 27470                                  	;RestoreReg <cx,bx>
 27471 00004589 59                      	pop	cx
 27472 0000458A 5B                      	pop	bx
 27473 0000458B C3                      	retn
 27474                                  
 27475                                  ;EndProc DskWrtBufPurge
 27476                                  
 27477                                  ;Break   <DIV32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT DIVIDE>
 27478                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27479                                  ;
 27480                                  ; Procedure Name : DIV32
 27481                                  ;
 27482                                  ; Inputs:
 27483                                  ;       DX:AX = 32 bit dividend   BX= divisor
 27484                                  ; Function:
 27485                                  ;       Perform 32 bit division:  DX:AX/BX = CX:AX + DX (rem.)
 27486                                  ; Outputs:
 27487                                  ;       CX:AX = quotient , DX= remainder
 27488                                  ; Uses:
 27489                                  ;       All registers except AX,CX,DX preserved.
 27490                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27491                                  ;M039: DIV32 optimized for divisor of 512 (common sector size).
 27492                                  
 27493                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27494                                  ; DOSCODE:7C94h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27495                                  
 27496                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27497                                  ; DOSCODE:7C5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27498                                  
 27499                                  DIV32:
 27500 0000458C 81FB0002                	cmp	bx,512
 27501 00004590 7515                    	jne	short div5
 27502                                  
 27503 00004592 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 27504 00004594 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax           ; CX:AX = Dividend
 27505 00004596 81E2FF01                	and	dx,(512-1)      ; DX = Remainder
 27506 0000459A 88E0                    	mov	al,ah
 27507 0000459C 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 27508 0000459E 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch
 27509 000045A0 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 27510 000045A2 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 27511 000045A4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 27512 000045A6 C3                      	retn
 27513                                  div5:	
 27514 000045A7 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 27515 000045A9 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 27516 000045AB 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27517 000045AD F7F3                    	div	bx              ; 0:AX/BX
 27518 000045AF 91                      	xchg	cx,ax
 27519 000045B0 F7F3                    	div	bx              ; DX:AX/BX
 27520 000045B2 C3                      	retn
 27521                                  
 27522                                  ;Break   <SHR32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT SHIFT RIGHT>
 27523                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27524                                  ;
 27525                                  ; Procedure Name : SHR32
 27526                                  ;
 27527                                  ; Inputs:
 27528                                  ;	DX:AX = 32 bit sector number
 27529                                  ; Function:
 27530                                  ;       Perform 32 bit shift right
 27531                                  ; Outputs:
 27532                                  ;	AX = cluster number
 27533                                  ;	ZF = 1 if no error
 27534                                  ;	   = 0 if error (cluster number > 64k)
 27535                                  ; Uses:
 27536                                  ;       DX,CX
 27537                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27538                                  ; M017	- SHR32 rewritten for better performance
 27539                                  ; M039	- Additional optimization
 27540                                  
 27541                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27542                                  ; DOSCODE:7CBBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27543                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27544                                  ; DOSCODE:7C81h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27545                                  
 27546                                  SHR32:
 27547                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 27548 000045B3 268A4E05                	mov	cl,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 27549 000045B7 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch	    ;ZF=1
 27550 000045B9 E306                    	jcxz	norota
 27551                                  rotashft2:
 27552 000045BB D1EA                    	shr	dx,1	    ;ZF reflects state of DX.
 27553 000045BD D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1	    ;ZF not affected.
 27554 000045BF E2FA                    	loop	rotashft2
 27555                                  norota:
 27556 000045C1 C3                      	retn
 27557                                  
 27558                                  ;============================================================================
 27559                                  ; DIR.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 27560                                  ;============================================================================
 27561                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27562                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27563                                  
 27564                                  ;	TITLE	DIR - Directory and path cracking
 27565                                  ;	NAME	Dir
 27566                                  
 27567                                  ;Break	<FINDENTRY -- LOOK FOR AN ENTRY>
 27568                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27569                                  ;
 27570                                  ; Procedure Name : FINDENTRY,SEARCH
 27571                                  ;
 27572                                  ; Inputs:
 27573                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 27574                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 27575                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Starting directory sector number
 27576                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster of directory
 27577                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 27578                                  ;	[NAME1] = Name to look for
 27579                                  ; Function:
 27580                                  ;	Find file name in disk directory.
 27581                                  ;	"?" matches any character.
 27582                                  ; Outputs:
 27583                                  ;	Carry set if name not found
 27584                                  ;	ELSE
 27585                                  ;	Zero set if attributes match (always except when creating)
 27586                                  ;	AH = Device ID (bit 7 set if not disk)
 27587                                  ;	[THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters
 27588                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 27589                                  ;	ES = DOSGROUP
 27590                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer into directory buffer
 27591                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI = Pointer to First Cluster field in directory entry
 27592                                  ;	[CURBUF] has directory record with match
 27593                                  ;	[NAME1] has file name
 27594                                  ;	[LASTENT] is entry number of the entry
 27595                                  ; All other registers destroyed.
 27596                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27597                                  
 27598                                  ;hkn; called from rename.asm and dir2.asm. DS must be already set up at
 27599                                  ;hkn; this point.
 27600                                  
 27601                                  SEARCH:
 27602                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27603                                  	; DOSCODE:7C90h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27604                                  
 27605                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27606                                  	; DOSCODE:7CCAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27607                                  
 27608                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27609                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 45B3h
 27610                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 27611                                  
 27612                                  	; 24/01/2024
 27613                                  
 27614                                  	; 13/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27615                                  	; DOSCODE:8797h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27616                                  
 27617                                  	;entry	FindEntry
 27618                                  FINDENTRY:
 27619 000045C2 E8DE05                  	call	STARTSRCH
 27620 000045C5 A0[6B05]                	MOV	AL,[ATTRIB]
 27621                                  	;and	al,9Eh
 27622 000045C8 24DE                    	AND	AL,~attr_ignore		; Ignore useless bits
 27623                                  	;cmp	al,8
 27624 000045CA 3C08                    	CMP	AL,attr_volume_id	; Looking for vol ID only ?
 27625 000045CC 7503                    	JNZ	short NOTVOLSRCH	; No
 27626 000045CE E83402                  	CALL	SETROOTSRCH		; Yes force search of root
 27627                                  NOTVOLSRCH:
 27628 000045D1 E84C01                  	CALL	GETENTRY
 27629                                  	;JNC	short SRCH
 27630                                  	;JMP	SETESRET
 27631                                  	; 24/01/2024
 27632 000045D4 724F                    	jc	short SETESRET
 27633                                  
 27634                                  	;entry	Srch
 27635                                  SRCH:
 27636                                  	;;;
 27637                                  	; 13/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27638 000045D6 C706[A50A]0000          	mov     word [LNE_COUNT],0	; reset long name entry count
 27639                                  SRCH2:
 27640                                  	;;;

 27749                                  ; ATTRIB	Action

 27752                                  ; Otherwise	If no create then Is ATTRIB+extra superset of test?
 27753                                  ;		If create then Is ATTRIB equal to test?

 27801                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27802                                  ;
 27803                                  ; Procedure Name : MetaCompare
 27804                                  ;
 27805                                  ; Inputs:
 27806                                  ;	DS:SI -> 11 character FCB style name NO '?'
 27807                                  ;	    Typically this is a directory entry. It MUST be in upper case
 27808                                  ;	ES:DI -> 11 character FCB style name with possible '?'
 27809                                  ;	    Typically this is a FCB or SFT. It MUST be in upper case
 27810                                  ; Function:
 27811                                  ;	Compare FCB style names allowing for ? match to any char
 27812                                  ; Outputs:
 27813                                  ;	Zero if match else NZ
 27814                                  ; Destroys CX,SI,DI all others preserved
 27815                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27816                                  
 27817                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27818                                  	; DOSCODE:7D3Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27819                                  
 27820                                  MetaCompare:
 27821 0000469A B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11
 27822                                  WILDCRD:
 27823 0000469D F3A6                    	REPE	CMPSB
 27824 0000469F 7407                    	JZ	short MetaRet 		; most of the time we will fail.
 27825                                  CHECK_META:
 27826 000046A1 26807DFF3F              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1],"?"
 27827 000046A6 74F5                    	JZ	short WILDCRD
 27828                                  MetaRet:
 27829 000046A8 C3                       	retn				; Zero set, Match
 27830                                  
 27831                                  ;Break	<NEXTENTRY -- STEP THROUGH DIRECTORY>

 27834                                  ; Procedure Name : NEXTENTRY

 27840                                  ;	Carry set if no more.

 27843                                  NEXTENTRY:
 27844                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27845                                  	; DOSCODE:7D4Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27846                                  
 27847                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27848                                  	; DOSCODE:7D88h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27849                                  
 27850                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27851                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 4671h 
 27852                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 27853                                  
 27854                                  	; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27855                                  	; DOSCODE:8884h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27856                                  
 27857 000046A9 A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 27858 000046AC 3B06[DA05]              	CMP	AX,[ENTLAST]
 27859 000046B0 741C                    	JZ	short NONE

 27861                                  	;ADD	BX,32
 27862 000046B3 8D5F20                  	LEA	BX,[BX+32]
 27863 000046B6 39D3                    	CMP	BX,DX
 27864                                  	; 21/11/2022 - MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS (DOSCODE:7D5Dh)
 27865                                  	;JB	short HAVIT ; MSDOS 6.0 src (dir.asm)
 27866                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27867 000046B8 7540                    	jne	short HAVIT ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:7D97h)
 27868                                  
 27869                                  	;;;
 27870                                  	; 14/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27871 000046BA 833E[C205]00            	cmp	word [DIRSTART],0
 27872 000046BF 750F                    	jnz	short nextentry_cont
 27873 000046C1 833E[DC0A]00            	cmp	word [DIRSTART_HW],0
 27874 000046C6 7508                    	jnz	short nextentry_cont
 27875                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:bp+9]
 27876 000046C8 263B4609                	cmp	ax,[es:bp+DPB.ROOT_ENTRIES] ; Number of root dir entries
 27877                                  	;jnb	short NONE
 27878                                  	;jmp	short GETENT
 27879 000046CC 7255                    	jb	short GETENT
 27880                                  NONE:		; 14/02/2024
 27881 000046CE F9                      	stc
 27882 000046CF C3                      	retn
 27883                                  	
 27884                                  nextentry_cont:
 27885                                  	;;;
 27886                                  
 27887 000046D0 8A1E[7305]              	MOV	BL,[SECCLUSPOS]
 27888 000046D4 FEC3                    	INC	BL
 27889 000046D6 3A1E[7705]              	CMP	BL,[CLUSFAC]
 27890 000046DA 7223                    	JB	short SAMECLUS
 27891                                  	;;;
 27892                                  	; 14/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27893 000046DC 8B1E[E00A]              	mov	bx,[NXTCLUSNUM_HW]
 27894 000046E0 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 27895                                  	;;;

 27902 000046F2 752F                    	jnz	short GETENT
 27903                                  	;;;
 27904                                  	; 23/07/2019

 27906                                  	;JB	short NONE
 27907                                  	;JMP	short GETENT
 27908                                  	; 16/12/2022
 27909 000046F7 732A                    	jnb	short GETENT
 27910                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27911                                  	;JB	short NONE
 27912                                  	;JMP	short GETENT
 27913                                  	; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27914                                  ;NONE:
 27915                                  	;STC
 27916 000046F9 C3                      	retn
 27917                                  HAVIT:

 27920                                  nextentry_retn:

 27923                                  SAMECLUS:

 27974                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27975                                  ;
 27976                                  ; Procedure Name : GETENTRY
 27977                                  ;
 27978                                  ; Inputs:
 27979                                  ;	[LASTENT] has directory entry
 27980                                  ;	ES:BP points to drive parameters
 27981                                  ;	[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[ENTLAST] set for DIR involved
 27982                                  ; Function:
 27983                                  ;	Locates directory entry in preparation for search
 27984                                  ;	GETENT provides entry for passing desired entry in AX
 27985                                  ; Outputs:
 27986                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer to next directory entry in CURBUF
 27987                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:DX = Pointer to first byte after end of CURBUF
 27988                                  ;	[LASTENT] = New directory entry number
 27989                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS] set via DIRREAD
 27990                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 27991                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27992                                  
 27993                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27994                                  GETENTRY:
 27995                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27996 00004720 A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 27997                                  
 27998                                  	;entry	GETENT
 27999                                  GETENT:
 28000 00004723 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 28001                                  ;
 28002                                  ; Convert the entry number in AX into a byte offset from the beginning of the
 28003                                  ; directory.
 28004                                  ;
 28005 00004726 B105                    	mov	cl,5			; shift left by 5 = mult by 32
 28006 00004728 D3C0                    	rol	ax,cl			; keep hight order bits
 28007 0000472A 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 28008                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28009                                  	;and	ax,0FFE0h
 28010                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28011                                  	;and	ax,~(32-1)		; mask off high order bits
 28012                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28013 0000472C 24E0                    	and	al,0E0h ; ~31
 28014 0000472E 83E21F                  	and	dx,1Fh
 28015                                  	;and	dx,32-1			; mask off low order bits
 28016                                  ;
 28017                                  ; DX:AX contain the byte offset of the required directory entry from the
 28018                                  ; beginning of the directory. Convert this to a sector number. Round the
 28019                                  ; sector size down to a multiple of 32.
 28020                                  ;
 28021                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+2]
 28022 00004731 268B5E02                	MOV	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 28023 00004735 80E3E0                  	and	bl,0E0h
 28024                                  	;AND	BL,255-31		; Must be multiple of 32
 28025 00004738 F7F3                    	DIV	BX
 28026                                  	; 14/02/2024
 28027                                  	;MOV	BX,DX			; Position within sector
 28028                                  				; NOTE: This BX value is not used in DIRREAD
 28029                                  				; Erdogan Tan - 14/02/2024
 28030                                  	;PUSH	BX
 28031 0000473A 52                      	push	dx
 28032                                  	;
 28033 0000473B E84BF6                  	call	DIRREAD
 28034 0000473E 5B                      	POP	BX
 28035                                  	;retc
 28036 0000473F 72BD                    	jc	short nextentry_retn
 28037                                  SETENTRY:
 28038 00004741 8B16[E205]              	MOV	DX,[CURBUF]
 28039                                  	;;;add	dx,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28040                                  	;;add	dx,20 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 28041                                  	;add	dx,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 14/02/2024	
 28042 00004745 83C218                  	ADD	DX,BUFINSIZ
 28043 00004748 01D3                    	ADD	BX,DX
 28044                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+2]
 28045 0000474A 26035602                	ADD	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]  ; Always clears carry
 28046                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28047                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS contains a 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:7E15h
 28048                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28049                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM contains 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:8931h
 28050 0000474E F8                      	clc
 28051 0000474F C3                      	retn
 28052                                  
 28053                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28054                                  
 28055                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28056                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8933h
 28057                                  
 28058                                  sft_fcb_table:
 28059 00004750 00<rep 14h>             	times 20 db 0
 28060                                  sftfcb.cluster:
 28061 00004764 00000000                	dd	0
 28062                                  sftfcb.direntry:
 28063 00004768 0000                    	dw	0
 28064                                  sftfcb_entry_size equ $ - sftfcb.cluster ; = 6
 28065                                  
 28066 0000476A 00<rep 72h>             	times 114 db 0	; 6*20 = 120 ; entry size = 6 bytes 
 28067                                  
 28068                                  SRCH_CLUSTER:
 28069 000047DC 0000                    	dw	0
 28070                                  SRCH_CLUSTER_HW:
 28071 000047DE 0000                    	dw	0
 28072                                  
 28073                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28074                                  
 28075                                  ;Break	<SETDIRSRCH SETROOTSRCH -- Set Search environments>
 28076                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28077                                  ;
 28078                                  ; Procedure Name : SETDIRSRCH,SETROOTSRCH
 28079                                  ;
 28080                                  ; Inputs:
 28081                                  ;	BX cluster number of start of directory
 28082                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28083                                  ;	DI next cluster number from fastopen extended info. DOS 3.3 only
 28084                                  ; Function:
 28085                                  ;	Set up a directory search
 28086                                  ; Outputs:
 28087                                  ;	[DIRSTART] = BX
 28088                                  ;	[CLUSFAC],[CLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC] set
 28089                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28090                                  ; destroys AX,DX,BX
 28091                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28092                                  
 28093                                  	;;;
 28094                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28095                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:89C3h
 28096                                  	;;;
 28097                                  SETDIRSRCH:
 28098 000047E0 A1[EE0A]                	mov	ax,[ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28099                                  	;cmp	word [ROOTCLUST_HW],0
 28100 000047E3 21C0                    	and	ax,ax	
 28101 000047E5 7504                    	jnz	short SETDIRSRCH_FAT32
 28102                                  	
 28103 000047E7 09DB                    	or	bx,bx
 28104                                  	;jz	short SETROOTSRCH
 28105 000047E9 741C                    	jz	short SETROOTSRCH2 ; ax = 0
 28106                                  SETDIRSRCH_FAT32:
 28107                                  	;mov	ax,[ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28108 000047EB A3[DC0A]                	mov	[DIRSTART_HW],ax
 28109 000047EE A3[E80A]                	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],ax
 28110                                  
 28111 000047F1 891E[C205]              	mov	[DIRSTART],bx
 28112                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 28113 000047F5 268A4604                	mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 28114                                  	;inc	al
 28115 000047F9 40                      	inc	ax
 28116 000047FA A2[7705]                	mov	[CLUSFAC],al
 28117                                  
 28118 000047FD 56                      	push	si
 28119

 28346 00004909 07                      	pop	es

 28450                                  ;============================================================================
 28451                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28452                                  ;============================================================================
 28453                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28454                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28455                                  ; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28456                                  
 28457                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 28458                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 28459                                  
 28460                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 28461                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28462                                  ;
 28463                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 28464                                  ;
 28465                                  ; Inputs:
 28466                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 28467                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 28468                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28469                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28470                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28471                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28472                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 28473                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28474                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 28475                                  ; Function:
 28476                                  ;	Crack the path
 28477                                  ; Outputs:
 28478                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 28479                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 28480                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28481                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28482                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28483                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28484                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28485                                  ;	   Zero set
 28486                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28487                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28488                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28489                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28490                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28491                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28492                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28493                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28494                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 28495                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28496                                  ;	ELSE
 28497                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 28498                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28499                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28500                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 28501                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28502                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28503                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28504                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28505                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28506                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28507                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28508                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 28509                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28510                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28511                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28512                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28513                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28514                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28515                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28516                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28517                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 28518                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28519                                  
 28520                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 28521                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 28522                                  
 28523                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28524                                  
 28525                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28526                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8B99h
 28527                                  
 28528                                  GETPATH:
 28529                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 28530 0000498D C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 28531                                  
 28532                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 28533                                  
 28534                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 28535                                  GetPathNoSet:
 28536                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 28537                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 28538                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28539 00004993 E841C9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 28540                                  	;
 28541 00004996 C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 28542                                  
 28543                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 28544                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 28545                                  
 28546 0000499C 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 28547                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 28548                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 28549 000049A0 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'
 28550 000049A5 7435                    	JZ	short CrackIt
 28551                                  
 28552                                  ; Let ChkDev find it in the device list
 28553                                  
 28554 000049A7 83C703                  	ADD	DI,3
 28555                                  	; 18/08/2018
 28556                                  	;MOV	SI,DI			; let CHKDEV see the original name
 28557                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28558                                  	; 16/12/2022

 28576                                  ; Take name in name1 and pack it back into where wfp_start points. This
 28577                                  ; guarantees wfp_start pointing to a canonical representation of a device.
 28578                                  ; We are allowed to do this as GetPath is *ALWAYS* called before entering a
 28579                                  ; wfp into the share set.

 28729                                  ;

 28731                                  ; of path and go crack from root.

 28758                                  
 28759                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28760                                  ;
 28761                                  ; Procedure Name : ChkDev

 28763                                  ; Check to see if the name at DS:DI is a device. Returns carry set if not a
 28764                                  ;   device.

 28769 00004A20 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI

 28777 00004A27 B90900                  	MOV	CX,9
 28778                                  TESTLOOP:

 28780

 28782 00004A2F 740E                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE

 28797 00004A3F 41                      	inc	cx
 28798 00004A40 41                      	inc	cx

 28800 00004A43 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 28801                                  	;MOV	AX,SS
 28802                                  	;MOV	DS,AX
 28803                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28804 00004A45 16                      	push	ss
 28805 00004A46 1F                      	pop	ds
