 35734                                  
 35735 00005E54 C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 35736 00005E59 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 35737                                  
 35738                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 35739                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 35740                                  
 35741 00005E5B E95410                  	jmp	exit_inner
 35742                                  
 35743                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35744                                  ;
 35745                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 35746                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 35747                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 35748                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 35749                                  ;
 35750                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 35751                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 35752                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 35753                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 35754                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 35755                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 35756                                  ;
 35757                                  ; output:   none.
 35758                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35759                                  
 35760                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 35761                                  	
 35762                                  reset_environment:
 35763                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35764                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 35765                                  
 35766                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 35767                                  
 35768 00005E5E 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 35769                                  
 35770                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 35771                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 35772                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 35773                                  
 35774 00005E5F B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 35775                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 35776                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 35777 00005E61 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 35778                                  
 35779                                  					; SS override
 35780 00005E63 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 35781                                  
 35782                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 35783                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 35784                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 35785                                  					; On process exit.
 35786 00005E69 B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h
 35787 00005E6C CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 35788                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 35789                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 35790 00005E6E B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 35791 00005E70 E8E7B0                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 35792                                  
 35793 00005E73 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 35794 00005E74 06                      	push	es
 35795 00005E75 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 35796                                  
 35797 00005E76 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 35798 00005E7B 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 35799 00005E7D A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 35800                                  
 35801                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 35802                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper
 35803                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 35804                                  	
 35805 00005E80 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX
 35806 00005E82 7418                    	JZ	short reset_return	; parentPDB = CurrentPDB
 35807 00005E84 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX
 35808 00005E86 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB
 35809 00005E88 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save parent
 35810                                  
 35811                                  					; SS override
 35812                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 35813 00005E89 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 35814 00005E8F 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 35815                                  
 35816                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 35817                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 35818                                  
 35819                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 35820 00005E91 E85D10                  	call	arena_free_process
 35821                                  
 35822                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 35823                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 35824                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 35825                                  
 35826                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 35827 00005E94 E813D7                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 35828                                  
 35829                                  reset_to_parent:
 35830                                  					; SS override
 35831 00005E97 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 35832                                  
 35833                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 35834                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 35835 00005E9C 16                      	push	ss
 35836 00005E9D 1F                      	pop	ds	
 35837                                  
 35838 00005E9E B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 35839                                  
 35840                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors,
 35841                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 35842                                  
 35843                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
 35844 00005EA0 E8F5B9                  	call	ECritDisk
 35845                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 35846 00005EA3 E86108                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 35847                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
 35848 00005EA6 E81CBA                  	call	LCritDisk
 35849                                  
 35850                                  ; 29/02/2024 - Retrto DOS v5.0

 35854

 35856                                  %endif
 35857                                  
 35858 00005EA9 FA                      	CLI
 35859 00005EAA C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35860

 35862                                  	;;;

 35864                                  	;;;
 35865

 35879                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35880 00005ED5 07                      	pop	es ; * ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:94A8h, MSDOS.SYS)
 35881                                  
 35882                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35883 00005ED6 50                      	push	ax			; set up ds, but save ds in TEMPSEG
 35884 00005ED7 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; and not on stack.

 35903 00005EE8 9F                      	LAHF
 35904 00005EE9 86C4                    	XCHG	AH,AL
 35905 00005EEB 2402                    	AND	AL,2
 35906 00005EED B4F2                    	MOV	AH,0F2h
 35907

 35911 00005EEF 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35912

 35914                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD]
 35915                                  	
 35916                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35917 00005EF0 FF36[8205]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD+2]

 35921

 35923 00005EF8 A1[8405]                	MOV	AX,[USER_SP]
 35924 00005EFB 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]	; restore ds
 35925                                  
 35926 00005EFF CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address
 35927                                  
 35928                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35929                                  ;
 35930                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 35931                                  ;
 35932                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 35933                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 35934                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 35935                                  ;
 35936                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35937                                  
 35938                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 35939 00005F00 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35940                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 35941 00005F01 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 35942 00005F04 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 35943                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 35944                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 35945                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35946                                  	
 35947                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35948 00005F07 1E                      	push	ds
 35949                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 35950 00005F08 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35951                                  
 35952                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate
 35953                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 35954                                  
 35955 00005F0D 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 35956 00005F0F 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 35957 00005F11 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 35958                                  
 35959                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 35960 00005F13 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 35961 00005F17 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 35962                                  NoTrans:
 35963                                  	;MOV	[CS:EXTERR],AX
 35964 00005F19 A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 35965 00005F1C 1F                      	pop	ds
 35966                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 35967 00005F1D 58                      	POP	AX
 35968                                  
 35969                                  	; Now Extended error is set correctly. Translate it to get correct
 35970                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 35971                                  
 35972 00005F1E 56                      	PUSH	SI
 35973                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 35974 00005F1F BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 35975 00005F22 E89DA7                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 35976 00005F25 5E                      	POP	SI
 35977 00005F26 C3                      	retn
 35978                                  
 35979                                  ;============================================================================
 35980                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 35981                                  ;============================================================================
 35982                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35983                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35984                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35985                                  
 35986                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 35987                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 35988                                  
 35989                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 35990                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35991                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 35992                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 35993                                  ;
 35994                                  ;	IsEof
 35995                                  ;	UNPACK
 35996                                  ;	PACK
 35997                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 35998                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 35999                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36000                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36001                                  ;
 36002                                  ;	Revision history:
 36003                                  ;
 36004                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36005                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36006                                  ;
 36007                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36008                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36009                                  
 36010                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36011                                  
 36012                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36013                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36014                                  
 36015                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36016                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36017                                  ;
 36018                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36019                                  ;
 36020                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36021                                  ;
 36022                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36023                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36024                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36025                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36026                                  ;
 36027                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36028                                  
 36029                                  IsEOF:
 36030                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36031                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36032                                  	;;;
 36033 00005F27 E89801                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36034 00005F2A 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36035                                  
 36036                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36037 00005F2C 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36038 00005F33 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36039 00005F35 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36040                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36041 00005F38 C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36042                                  
 36043                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36044                                  	;;;
 36045                                  
 36046                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36047 00005F39 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36048 00005F3F 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36049                                  
 36050                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36051                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36052                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36053                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36054                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36055                                  
 36056 00005F41 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36057 00005F45 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36058                                  
 36059 00005F47 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36060                                  IsEOF_other:
 36061 00005F4B C3                      	retn
 36062                                  EOF16:
 36063 00005F4C 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36064 00005F4F C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36065                                  
 36066                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36067                                  
 36068                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36069                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36070                                  ;
 36071                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36072                                  ;
 36073                                  ; Inputs:
 36074                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36075                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36076                                  ; Outputs:
 36077                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36078                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36079                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36080                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36081                                  ;
 36082                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36083                                  ;
 36084                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36085                                  
 36086                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36087                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36088                                  	;
 36089                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36090                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36091                                  
 36092                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36093                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36094                                  
 36095                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36096                                  UNPACK:
 36097                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36098 00005F50 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36099 00005F52 7519                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36100                                  
 36101                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36102                                  %if 0
 36103                                  	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36104                                  	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 36105                                  	retn				; done
 36106                                  %else
 36107                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A435h
 36108                                  	;;;
 36109                                  up_1:
 36110 00005F54 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36111 00005F58 7513                    	jne	short up_cont
 36112 00005F5A 8B3E[350F]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36113 00005F5E 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36114 00005F60 893E[EC0A]              	mov	[CCONTENT_HW],di
 36115 00005F64 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]

 36284                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36285                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36286                                  ;
 36287                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 36288                                  ;
 36289                                  ; Inputs:
 36290                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 36291                                  ;	DX = Data
 36292                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 36293                                  ; Outputs:
 36294                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 36295                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 36296                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36297                                  ;	No other registers affected
 36298                                  ;
 36299                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 36300                                  ;
 36301                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36302                                  
 36303                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 36306                                  	;  [CLUSDATA_HW]:DX = cluster data/content
 36307                                  	;  [CLUSTNUM_HW]:BX = cluster number (to be updated)
 36308                                  	;  ES:BP = pointer to DPB
 36309

 36311                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 36316                                  
 36317                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36318                                  %if 0
 36319                                  	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 36320                                  	retn				; done
 36321                                  %else

 36323                                  	;;;

 36325 00006007 750D                    	jnz	short p_cont
 36326

 36330                                  	;pop	ax

 36332 0000600D 8F06[350F]              	pop	word [CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36333                                  
 36334 00006011 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx
 36335 00006015 C3                      	retn
 36336                                  	;;;
 36337                                  %endif

 36340                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0

 36348 00006024 59                      	POP	CX

 36502                                  
 36503                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 36504                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36505                                  ;
 36506                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 36507                                  ;
 36508                                  ; Inputs:
 36509                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 36510                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 36511                                  ; Function:
 36512                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 36513                                  ; Outputs:
 36514                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 36515                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 36516                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 36517                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 36518                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 36519                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 36520                                  ;
 36521                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36522                                  
 36523                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36524                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36525                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36526                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36527                                  
 36528                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36529                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A5D7h
 36530                                  
 36531                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 36532                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 36533 000060D7 C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 36534                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 36535 000060DC 50                      	push	ax
 36536 000060DD 53                      	push	bx
 36537 000060DE 51                      	push	cx
 36538 000060DF 52                      	push	dx
 36539                                  	; 02/03/2024
 36540                                  	;MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 36541                                  
 36542                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36543                                  	;;;
 36544                                  	;push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36545 000060E0 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx
 36546 000060E2 8B16[E80A]              	mov	dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36547                                  	;
 36548 000060E6 52                      	push	dx ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36549                                  	;
 36550 000060E7 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36551 000060E9 E8D6FF                  	call	IsFAT32
 36552 000060EC 730E                    	jnc	short mapcl1 ; not FAT32
 36553                                  	; FAT32
 36554 000060EE D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36555 000060F0 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36556 000060F2 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36557 000060F4 D1E0                    	shl	ax,1
 36558 000060F6 D1D2                    	rcl	dx,1
 36559 000060F8 D1D7                    	rcl	di,1
 36560                                  	; DI:DX:AX = 4*(DX:AX)
 36561 000060FA EB14                    	jmp	short Map16		; 32 bit FAT	
 36562                                  mapcl1:
 36563                                  	;;;
 36564 000060FC 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 36565                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36566                                  	;JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 36567                                  	;SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 36568                                  	;
 36569                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36570                                  	;;;
 36571 00006102 7304                    	jae	short mapcl2		; 16 bit FAT
 36572                                  	; 12 bit FAT
 36573 00006104 D1EA                    	shr	dx,1
 36574 00006106 D1D8                    	rcr     ax,1
 36575                                  mapcl2:
 36576 00006108 01D8                    	add     ax,bx
 36577 0000610A 1316[E80A]              	adc     dx,[CLUSTNUM_HW]
 36578 0000610E 11FF                    	adc	di,di
 36579                                  	;;;
 36580                                  Map16:	
 36581                                  
 36582                                  ; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36583                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36584                                  %if 0
 36585                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 36586                                  	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 36587                                  	
 36588                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36589                                  	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 36590                                  	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 36591                                  %endif
 36592                                  
 36593 00006110 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36594                                  
 36595                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36596                                  ;
 36597                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 36598                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 36599                                  ;
 36600                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 36601                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 36602                                  ;
 36603                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 36604                                  
 36605 00006114 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 36606 00006118 751C                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 36607                                  
 36608                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36609                                  %if 0
 36610                                  	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 36611                                  	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 36612                                  	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 36613                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 36614                                  	;shr	al,1
 36615                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 36616                                  	shr	di,1			; 2
 36617                                  	rcr	al,1			; 2
 36618                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36619                                  	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 36620                                  %else
 36621                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36622                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36623                                  	;;;
 36624 0000611A 50                      	push	ax
 36625 0000611B D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36626 0000611D D1DA                    	rcr	dx,1
 36627 0000611F D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 36628 00006121 88E0                    	mov	al,ah			; 9 bit shift to right
 36629 00006123 88D4                    	mov	ah,dl
 36630 00006125 88F2                    	mov	dl,dh
 36631 00006127 30F6                    	xor	dh,dh
 36632 00006129 D1EF                    	shr	di,1
 36633 0000612B 10F6                    	adc	dh,dh
 36634 0000612D 87FA                    	xchg	dx,di		; DI:AX = sector contains requested cluster data
 36635 0000612F 5A                      	pop	dx
 36636 00006130 81E2FF01                	and	dx,1FFh			; offset in sector
 36637                                  	;;;
 36638                                  %endif
 36639 00006134 EB07                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 36640                                  
 36641                                  _DoDiv:
 36642                                  ;ENDIF
 36643                                  
 36644                                  ; 02/04/2024
 36645                                  %if 0
 36646                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36647                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 36648                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36649                                  	mov	dx,di			; 2
 36650                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36651                                  	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 36652                                  %else
 36653                                  	; 02/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36654                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36655                                  	;;;
 36656 00006136 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36657 00006137 92                      	xchg	ax,dx
 36658 00006138 F7F1                    	div	cx
 36659 0000613A 97                      	xchg	ax,di
 36660 0000613B F7F1                    	div	cx
 36661                                  	;jmp	short DivDone
 36662                                  	;;;
 36663                                  %endif
 36664                                  
 36665                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36666                                  DivDone:
 36667                                  ;ENDIF
 36668                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 36669 0000613D 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 36670                                  	
 36671                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36672                                  	;;;
 36673 00006141 83D700                  	adc	di,0
 36674                                  	;;;
 36675                                  
 36676 00006144 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 36677                                  
 36678                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 36679                                  
 36680                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36681                                  	;;;
 36682 00006145 57                      	push	di ; 4*
 36683                                  	;;;
 36684 00006146 50                      	push	ax ; 3*
 36685 00006147 52                      	push	dx ; 2*

 36687

 36689

 36691                                  	; mov [HIGH_SECTOR],di ; *!* ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36692 0000614B 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 36693                                  	;
 36694                                  
 36695                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36696                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36697                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 36698                                  	;
 36699                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)

 36701                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *

 36703                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 36704                                  	; 22/09/2023

 36706

 36708 00006150 59                      	pop	cx ; 1*

 36711                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36712                                  	;;;

 36720                                  	;;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0

 36723 0000615D 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 36724 0000615F 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX

 36770                                  	;;;

 36772                                  	;;;

 36801                                  	;;;

 36814

 36817                                  
 36818                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 36819                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36820                                  ;
 36821                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 36822                                  ;
 36823                                  ; Inputs:
 36824                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 36825                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 36826                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 36827                                  ; Function:
 36828                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 36829                                  ;	if disk changed.
 36830                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 36831                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 36832                                  ; Outputs:
 36833                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36834                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 36835                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 36836                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 36837                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 36838                                  ;
 36839                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36840                                  
 36841                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 36842 000061B9 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 36843                                  
 36844                                  fatread_gotdpb:	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36845                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36846                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36847                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36848 000061BD 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36849 000061C1 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36850 000061C4 E8AFA4                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 36851                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36852                                  	; 17/12/2022
 36853 000061C7 E99C00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36854                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 36855                                  	;retn
 36856                                  
 36857                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36858                                  ;
 36859                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 36860                                  ;
 36861                                  ; Inputs:
 36862                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 36863                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 36864                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 36865                                  ; Function:
 36866                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 36867                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 36868                                  ; Outputs:
 36869                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 36870                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 36871                                  ;	THISDRV set
 36872                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36873                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 36874                                  ;
 36875                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36876                                  
 36877                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36878                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36879                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36880                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36881                                  
 36882                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36883                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A6D8h
 36884                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C644h)
 36885                                  
 36886                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 36887 000061CA 06                      	PUSH	ES
 36888 000061CB 57                      	PUSH	DI
 36889                                  
 36890                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 36891 000061CC 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36892                                  
 36893                                  ; 03/03/2024
 36894                                  %if 0
 36895                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36896                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 36897                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36898                                  	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 36899                                  	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 36900                                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 36901                                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 36902                                  %else
 36903                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36904                                  	;;;
 36905 000061D0 E8EAFF                  	call	fatread_gotdpb
 36906                                  	;;;
 36907                                  %endif
 36908 000061D3 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 36909 000061D4 07                      	POP	ES
 36910 000061D5 72E1                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 36911 000061D7 7542                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 36912                                  
 36913                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 36914                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 36915                                  
 36916                                  MED_CHANGE:
 36917                                  	;XOR	AX,AX
 36918                                  	;DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 36919                                  	; 03/03/2024
 36920 000061D9 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh ; -1
 36921                                  	
 36922 000061DC 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 36923 000061DD 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 36924 000061E1 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 36925                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 36926 000061E3 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 36927                                  
 36928                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36929                                  
 36930                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 36931                                  ;
 36932                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 36933                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 36934                                  
 36935 000061E7 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 36936                                  frcd20: 
 36937                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 36938                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 36939 000061EC 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 36940 000061F1 7522                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 36941                                  
 36942                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36943                                  	;push	es
 36944                                  	;push	di
 36945                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 36946                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36947                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 36948                                  	;pop	di
 36949                                  	;pop	es
 36950                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 36951                                  
 36952                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36953 000061F3 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 36954 000061F7 751C                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 36955 000061F9 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 36956 000061FB 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 36957 000061FF 7514                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 36958                                  
 36959                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36960                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A70Fh
 36961 00006201 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 36962                                  	;JZ	short frcd25 ; = 0	; If root (0), leave root
 36963                                  		; !!! test es:[di+49h],ax
 36964                                  		; !!! jz short frcd25	
 36965                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM bug (!?) ; Erdogan Tan - 03/03/2024
 36966                                  		; test dword ptr es:[di+49h],-1 ; Win ME - BIOSCODE:0C694h
 36967                                  		; jz short frcd25
 36968                                  		;
 36969                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36970 00006205 7506                    	jnz	short frcd24
 36971                                  
 36972                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36973                                  	;;;
 36974                                  	;test	[es:di+4Bh],ax

 36976 0000620B 7408                    	jz	short frcd25 ; = 0
 36977                                  frcd24:		; 03/03/2024
 36978                                  	;;;
 36979                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 36980 0000620D 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 36981                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36982                                  	;;;
 36983                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 36984 00006211 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax ; -1
 36985                                  	;;;
 36986                                  frcd25:	
 36987                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 36988                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 36989 00006215 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 36990 00006218 E2D2                    	LOOP	frcd20
 36991 0000621A 1F                      	POP	DS
 36992                                  NO_CHANGE:
 36993 0000621B C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 36994 0000621F F8                      	CLC
 36995 00006220 C3                      	retn
 36996                                  
 36997                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E =======================================
 36998                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 36999                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 37000                                  ;;;
 37001                                  chk_set_first_access:
 37002                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 37003 00006221 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 37004 00006226 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 37005                                  	; FAT32

 37014                                  chk_set_fa_2:

 37016 0000623A 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+DPB.FREE_CNT],0FFFFh ; -1
 37017 00006240 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3

 37019 00006242 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS],1
 37020                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 37021 00006247 C3                      	retn
 37022                                  ;;;

 37028                                  ;
 37029                                  ; Procedure Name : FAT_operation
 37030                                  ;
 37031                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37032                                  
 37033                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37034                                  
 37035                                  	; 04/03/2024
 37036                                  	; 03/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37037                                  
 37038                                  FAT_operation:
 37039                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37040                                  FATERR:
 37041                                  
 37042                                  ; 03/03/2024
 37043                                  %if 0
 37044                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 37045                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 37046                                  	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 37047                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 37048                                  %else
 37049                                  	; 03/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37050                                  	;;;
 37051 00006248 E8D6FF                  	call    chk_set_first_access
 37052                                  	;;;
 37053                                  %endif
 37054                                  	;and	di,0FFh

 37727                                  ; buffer management for MSDOS
 37728                                  ;
 37729                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'
 37730                                  ;       ASSUME  SS:DOSGROUP,CS:DOSGROUP
 37731                                  ;
 37732                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS
 37733                                  ;
 37734                                  ;SETVISIT:
 37735                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37736                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 37737                                  ;; Inputs:
 37738                                  ;;      None
 37739                                  ;; Function:
 37740                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 37741                                  ;; Outputs:
 37742                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 37743                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 37744                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 37745                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 37746                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 37747                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37748                                  ;
 37749                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37750                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 37751                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37752                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 37753                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 37754                                  ;SETLOOP:
 37755                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37756                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 37757                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 37758                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 37759                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37760                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 37761                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 37762                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37763                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 37764                                  ;       RETN
 37765                                  ;
 37766                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 37767                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37768                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 37769                                  ;
 37770                                  ;; Inputs:
 37771                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 37772                                  ;; Function:
 37773                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 37774                                  ;; Outputs:
 37775                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 37776                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 37777                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37778                                  ;
 37779                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37780                                  ;       ;retz
 37781                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37782                                  ;
 37783                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37784                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 37785                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37786                                  ;
 37787                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 37788                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 37789                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 37790                                  ;	
 37791                                  ;	push	ax
 37792                                  ;	or	al,1
 37793                                  ;	pop	ax
 37794                                  ;	retn	
 37795                                  ;
 37796                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 37797                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 37798                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT

 37811                                  ;

 37824                                  ;
 37825                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37826                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed

 37830                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 37831                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37832                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 37833                                  ; Inputs:
 37834                                  ;	 No Inputs
 37835                                  ; Function:
 37836                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37837                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 37838                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 37839                                  ; Outputs:
 37840                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37841                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 37842                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 37843                                  ; No other registers altered
 37844                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37845                                  
 37846                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37847                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37848                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37849                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37850                                  
 37851                                  ; 06/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 37852                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AA4Bh
 37853                                  
 37854                                  GETCURHEAD:
 37855 00006528 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 37856 0000652D 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 37857 00006534 36893E[1711]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 37858 00006539 C3                      	retn
 37859                                  
 37860                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 37861                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37862                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 37863                                  ; Inputs:
 37864                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 37865                                  ; Function:
 37866                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 37867                                  ; Outputs:
 37868                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 37869                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 37870                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37871                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 37872                                  
 37873                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 37874                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37875                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37876                                  ;	push	es
 37877                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 37878                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 37879                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 37880                                  ;	push	es
 37881                                  ;	pop	ds
 37882                                  ;	mov	di,si
 37883                                  ;	pop	es
 37884                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 37885                                  ;	retn	
 37886                                  	
 37887                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37888                                  SCANPLACE:
 37889 0000653A FF35                    	push	word [di]
 37890                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 37891 0000653C E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 37892 0000653F 5F                      	pop	di
 37893 00006540 C3                      	retn
 37894                                  
 37895                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37896                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 37897                                  ; Input:
 37898                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 37899                                  ; Function:
 37900                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 37901                                  ; NO registers altered
 37902                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37903                                  
 37904                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 37905                                  
 37906                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37907                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37908                                  PLACEBUF:
 37909                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37910                                  
 37911                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37912 00006541 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 37913 00006542 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 37914                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37915                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 37916                                  	
 37917 00006543 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 37918                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 37919 00006545 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 37920                                  	
 37921 0000654A 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 37922 0000654C 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37923 0000654E 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 37924 00006550 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37925 00006552 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override
 37926 00006556 EB18                    	jmp	short nret 			;Continue with repositioning;AN000;
 37927                                  not_first:
 37928                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37929 00006558 56                      	push	si
 37930                                  	;mov	si,[di+2]
 37931 00006559 8B7502                  	mov	SI,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;No, SI = prior Buf	;AN000;
 37932 0000655C 8904                    	mov	[si],ax
 37933                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],AX	; ax has di->buf_next	;AN000;
 37934 0000655E 96                      	xchg	si,ax
 37935                                  	;mov	[si+2],ax
 37936 0000655F 894402                  	mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],AX	;			;AN000;
 37937                                  	
 37938 00006562 8B7702                  	mov	SI,[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;SI-> last buffer	;AN000;
 37939 00006565 893C                    	mov	[si],di
 37940                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],DI	;Add Buf to end of list ;AN000;
 37941 00006567 897F02                  	mov	[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],DI				;AN000;

 38086                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 38087                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38088                                  ;
 38089                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 38090                                  ; Inputs:
 38091                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 38092                                  ; Function:
 38093                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 38094                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 38095                                  ;	   same segment
 38096                                  ;
 38097                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 38098                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 38099                                  ; No Registers altered
 38100                                  ;
 38101                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38102                                  
 38103                                  POINTCOMP:
 38104                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38105                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h

 38110 00006583 52                      	PUSH	DX

 38112 00006586 8CC2                    	MOV	DX,ES

 38119                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38120                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h 
 38121                                  
 38122                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 38123                                  
 38124                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38125                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38126                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 38127                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38128                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 38129                                  ; 
 38130                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38131                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38132                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 38133                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38134                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38135                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38136                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38137                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38138                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38139                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38140                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38141                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38142                                  
 38143                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38144                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38145                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38146                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38147                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38148                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38149                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38150                                  ; 
 38151                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38152                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38153                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38154                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38155                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38156                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38157                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38158                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38159                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38160                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38161                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38162                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38163                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38164                                  
 38165                                  	; 22/09/2023 - RetroDOS v4.2 MSDOS.SYS (optimization)

 38836                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 38837                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38838                                  ;
 38839                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 38840                                  ;
 38841                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 38842                                  ;

 38844                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)

 39045                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 39046                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39047                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 39048                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
