 39145                                  ; MSPROC.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1992
 39146                                  ;============================================================================
 39147                                  ; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39148                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39149                                  ; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 39150                                  
 39151                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 39152                                  
 39153                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 39154                                  
 39155                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 39156                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 39157                                  
 39158                                  ; =========================================================================
 39159                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 39160                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 39161                                  ;
 39162                                  ;	$WAIT
 39163                                  ;	$EXEC
 39164                                  ;	$Keep_process
 39165                                  ;	Stay_resident
 39166                                  ;	$EXIT
 39167                                  ;	$ABORT
 39168                                  ;	abort_inner
 39169                                  ;
 39170                                  ;	Modification history:
 39171                                  ;
 39172                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 39173                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 39174                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 39175                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 39176                                  ;
 39177                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 39178                                  ;
 39179                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 39180                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 39181                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 39182                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 39183                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 39184                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 39185                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 39186                                  ;
 39187                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 39188                                  ;
 39189                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 39190                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 39191                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 39192                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 39193                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 39194                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 39195                                  ;
 39196                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 39197                                  ;
 39198                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 39199                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 39200                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 39201                                  ;
 39202                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 39203                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 39204                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 39205                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 39206                                  ;
 39207                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 39208                                  ;
 39209                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 39210                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 39211                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 39212                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 39213                                  ;
 39214                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 39215                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 39216                                  ;		       UMBs.
 39217                                  ;
 39218                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 39219                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 39220                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 39221                                  ;
 39222                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 39223                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 39224                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 39225                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 39226                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 39227                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 39228                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 39229                                  ;
 39230                                  ; =========================================================================
 39231                                  
 39232                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 39233                                  
 39234                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 39235                                  ; =========================================================================
 39236                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 39237                                  ;
 39238                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 39239                                  ;
 39240                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 39241                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 39242                                  ;
 39243                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 39244                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 39245                                  ;	USES	all
 39246                                  ; =========================================================================
 39247                                  
 39248                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39249                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 39250                                  
 39251                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 39252                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 39253                                  
 39254                                  	; 07/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 39255                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0AD78h	
 39256                                  
 39257                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:9B55h)
 39258                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:944Ch)
 39259                                  
 39260                                  _$WAIT:
 39261                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39262                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 39263                                  
 39264 0000684D 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 39265 0000684F 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 39266 00006854 E9289E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 39268                                  ; =========================================================================
 39269                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 39270                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 39271                                  ;
 39272                                  ;
 39273                                  ; Assembler usage:
 39274                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 39275                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 39276                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 39277                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 39278                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 39279                                  ;
 39280                                  ;	AL  Function
 39281                                  ;	--  --------
 39282                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 39283                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 39284                                  ;	    begin execution.
 39285                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 39286                                  ;
 39287                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 39288                                  ;
 39289                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39290                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39291                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39292                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39293                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39294                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39295                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39296                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39297                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39298                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39299                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39300                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39301                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39302                                  ;
 39303                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 39304                                  ;
 39305                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39306                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 39307                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 39308                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39309                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 39310                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 39311                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39312                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39313                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 39314                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39315                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 39316                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 39317                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39318                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39319                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 39320                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39321                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 39322                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 39323                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39324                                  ;
 39325                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 39326                                  ;
 39327                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39328                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 39329                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 39330                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39331                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 39332                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 39333                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 39334                                  ;
 39335                                  ; Returns:
 39336                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 39337                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 39338                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 39339                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 39340                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 39341                                  ; =========================================================================
 39342                                  ;
 39343                                  ;   Revision history:
 39344                                  ;
 39345                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 39346                                  ;
 39347                                  ; =========================================================================
 39348                                  
 39349                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF
 39350                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer_Size	EQU	(128+128+53+curdirLen)
 39351                                  
 39352                                  ; =========================================================================
 39353                                  
 39354                                  ;IF1		; warning message on buffers
 39355                                  ;%out	Please make sure that the following are contiguous and of the
 39356                                  ;%out	following sizes:
 39357                                  ;%out
 39358                                  ;%out	OpenBuf     128
 39359                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128
 39360                                  ;%out	SearchBuf    53
 39361                                  ;%out	DummyCDS    curdirLen
 39362                                  ;ENDIF

 39372

 39383                                  _$EXEC:
 39384                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 39385                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5EF1h
 39386                                  
 39387                                  EXEC001S:

 39429                                  	; ==================================================================
 39430                                  		      	
 39431                                  	; M068 - Start
 39432                                  	;
 39433                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a
 39434                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 39435                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep
 39436                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 39437                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 39438                                  
 39439                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39440 00006857 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 39441                                  
 39442                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack
 39443                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 39444                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 39445                                  
 39446 0000685D 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 39447                                  	;jne	short @f
 39448 0000685F 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 39449                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 39450 00006861 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 39451 00006862 B9[0A04]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 39452 00006865 51                      	push	cx
 39453                                  ;@@:
 39454                                  Exec_@f:
 39455                                  	; M068 - End
 39456

 39458

 39467

 41037                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41038                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41039                                  ;
 41040                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41041                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41042                                  ;
 41043                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41044                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41045                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41046                                  ;
 41047                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41048                                  
 41049                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41050                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41051

 41053                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41054                                  
 41055                                  	; 09/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 41056                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B3BCh
 41057                                  
 41058                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41059 00006E63 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41060                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41061 00006E64 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41062 00006E6A 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41063 00006E6F 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41064 00006E72 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41065                                  
 41066 00006E74 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41067                                  
 41068                                  Keep_Shrink:

 41070 00006E79 53                      	push	BX

 41072 00006E7B E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41073 00006E7E 1F                      	pop	DS
 41074 00006E7F 5B                      	pop	BX
 41075 00006E80 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41076                                  
 41077 00006E82 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41078 00006E84 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41079                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41080 00006E86 A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41081

 41140                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 41141                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41142                                  ; Inputs:
 41143                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 41144                                  ; Function:
 41145                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 41146                                  ;	to the terminate address
 41147                                  ; Returns:
 41148                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 41149                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41150                                  
 41151                                  _$ABORT:
 41152 00006EBF 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL
 41153                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],0
 41154                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],AL ; = 0
 41155 00006EC1 36C606[7C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_ABORT
 41156                                  
 41157                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 41158                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 41159                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 41160                                  
 41161                                  abort_inner:
 41162 00006EC7 368A26[7C05]            	mov	AH,[SS:EXIT_TYPE]
 41163 00006ECC 36A3[3403]              	mov	[SS:exit_code],AX
 41164 00006ED0 E8B895                  	call	Get_User_Stack
 41165                                  
 41166                                  	;mov	ds,[si+14h]
 41167 00006ED3 8E5C14                  	mov	DS,[SI+user_env.user_CS] ; set up old interrupts ;PBUGBUG
 41168 00006ED6 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 41169 00006ED8 8EC0                    	mov	ES,AX
 41170                                  	;mov	si,10
 41171 00006EDA BE0A00                  	mov	SI,SAVEXIT
 41172                                  	;mov	di,88h
 41173 00006EDD BF8800                  	mov	DI,addr_int_terminate
 41174 00006EE0 A5                      	movsw
 41175 00006EE1 A5                      	movsw

 41177 00006EE3 A5                      	movsw
 41178 00006EE4 A5                      	movsw
 41179 00006EE5 A5                      	movsw
 41180 00006EE6 E975EF                  	jmp	reset_environment

 41214                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 41215                                  ;
 41216                                  ;	Memory related system calls and low level routines for MSDOS 2.X.
 41217                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 41218                                  ;
 41219                                  ;	$ALLOC
 41220                                  ;	$SETBLOCK
 41221                                  ;	$DEALLOC
 41222                                  ;	$AllocOper
 41223                                  ;	arena_free_process
 41224                                  ;	arena_next
 41225                                  ;	check_signature
 41226                                  ;	Coalesce
 41227                                  ;
 41228                                  ;	Modification history:
 41229                                  ;
 41230                                  ;	    Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 41231                                  ;
 41232                                  ;	    Revision: M000 - added support for allocing UMBs. 7/9/90
 41233                                  ;		      M003 - added support for link/unlink UMBs from
 41234                                  ;			     DOS arena chain. 7/18/90
 41235                                  ;		      M009 - Added error returns invalid function and 
 41236                                  ;			     arena trashed in set link state call.
 41237                                  ;		      M010 - Release UMB arenas allocated to current PDB
 41238                                  ;			     if UMB_HEAD is initialized.
 41239                                  ;
 41240                                  ;		      M016 - MACE utilities mkeyrate.com version 1.0 
 41241                                  ;			     support. Please see under M009 in 
 41242                                  ;			     ..\inc\dossym.inc. 8/31/90.
 41243                                  ;
 41244                                  ;		      M061 - In GetLastArena, if linking in UMBs check to make
 41245                                  ;			     sure that umb_head arena is valid and also make
 41246                                  ;			     sure that the previous arena is pointing to 
 41247                                  ;			     umb_head.
 41248                                  ;
 41249                                  ;		      M064 - allow HIGH_ONLY bit to be set by a call to 
 41250                                  ;			     set allloc strategy.
 41251                                  ;			     use STRAT_MASK to mask out bits 6 & 7 of 
 41252                                  ;			     bx in AllocSetStrat.
 41253                                  ;
 41254                                  ;		      M068 - use a count value (A20OFF_COUNT) rather than
 41255                                  ;			     a bit to indicate to dos dispatcher to turn
 41256                                  ;			     a20 off before iret. See M016.

 41376                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 41377                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41378                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 41379                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41380                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 41381                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 41382                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41383                                  
 41384                                  arena_next:
 41385 00006F23 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 41386 00006F25 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 41387 00006F29 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 41388                                  
 41389                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 41390                                  ;
 41391                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 41392                                  ;       RETN
 41393                                  
 41394                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 41395                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41396                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 41397                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41398                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 41399                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 41400                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 41401                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 41402                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41403                                  
 41404                                  check_signature:        
 41405                                  
 41406 00006F2A 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 41407                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 41408 00006F2C 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 41409                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 41410 00006F30 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41411                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41412 00006F32 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 41413                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 41414 00006F36 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 41415 00006F38 F9                              STC                             ; set error
 41416                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 41417                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 41418                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 41419                                  check_signature_ok:
 41420                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 41421 00006F39 C3                      	RETN
 41422                                  
 41423                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 41424                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41425                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 41426                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 41427                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 41428                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 41429                                  ;
 41430                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 41431                                  ;		(di) = 0
 41432                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41433                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 41434                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 41435                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 41436                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 41437                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41438                                          
 41439                                  Coalesce:
 41440                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 41441 00006F3A 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 41442                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 41443                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 41444 00006F3D 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 41445 00006F3F E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 41446                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 41447 00006F42 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 41448                                  
 41449                                  coalesce_check:
 41450                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 41451 00006F44 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 41452                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 41453 00006F49 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 41454                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 41455 00006F4B 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 41456 00006F50 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 41457                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 41458 00006F51 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 41459 00006F55 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 41460 00006F58 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 41461 00006F5A EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 41462                                  
 41463                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41464                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 41465                                  
 41466                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 41467                                  
 41468                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41469                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41470                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 41471                                  ;
 41472                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 41473                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 41474                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 41475                                  ;
 41476                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 41477                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 41478                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 41479                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 41480                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 41481                                  ;
 41482                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 41483                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 41484                                  ;
 41485                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41486                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41487                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41488                                  ;           INT     21h
 41489                                  ;
 41490                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 41491                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 41492                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 41493                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 41494                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 41495                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 41496                                  ;
 41497                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 41498                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 41499                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 41500                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 41501                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 41502                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 41503                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 41504                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 41505                                  ;	USES	All
 41506                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41507                                  
 41508                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41509                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41510                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 41511                                  ;
 41512                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41513                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 41514                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 41515                                  ;           INT     21h
 41516                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 41517                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 41518                                  ;
 41519                                  ;   Description:
 41520                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 41521                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 41522                                  ;
 41523                                  ;   Error return:
 41524                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 41525                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41526                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41527                                  
 41528                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41529                                  
 41530                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 41866                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41867                                  
 41868                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41869                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41870                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 41871                                  ;
 41872                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 41873                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 41874                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 41875                                  ;
 41876                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 41877                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 41878                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 41879                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 41880                                  ;
 41881                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 41882                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 41883                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 41884                                  ;		code.
 41885                                  ;
 41886                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 41887                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 41888                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 41889                                  ;
 41890                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41891                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41892                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 41893                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 41894                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 41895                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 41896                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 41897                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 41898                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41899                                  
 41900                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41901                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41902                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41903                                  ;
 41904                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41905                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 41906                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 41907                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 41908                                  ;           INT     21h
 41909                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 41910                                  ;         size possible
 41911                                  ;   Error return:
 41912                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 41913                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41914                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 41915                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 41916                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41917                                  
 41918                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 41919                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41920                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 41921 000070AD E8E8A7                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 41922                                  
 41923 000070B0 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE

 41925 000070B5 48                              DEC     AX
 41926 000070B6 E871FE                          CALL    check_signature

 41928

 42013                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42014                                  
 42015                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42016                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42017                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42018                                  ;
 42019                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42020                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42021                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42022                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42023                                  ;           INT     21h
 42024                                  ;
 42025                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42026                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42027                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42028                                  ;
 42029                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42030                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42031                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42032                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42033                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42034                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42035                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42036                                  ;
 42037                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42038                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42039                                  ;
 42040                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42041                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42042                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42043                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42044                                  ;
 42045                                  ;
 42046                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42047                                  ;
 42048                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42049                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42050                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42051                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42052                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42053                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42054                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42055                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42056                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42057                                  ;
 42058                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42059                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42060                                  ;
 42061                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42062                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42063                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42064                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42065                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42066                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42067                                  
 42068                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42069                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42070                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42071                                  ;
 42072                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42073                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42074                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42075                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42076                                  ;           INT     21h
 42077                                  ;
 42078                                  ;   Error return:
 42079                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42080                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42081                                  
 42082                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 42301                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42302                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42303                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 42304                                  ;
 42305                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 42306                                  ;
 42307                                  ;
 42308                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 42309                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 42310                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 42311                                  ;		   else
 42312                                  ;			DS = last arena
 42313                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 42314                                  ;
 42315                                  ;		   CY if error
 42316                                  ;
 42317                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 42318                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42319                                  
 42320                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42321                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42322                                  
 42323                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42324                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 42325                                  
 42326                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42327                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 42328                                  
 42329                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 42330                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 42331                                  
 42332                                  GetLastArena:
 42333 00007176 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 42334                                  
 42335 00007177 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 42336 0000717B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 42337 0000717D 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 42338                                  
 42339 0000717F 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42340                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42341 00007183 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 42342                                  
 42343                                  GLA_next:
 42344 00007185 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42345 00007187 E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42346                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42347                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42348                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42349 0000718A 7222                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42350                                  
 42351                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42352                                  %if 0
 42353                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42354                                  	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is
 42355                                  					;    umb_head
 42356                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 42357                                  %else
 42358                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42359                                  	;;;
 42360 0000718C E85BFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42361 0000718F 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb
 42362                                  	;;;
 42363                                  %endif
 42364 00007191 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 42365                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 42366 00007195 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 42367                                  GLA_chkumb:
 42368 00007197 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42369                                  GLA_@f:
 42370 00007199 75EA                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 42371                                  
 42372                                  GLA_done:
 42373                                  
 42374                                  ; 10/03/2024
 42375                                  %if 0
 42376                                  					; M061 - Start
 42377                                  	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 42378                                  	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 42379                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next
 42380                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 42381                                  %else
 42382                                  	; 10/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42383                                  	;;;
 42384 0000719B E84CFD                  	call	test_umb_flag
 42385 0000719E 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret ; cf=0
 42386                                  	;;;
 42387                                  %endif
 42388 000071A0 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 42389 000071A2 E87EFD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 42390                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 42391 000071A5 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 42392 000071A7 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 42393 000071A9 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 42394                                  					; M061 - End
 42395                                  GLA_ret:
 42396                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42397                                  	;clc
 42398                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42399                                  	;clc
 42400 000071AB 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 42401 000071AC C3                      	retn				; M061
 42402                                  
 42403                                  GLA_err:
 42404 000071AD F9                      	stc				; M061
 42405                                  GLA_err2:
 42406 000071AE 58                      	pop	ax
 42407                                  
 42408                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 
 42409                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42410                                  	;;;
 42411 000071AF 58                      	pop	ax	; return address to _$ALLOCOPER (the caller)
 42412 000071B0 E82EA1                  	call	set_exerr_locus_mem
 42413 000071B3 E910FE                  	jmp	alloc_trashed2	; (error return from _$ALLOCOPER)
 42414                                  	;;;
 42415                                  
 42416                                  	; 10/03/2024
 42417                                  	;retn

 42486                                  ;
 42487                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 42488                                  ;
 42489                                  ; Inputs:
 42490                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 42491                                  ; Function:
 42492                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 42493                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 42494                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 42495                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 42496                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 42497                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 42498                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 42499                                  ;			CX User Index
 42500                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 42501                                  ;			BX = UID
 42502                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 42503                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 42504                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 42505                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 42506                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 42507                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 42508                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 42509                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 42510                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 42511                                  ;
 42512                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42513                                  
 42514                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42515                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 42516                                  
 42517                                  _$ServerCall:
 42518                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42519                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 42520                                  	; 10/06/2019
 42521                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42522                                  	; DOSCODE:A532h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 42523                                  
 42524                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 42526 000071D1 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7

 42530                                  SET_STUFF:

 42550                                  NO_SET_ID:
 42551                                  	; 10/06/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42552 000071F3 2EFF36[B871]            	PUSH	word [cs:SERVERLEAVE]	; push return address

 42562

 42566                                  servercall_error:
 42567 00007206 E98094                  	JMP	SYS_RET_ERR

 42569                                  SERVERRETURN:
 42570 00007209 C3                      	retn
 42571                                  
 42572                                  ; Commit - iterate through the open file list and make sure that the
 42573                                  ; directory entries are correctly updated.
 42574                                  
 42575                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42576                                  COMMIT_ALL:
 42577 0000720A 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; for (i=0; ThisSFT=getSFT(i); i++)
 42578 0000720C 16                      	push	ss
 42579 0000720D 1F                      	pop	ds
 42580 0000720E E887A6                  	call	ECritSFT		; Gonna scan SFT cache, lock it down
 42581                                  CommitLoop:

 42583 00007212 E82201                  	call	SFFromSFN

 42585 00007217 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 42586                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0
 42587                                  					; if (ThisSFT->refcount != 0)

 42593 00007221 7412                    	JZ	short CommitNext	;   in them.

 42596                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet ; 8000h

 42598                                  					;      doesn't deadlock

 42693                                  SRV_CALL:

 42695 00007270 1E                      	push	ds

 42698 00007275 5F                      	pop	di
 42699 00007276 07                      	pop	es
 42700                                  
 42701                                  ; DS:SI point to stack
 42702                                  ; ES:DI point to DPL
 42703                                  
 42704 00007277 E854A5                  	call	XCHGP
 42705                                  
 42706                                  ; DS:SI point to DPL
 42707                                  ; ES:DI point to stack
 42708                                  ;
 42709                                  ; We now copy the registers from DPL to save stack
 42710

 42713 0000727E F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Put in AX,BX,CX,DX,SI,DI

 42715 00007281 47                      	INC	DI			; Skip user_BP
 42716 00007282 A5                      	MOVSW				; DS
