 42838                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 42839                                  
 42840                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 42841                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42842                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 42843                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 42844                                  ;
 42845                                  ;	NOTE:
 42846                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42847                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42848                                  ;
 42849                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42850                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 42851                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 42852                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42853                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42854                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 42855                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42856                                  
 42857                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42858                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42859                                  
 42860                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 42861                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42862                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42863 00007304 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42864                                  	
 42865                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 42866 00007309 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 42867                                  
 42868                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 42869 0000730E 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 42870 00007313 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 42871                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42872                                  	;mov	al,6
 42873 00007315 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42874                                  ReturnCarry:
 42875 00007317 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 42876 00007318 C3                      	retn				; go back
 42877                                  pjfn10: 
 42878                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 42879 00007319 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 42880 0000731E 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 42881                                  	;clc
 42882                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 42883 00007320 C3                      	retn
 42884                                  
 42885                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 42886                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42887                                  ;
 42888                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 42889                                  ;
 42890                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 42891                                  ;
 42892                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 42893                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 42894                                  ;                   AX has error code
 42895                                  ;               Carry Reset
 42896                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 42897                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 42898                                  ; NOTE:
 42899                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42900                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42901                                  ;
 42902                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42903                                  
 42904                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42905                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42906                                  
 42907                                  SFFromHandle:
 42908 00007321 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 42909                                  	;retc				; return if error
 42910 00007324 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 42911 00007326 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 42912                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42913                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42914                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42915                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42916                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42917                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42918 0000732A 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 42919                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42920                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42921                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42922                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42923                                  GetSF:
 42924 0000732C 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 42925 0000732D 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 42926 00007330 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 42927 00007332 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 42928 00007335 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 42929 00007336 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 42930                                  
 42931                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 42932                                  
 42933                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 42934                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42935                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 42936                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 42937                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 42938                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 42939                                  ;
 42940                                  ;   NOTE:
 42941                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 42942                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42943                                  ;
 42944                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 42945                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42946                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 42947                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 42948                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 42949                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42950                                  
 42951                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42952                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 42953                                  
 42954                                  SFFromSFN:
 42955                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42956                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42957 00007337 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42958                                  
 42959                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 42960 0000733C 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 42961                                  sfsfn5:	
 42962                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 42963 00007341 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 42964 00007345 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 42965                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 42966 00007347 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 42967 0000734B 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 42968                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 42969 0000734E 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 42970 00007351 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 42971 00007353 F9                      	STC
 42972 00007354 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 42973                                  sfsfn7:
 42974 00007355 50                      	push	ax
 42975                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 42976                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 42977                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 42978                                  	
 42979                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42980 00007356 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 42981                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42982                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 42983                                  	
 42984 00007358 F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 42985 0000735A 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 42986 0000735C 58                      	pop	ax
 42987                                  	;add	di,6
 42988 0000735D 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 42989 00007360 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 42990                                  
 42991                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 42992                                  
 42993                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 42994                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42995                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 42996                                  ;
 42997                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 42998                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42999                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43000                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43001                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43002                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43003                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43004                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43005                                  
 43006                                  JFNFree:
 43007 00007361 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43008                                  jfnf1:	
 43009 00007363 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43010 00007366 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43011 00007368 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43012 0000736C 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43013 0000736E 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43014 0000736F EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43015                                  
 43016                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43017                                  jfnf5:	
 43018                                  	;mov	al,4
 43019 00007371 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43020                                  jfnfx:	
 43021 00007373 C3                      	retn				; bye
 43022                                  
 43023                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43024                                  
 43025                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43026                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43027                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43028                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43029                                  ;
 43030                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43031                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43032                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43033                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43034                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43035                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43036                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43037                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43038                                  ;
 43039                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43040                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43041                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43042                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43043                                  ;
 43044                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43045                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43046                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43047                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43048                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43049                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43050                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43051                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43052                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43053                                  
 43054                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43055                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43056                                  
 43057                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43058                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43059                                  
 43060                                  SFNFree:
 43061                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43062                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43063                                  	;
 43064                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43065 00007374 50                      	push	ax
 43066 00007375 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43067                                  sfnf5:	
 43068 00007377 53                      	push	bx
 43069 00007378 E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43070 0000737B 5B                      	pop	bx
 43071 0000737C 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43072 0000737E 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43073                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43074 00007382 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43075                                  	
 43076                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43077 00007384 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43078                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43079 00007388 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43080                                  sfnf7:	
 43081 0000738A 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43082 0000738B EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43083                                  
 43084                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43085                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43086                                  ;
 43087                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43088                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43089                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43090                                  
 43091                                  sfnf10:	
 43092 0000738D 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43093                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43094 00007391 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43095 00007395 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43096 00007397 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43097                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43098 0000739B 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43099 0000739F 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43100                                  
 43101                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43102                                  ;
 43103                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43104                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43105                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43106                                  
 43107                                  sfnf20:
 43108                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43109                                  
 43110                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43111 000073A1 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43112                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43113                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43114                                  
 43115 000073A6 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43116                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43117 000073AA 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43118 000073AE 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43119                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43120 000073B2 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43121                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43122                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43123                                  	;pop	ax
 43124                                  	;;clc
 43125                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43126                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43127 000073B6 58                      	pop	ax
 43128                                  	;clc
 43129 000073B7 C3                      	retn
 43130                                  
 43131                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43132                                  ;
 43133                                  ;	'C' set
 43134                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43135                                  
 43136                                  sfnf95: 
 43137 000073B8 58                      	pop	ax
 43138                                  
 43139                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43140                                  %if 0
 43141                                  	;mov	al,4
 43142                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43143                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43144                                  %else
 43145                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43146                                  	;;;
 43147 000073B9 EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43148                                  	;;;
 43149                                  %endif

 43159                                  
 43160                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43161                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43162                                  ;
 43163                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43164                                  ;
 43165                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43166                                  ;		path
 43167                                  ;
 43168                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43169                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43170                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43171                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43172                                  ;
 43173                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43174                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 43175                                  ;	USES	all
 43176                                  ;
 43177                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43178                                  
 43179                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43180                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43181

 43199                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43200                                  ;
 43201                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network

 43203                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.

 43215

 43217                                  ; -1.

 44291                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 44292                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44293                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 44294                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 44295                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 44296                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 44297                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 44298                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 44299                                  ;
 44300                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 44301                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 44302                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 44303                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 44304                                  ;	USES	none
 44305                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44306                                  
 44307                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44308                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44309                                  CheckOwner:
 44310                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44311                                  
 44312 000076B4 E86AFC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 44313 000076B7 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 44314                                  
 44315 000076B9 50                      	push	ax
 44316                                  
 44317                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44318                                  
 44319                                  ;SR; WIN386 patch - Do not check for USER_ID for using handles since these 
 44320                                  ;SR; are shared across multiple VMs in win386.

 44326

 44352                                  ; Retro	DOS v3.0 - 11/07/2018

 44355                                  
 44356                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 44357                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 44358                                  
 44359                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 44360                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 44361                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 44362                                  
 44363                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 44364                                  ;
 44365                                  ;	$AssignOper
 44366                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 44367                                  ;	InitCDS
 44368                                  ;	$UserOper
 44369                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 44370                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 44371                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 44372                                  ;
 44373                                  ;   Revision history:
 44374                                  ;
 44375                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 44376                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 44377                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 44378                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 44379                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 44380                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 44381                                  ;				    aliasing.
 44382                                  ;
 44383                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 44384                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 44385                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 44386                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 44387                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 44388                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 44389                                  ;
 44390                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 44391                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 44392                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 44393                                  ;
 44394                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 44395                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 44396                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 44397                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 44398                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 44399                                  ;
 44400                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 44401                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 44402                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 44403                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 44404                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 44405                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 44406                                  ;
 44407                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 44408                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 44409                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 44410                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 44411                                  ;   number.
 44412                                  ;
 44413                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 44414                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 44415                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 44416                                  ;   TransPath.
 44417                                  ;
 44418                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 44419                                  
 44420                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 44421                                  
 44422                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 44423                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 44424                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 44425                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 44426                                  ;					; current drive)
 44427                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 44428                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 44429                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 44430                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 44431                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 44432                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 44433                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 44434                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 44435                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 44436                                  
 44437                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 44438                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44439                                  ; Inputs:
 44440                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 44441                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 44442                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 44443                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 44444                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 44445                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 44446                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 44447                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 44448                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 44449                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 44450                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44451                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 44452                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 44453                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 44454                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 44455                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 44456                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 44457                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 44458                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 44459                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 44460                                  ; Function:
 44461                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 44462                                  ; Returns:
 44463                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 44464                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44465                                  
 44466                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 44537                                  ;Break <FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a drive number>
 44538                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44539                                  ;**	FIND_DPB - Find a DPB from a Drive #
 44540                                  ;
 44541                                  ;	ENTRY	AL has drive number A = 0
 44542                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set
 44543                                  ;		    No DPB for this drive number
 44544                                  ;		'C' clear
 44545                                  ;		    DS:SI points to DPB for drive
 44546                                  ;	USES	SI, DS, Flags

 44548                                  
 44549                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44550                                  FIND_DPB:

 44552                                  fdpb5:

 44554 00007716 7409                    	JZ	short fdpb10
 44555 00007718 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si]

 44557 0000771A 7406                    	jz	short ret_label15	; Carry clear (retz)
 44558                                  	;;lds	si,[si+18h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 44559                                  	;lds	si,[si+19h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 44560 0000771C C57419                  	LDS	SI,[SI+DPB.NEXT_DPB]
 44561 0000771F EBF2                    	JMP	short fdpb5
 44562                                  fdpb10:

 44564                                  ret_label15:

 44567                                  ;	Break <InitCDS - set up an empty CDS>
 44568                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44569                                  ;**	InitCDS - Setup an Empty CDS
 44570                                  ;
 44571                                  ;	ENTRY	ThisCDS points to CDS
 44572                                  ;		AL has uppercase drive letter
 44573                                  ;	EXIT	ThisCDS is now empty
 44574                                  ;		(ES:DI) = CDS
 44575                                  ;		'C' set if no DPB associated with drive
 44576                                  ;	USES	AH,ES,DI, Flags

 44637                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 44638                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44639                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 44640                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 44641                                  ;
 44642                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 44643                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 44644                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 44645                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 44646                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 44647                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 44648                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 44649                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 44650                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 44651                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 44652                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 44653                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44654                                  
 44655                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 44656                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44657                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44658                                  _$UserOper:
 44659                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44660                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)

 44663                                  	;POP	AX
 44664                                  	; 01/07/2024

 44667 00007774 742B                    	JZ	short UserSet 		; set the current user

 44680                                  	;;;
