 44949                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 44950                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44951                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 44952                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 44953                                  ;
 44954                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 44955                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 44956                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 44957                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 44958                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 44959                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 44960                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 44961                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44962                                  
 44963                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44964                                  TransFCB:
 44965                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44966                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 44967                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 44968                                  	;ENTER
 44969 0000784A 55                      	push	bp
 44970 0000784B 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 44971                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 44972 0000784D 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 44973 00007850 16                      	push	ss
 44974 00007851 07                      	pop	es
 44975 00007852 06                      	push	es
 44976 00007853 57                      	push	di
 44977                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 44978                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 44979 00007854 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 44980 00007857 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 44981 0000785D 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 44982 00007863 E89AA9                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 44983                                  	; 06/12/2022
 44984 00007866 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 44985 00007868 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 44986 0000786B 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 44987 0000786F 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 44988                                  GetDrive:
 44989 00007875 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 44990 00007876 E862FF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 44991 00007879 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 44992 0000787B E86F03                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 44993                                  
 44994                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 44995                                  
 44996                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 44997 0000787E B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 44998 00007881 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 44999                                  FCBScan:
 45000 00007882 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 45001                                  	
 45002                                  	; 09/08/2018
 45003                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 45004                                  	;es	xlat
 45005                                  
 45006                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 45007 00007883 E8B8E1                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 45008                                  
 45009                                  	;test	al,8	
 45010 00007886 A808                    	test	al,FFCB
 45011 00007888 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 45012                                  NextCh: 
 45013 0000788A E2F6                    	loop	FCBScan
 45014 0000788C 5E                      	pop	si
 45015 0000788D 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 45016 0000788F E8CBAD                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 45017 00007892 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 45018 00007893 07                      	pop	es
 45019 00007894 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 45020 00007895 1F                      	pop	ds
 45021                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45022                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 45023 00007896 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]
 45024 00007899 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 45025 0000789C 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 45026 0000789E 55                      	push	bp
 45027 0000789F E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 45028 000078A2 5D                      	pop	bp
 45029 000078A3 7303                    	jnc	short FCBRet		; bye with transPath error code
 45030                                  BadPack:
 45031 000078A5 F9                      	STC
 45032                                  	;mov	al,3
 45033 000078A6 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found
 45034                                  FCBRet: 
 45035                                  	;LEAVE
 45036 000078A8 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 45037 000078AA 5D                      	pop	bp
 45038                                  TransPath_retn:
 45039 000078AB C3                      	retn
 45040                                  
 45041                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45042                                  
 45043                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45044                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45045                                  ;
 45046                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45047                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45048                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45049                                  ;       exactly.
 45050                                  ;
 45051                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45052                                  ;       matches splice.
 45053                                  ;
 45054                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45055                                  ;
 45056                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45057                                  ;
 45058                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45059                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45060                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45061                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45062                                  ;
 45063                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45064                                  ;
 45065                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45066                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45067                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45068                                  ;
 45069                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45070                                  ;
 45071                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45072                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45073                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45074                                  ;           splice
 45075                                  ;           fatRead
 45076                                  ;           return
 45077                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45078                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45079                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45080                                  ;           return
 45081                                  ;       if device then
 45082                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45083                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45084                                  ;           return
 45085                                  ;       if file then
 45086                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45087                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45088                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45089                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45090                                  ;           splice
 45091                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45092                                  ;           if local then
 45093                                  ;               fatread
 45094                                  ;           return
 45095                                  ;
 45096                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45097                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45098                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45099                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45100                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45101                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45102                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45103                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45104                                  ;
 45105                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45106                                  
 45107                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45108                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45109                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45110                                  
 45111                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45112                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45113                                  
 45114                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45115                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45116                                  
 45117                                  TransPath:
 45118 000078AC 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45119 000078AE EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45120                                  TransPathSet:
 45121 000078B0 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45122                                  SetSplice:
 45123 000078B2 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	; NoSetDir = !fExact;	;smr;SS Override
 45124 000078B6 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45125                                  TransPathNoSet:
 45126 000078B8 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		; fSplice = TRUE;	;smr;SS Override
 45127 000078BC 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 45128 000078C2 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 45129 000078C7 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45130 000078CE 16                      	push	ss
 45131 000078CF 07                      	pop	es
 45132                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45133 000078D0 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 45134                                  ;
 45135                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 45136                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 45137                                  ;
 45138                                  	;TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 45139                                  	;JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 45140                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45141                                  	;;;
 45142 000078D4 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 45143 000078DA 7435                    	jz	short CheckUNC
 45144                                  	;;;
 45145                                  ;
 45146                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 45147                                  ;
 45148 000078DC E8F802                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 45149 000078DF E8F9FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 45150 000078E2 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 45151 000078E4 E80603                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 45152 000078E7 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 45153 000078EA E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 45154 000078ED 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 45155                                  ;
 45156                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 45157                                  ;
 45158 000078EF 16                      	push	ss
 45159 000078F0 1F                      	pop	ds
 45160 000078F1 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 45161 000078F5 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45162 000078FA 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 45163 000078FC E82D02                  	CALL    Splice
 45164                                  NoServerSplice:
 45165 000078FF 16                      	push	ss
 45166 00007900 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 45167 00007901 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 45168 00007905 E8909F                  	call	ECritDisk
 45169 00007908 E8BFE8                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45170 0000790B E8B79F                  	call	LCritDisk
 45171                                  NoPath:
 45172                                  	;mov	al,3
 45173 0000790E B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45174 00007910 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 45175                                  
 45176                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 45177                                  ; the name if so.
 45178                                  
 45179                                  CheckUNC:
 45180 00007911 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 45181                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 45182 00007918 B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 45183 0000791B CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 45184                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 45185                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 45186                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 45187 0000791D 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 45188                                  
 45189                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 45190                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 45191                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 45192                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 45193                                  
 45194                                  NO_CHECK:
 45195 0000791F E8B502                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 45196 00007922 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 45197 00007923 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 45198 00007925 E831E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45199 00007928 86C4                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 45200 0000792A E82CE1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 45201 0000792D 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 45202 0000792F 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 45203 00007931 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 45204                                  
 45205                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 45206                                  ; local machine root path
 45207                                  
 45208 00007933 58                      	POP     AX
 45209 00007934 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 45210                                  UNCCpy:
 45211 00007935 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 45212 00007936 E8CDE0                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 45213 00007939 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45214 0000793B 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 45215 0000793D E819E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 45216 00007940 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 45217 00007942 AA                      	STOSB
 45218 00007943 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 45219 00007945 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 45220                                  UNCDone:
 45221 00007948 16                      	push	ss
 45222 00007949 1F                      	pop	ds
 45223 0000794A C3                       	retn				; return error code
 45224                                  UNCTerm:
 45225 0000794B AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 45226 0000794C EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 45227                                  
 45228                                  CheckDevice:
 45229                                  
 45230                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 45231                                  
 45232 0000794E 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 45233 0000794F 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 45234 00007952 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 45235                                  	;mov	al,2 
 45236 00007954 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 45237 00007956 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 45238 00007957 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 45239                                  CheckPath:
 45240 00007958 50                      	push	ax
 45241 00007959 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 45242                                  
 45243                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45244                                  %if 0
 45245                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45246                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45247                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45248                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45249                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45250                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45251                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45252                                  ;;;
 45253                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45254                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45255                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45256                                  ;;;
 45257                                  ;;;More info:
 45258                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45259                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45260                                  ;;;
 45261                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45262                                  start5Dhack:
 45263                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 45264                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 45265                                  
 45266                                  %endif
 45267                                  
 45268                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45269                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BECBh
 45270                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC47h)
 45271                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6C2h))
 45272                                  %if 0
 45273                                  	call	no5Dshere
 45274                                  %else
 45275                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45276                                  
 45277                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45278                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 45279 0000795A E8C0D3                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 45280                                  %endif
 45281 0000795D 5D                      	pop	bp
 45282 0000795E 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 45283 0000795F 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 45284                                  
 45285                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 45286                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 45287                                  ; call.
 45288                                  
 45289 00007961 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 45290 00007967 E871FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 45291 0000796A 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 45292                                  
 45293                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 45294                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 45295                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 45296                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 45297                                  ; a device.
 45298                                  
 45299 00007970 E87A02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 45300 00007973 B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 45301 00007975 AA                      	STOSB
 45302 00007976 E8299E                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 45303                                  
 45304 00007979 F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 45305 0000797A 16                      	push	ss
 45306 0000797B 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 45307                                  DoFile_retn:
 45308 0000797C C3                      	retn
 45309                                  
 45310                                  ; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 45311                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:BEEEh
 45312                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:AC6Ah)
 45313                                  ; ((Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:A6F2h))
 45314                                  ;%if 1
 45315                                  
 45316                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45317                                  %if 0
 45318                                  
 45319                                  no5Dshere:
 45320                                  	; 10/08/2018
 45321                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 45322                                  %endif
 45323                                  
 45324                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 45325                                  
 45326                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 45327                                  
 45328                                  DoFile:
 45329                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45330                                  
 45331 0000797D E83FFE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 45332                                  	;mov	al,3 
 45333 00007980 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 45334 00007982 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 45335                                  
 45336                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 45337                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 45338                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 45339                                  
 45340                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 45341 00007984 1E                      	push	ds
 45342 00007985 56                      	push	si
 45343 00007986 06                      	push	es
 45344 00007987 57                      	push	di
 45345 00007988 E8C5D2                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 45346                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 45347 0000798B 5F                      	pop	di
 45348 0000798C 07                      	pop	es
 45349 0000798D 5E                      	pop	si
 45350 0000798E 1F                      	pop	ds
 45351                                  	;mov	al,3
 45352 0000798F B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45353                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 45354 00007991 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45355                                  
 45356                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 45357                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 45358                                  
 45359 00007993 1E                      	push	ds
 45360 00007994 56                      	push	si
 45361 00007995 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 45362 0000799A 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 45363                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 45364 0000799C 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 45365                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 45366 0000799F 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 45367                                  					;AN000;
 45368 000079A3 E80B9E                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 45369 000079A6 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 45370                                  
 45371                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 45372                                  
 45373 000079A7 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 45374 000079A9 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 45375 000079AD 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 45376 000079AF AA                      	STOSB
 45377                                  
 45378                                  ; Now get original string.
 45379                                  
 45380                                  GetOrig:
 45381 000079B0 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 45382 000079B1 5E                      	pop	si
 45383 000079B2 1F                      	pop	ds
 45384                                  
 45385                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 45386                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 45387                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 45389 000079B3 E8CE00                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 45390 000079B6 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 45391 000079B8 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 45392 000079BA 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 45393                                  ;
 45394                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 45395                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 45396                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 45397                                  ;
 45398 000079BC 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 45399                                  SkipPath:
 45400 000079BE AC                      	LODSB
 45401 000079BF E897E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45402 000079C2 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 45403 000079C4 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45404 000079C5 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 45405 000079C7 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 45406                                  
 45407                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 45408                                  ; for yucks.
 45409                                  
 45410                                  PathAssure:
 45411 000079C9 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 45412 000079CB AA                      	STOSB
 45413                                  
 45414                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 45415                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 45416                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 45417                                  
 45418                                  DoCanon:
 45419 000079CC E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 45420                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 45421 000079CF 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 45422                                  
 45423                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 45424                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 45425                                  ; buffer.
 45426                                  
 45427 000079D1 16                      	push	ss
 45428 000079D2 1F                      	pop	ds
 45429 000079D3 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 45430 000079D7 C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 45431 000079DB E81702                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 45432 000079DE 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 45433                                  
 45434                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 45435                                  
 45436 000079E0 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 45437 000079E3 E873E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 45438 000079E6 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 45439                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 45440 000079E8 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 45441 000079EC 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 45442 000079EE 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 45443 000079EF 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 45444                                  
 45445                                  ; Splice the result.
 45446                                  
 45447                                  DoSplice:
 45448 000079F4 16                      	push	ss
 45449 000079F5 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 45450 000079F6 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 45451 000079FA 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 45452 000079FC F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 45453 00007A01 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 45454 00007A03 E82601                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 45455                                  SkipSplice:
 45456                                  
 45457                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 45458                                  ; device.
 45459                                  
 45460 00007A06 16                      	push	ss
 45461 00007A07 1F                      	pop	ds
 45462 00007A08 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 45463                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 45464                                  	; 17/12/2022
 45465                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h
 45466 00007A0C 26F6454480              	test	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],curdir_isnet>>8 ; 04/12/2022
 45467                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; 8000h
 45468 00007A11 750D                    	JNZ	short Done		; net, no fatread necessary (retnz)
 45469 00007A13 E30B                    	JCXZ    Done
 45470 00007A15 E8809E                  	call	ECritDisk
 45471 00007A18 E8AFE7                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 45472 00007A1B E8A79E                  	call	LCritDisk
 45473                                  	;mov	al, 3
 45474 00007A1E B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45475                                  Done:   
 45476 00007A20 C3                      	retn                         ; any errors in carry flag.
 45477                                  
 45478                                  ; 13/07/2018
 45479                                  
 45480                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 45481                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45482                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 45483                                  ;
 45484                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45485                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 45486                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 45487                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 45488                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45489                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 45490                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 45491                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 45492                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 45493                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 45494                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45495                                  
 45496                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45497                                  
 45498                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45499                                  
 45500                                  Canonicalize:
 45501                                  
 45502                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 45503                                  
 45504 00007A21 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 45505 00007A22 E834E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 45506 00007A25 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 45507 00007A27 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 45508 00007A29 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 45509 00007A2B AA                      	STOSB
 45510 00007A2C EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 45511                                  CanonDec:
 45512 00007A2E 4E                      	DEC     SI
 45513                                  
 45514                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 45515                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 45516                                  ; buffer.
 45517                                  
 45518                                  CanonLoop:
 45519                                  
 45520                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 45521                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 45522                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 45523                                  
 45524 00007A2F 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 45525 00007A31 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 45526 00007A33 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 45527 00007A35 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 45528 00007A3A 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 45529 00007A3C B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 45530 00007A3E AA                      	STOSB
 45531 00007A3F 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 45532                                  DoTerminate:
 45533 00007A41 AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 45534 00007A42 F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 45535 00007A43 C3                      	retn
 45536                                  
 45537                                  CanonBad:
 45538 00007A44 E8C701                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 45539                                  	;mov	al,3
 45540 00007A47 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for bad path error
 45541 00007A49 7402                    	JZ	short PathEnc		; path character encountered in string
 45542                                  	;mov	al,2
 45543 00007A4B B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set bad file error
 45544                                  PathEnc:
 45545 00007A4D F9                      	STC
 45546                                  CanonBad_retn:
 45547 00007A4E C3                      	retn
 45548                                  
 45549                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 45550                                  ; it to 8.3
 45551                                  
 45552                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 45553 00007A4F E84C00                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 45554 00007A52 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 45555                                  
 45556                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases. These will be backed up.
 45557                                  
 45558                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 45559 00007A54 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 45560 00007A58 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1
 45561                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'..'
 45562 00007A5A 26813D2E2E              	CMP     WORD [ES:DI],2E2Eh
 45563 00007A5F 7508                    	JNZ	short CanonNormal
 45564 00007A61 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           d--;
 45565                                  Skip1:  
 45566 00007A62 E82800                  	CALL    SkipBack                ;           SkipBack ();
 45567                                  	;;mov	al,3
 45568                                  	; 07/07/2024 (*)
 45569                                  	;MOV    AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 45570 00007A65 72E7                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn ; AL=3 (*)
 45571 00007A67 EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }
 45572                                  
 45573                                  ; We have a normal path. Advance destination pointer over it.
 45574                                  
 45575                                  CanonNormal:                            ;       else
 45576 00007A69 01CF                    	ADD     DI,CX                   ;           d += ct;
 45577                                  
 45578                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path
 45579                                  ; sep char or are pointing at a nul or are pointing at something else.
 45580                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.
 45581                                  
 45582                                  CanonPath:
 45583 00007A6B E81600                  	CALL    PathSep
 45584 00007A6E 75D4                    	JNZ	short CanonBad		; something else...
 45585                                  
 45586                                  ; Copy the first path char we see.
 45587                                  
 45588 00007A70 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get the char
 45589 00007A71 E8E5DF                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it path char?
 45590 00007A74 75B8                    	JNZ	short CanonDec		; no, go test for nul
 45591 00007A76 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ; beyond buffer end?
 45592 00007A78 73CA                    	JAE	short CanonBad		; yep, error.
 45593 00007A7A AA                      	STOSB                           ; copy the one byte
 45594                                  
 45595                                  ; Skip all remaining path chars
 45596                                  
 45597                                  CanonPathLoop:
 45598 00007A7B AC                      	LODSB                           ; get next byte
 45599 00007A7C E8DADF                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; path char again?
 45600 00007A7F 74FA                    	JZ	short CanonPathLoop	; yep, grab another
 45601 00007A81 4E                      	DEC     SI                      ; back up
 45602 00007A82 EBAB                    	JMP	short  CanonLoop	; go copy component
 45603                                  
 45604                                  ;BREAK <PathSep - determine if char is a path separator>
 45605                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45606                                  ;   PathSep - look at DS:SI and see if char is / \ or NUL
 45607                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to a char
 45608                                  ;   Outputs:    AL has char from DS:SI (/ => \)
 45609                                  ;               Zero set if AL is / \ or NUL
 45610                                  ;               Zero reset otherwise
 45611                                  ;   Registers modified: AL
 45612                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45613                                  
 45614                                  PathSep:

 45616                                  PathSepGotCh:				; already have character

 45619                                  	;call	PATHCHRCMP              ; check for path character
 45620                                  	;retn				; and return HIS determination

 45625                                  ;BREAK <SkipBack - move backwards to a path separator>
 45626                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45627                                  ;   SkipBack - look at ES:DI and backup until it points to a / ;   Inputs:     ES:DI - point to a char
 45629                                  ;               BX has current directory back up limit (point to a / \)
 45630                                  ;   Outputs:    ES:DI backed up to point to a path char
 45631                                  ;               AL has char from output ES:DI (path sep if carry clear)
 45632                                  ;               Carry set if illegal backup
 45633                                  ;               Carry Clear if ok
 45634                                  ;   Registers modified: DI,AL
 45635                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45636                                  
 45637                                  SkipBack:

 45639 00007A8F 720A                    	JB	short SkipBad		;       if (d < dlim)
 45640 00007A91 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           goto err;
 45641 00007A92 268A05                  	MOV     AL,[ES:DI]		;       if (pathchr (*--d))
 45642 00007A95 E8C1DF                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ;           break;
 45643 00007A98 75F3                    	JNZ	short SkipBack		;       }
 45644                                  	;CLC				;   return (0);
 45645                                  	; 01/07/2024
 45646                                  	; cf=0

 45648                                  SkipBad:                                ;err:
 45649                                  	;mov	al,3
 45650 00007A9B B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; bad path error

 45653                                  	; cf=1
 45654 00007A9D C3                      	retn				;

 45656                                  ;Break <CopyComponent - copy out a file path component>
 45657                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45658                                  ;   CopyComponent - copy a file component from a path string (DS:SI) into ES:DI
 45659                                  ;
 45660                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source path
 45661                                  ;               ES:DI - destination
 45662                                  ;               ES:BP - end of buffer
 45663                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - too long
 45664                                  ;               Carry Clear - DS:SI moved past component
 45665                                  ;                   CX has length of destination
 45666                                  ;   Registers modified: AX,CX,DX
 45667                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45668                                  
 45669                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 45695 00007AB3 740B                    	JZ	short NulTerm

 45721                                  DoPack:                                 ;           }

 45774                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 45775                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45776                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 45777                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 45778                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 45779                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 45780                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 45781                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 45782                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 45783                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 45784                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 45785                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise
 45786                                  ;               ThisCDS points to proper CDS if spliced, otherwise it is
 45787                                  ;                   left alone
 45788                                  ;               ThisDPB points to proper DPB
 45789                                  ;   Registers modified: DS:SI, ES:DI, BX,AX,CX
 45790                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45791                                  
 45792                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45793                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C0A6h
 45794                                  
 45795                                  Splice:

 45871                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 45872                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45873                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 45874                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 45875                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 45876                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 45877                                  ;
 45878                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 45879                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 45880                                  ;   Outputs:
 45881                                  ;       Carry Clear
 45882                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 45883                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 45884                                  ;       Carry Set
 45885                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 45886                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 45887                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45888                                  
 45889                                  _$NameTrans:
 45890 00007BB2 1E                      	push	ds
 45891 00007BB3 56                      	push	si
 45892 00007BB4 06                      	push	es
 45893 00007BB5 57                      	push	di
 45894 00007BB6 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 45895                                  	
 45896                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45897                                  ; M027 - Start
 45898                                  ;
 45899                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 45900                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 45901                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 45902                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 45903                                  ; and restore CX.
 45904                                  
 45905                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 45906 00007BB7 B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 45907 00007BB9 E8EE02                  	call	SetAttrib
 45908                                  
 45909                                  ; M027 - End
 45910                                  
 45911                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 45912 00007BBC BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF
 45913 00007BBF E8EAFC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 45914 00007BC2 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0

 45930                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45931                                  ;   DriveFromText - examine DS:SI and remove a drive letter, advancing the
 45932                                  ;   pointer.

 45961                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.

 45978                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 45979                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45980                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 45981                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 45982                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 45983                                  ;
 45984                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 45985                                  ;               ES:DI string
 45986                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 45987                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 45988                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 45989                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 45990                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45992                                  PathPref:

 45994 00007BF8 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte

 45996 00007BFB 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ

 45998 00007BFE 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 45999 00007C01 E855DE                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 46000 00007C04 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)

 46006 00007C0D C3                      	retn

 46042                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 46043                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46044                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46045                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46046                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46047                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46048                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46049                                  ;
 46050                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46051                                  ;       ------          --------
 46052                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46053                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46054                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46055                                  ;
 46056                                  ;   Error returns:
 46057                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46058                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46059                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46060                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46062                                  
 46063                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46064                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 46065                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46066                                  ;
 46067                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46068                                  ;
 46069                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46070                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46071                                  ;
 46072                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46073                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46074                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46075                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46076                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46077                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46078                                  ;	USES	all
 46079                                  ;
 46080                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46081                                  
 46082                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46083                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 46330                                  ;

 46332                                  ;	initial attributes contained in CX

 46337                                  ;		  (ax) = error code

 46355                                  ;	BREAK <$CHMOD - change file attributes>
 46356                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46357                                  ;
 46358                                  ;**	$CHMOD - Change File Attributes
 46359                                  ;
 46360                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46361                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46362                                  ;	    MOV     CX, attributes
 46363                                  ;	    MOV     AL,func (0=get, 1=set)
 46364                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46365                                  ;   Error returns:
 46366                                  ;	    AX = error_path_not_found
 46367                                  ;	    AX = error_access_denied
 46368                                  ;
 46369                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46370                                  
 46371                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46372                                  
 46373                                  	; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46374                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C27Ch
 46375                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AFF4h)
 46376                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0AAB2h)
 46377                                  
 46378                                  _$CHMOD:
 46379                                  	; 14/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46380                                  	;;;
 46381 00007CFC 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh		; MS-DOS 7.20 (Win98) - EXTENDED-LENGTH FILENAME OPERATIONS
 46382                                  				; AX = 43FFh
 46383                                  				; BP = 5053h ('PS')
 46384                                  				; CL = function
 46385                                  				; 39h "mkdir" create directory
 46386                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ pathname
 46387                                  				; 56h rename file
 46388                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ filename of existing file (no wildcards)
 46389                                  				; ES:DI -> ASCIZ new filename (no wildcards)
 46390                                  				;
 46391                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
 46392 00007CFE 7520                    	jnz	short std_chmod
 46393 00007D00 81FD5350                	cmp	bp,5053h

 46500                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 46501                                  ;
 46502                                  ;
 46503                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 46504                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 46505                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 46506                                  ;	     MOV     CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 46507                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 46508                                  ;	    INT     21h
 46509                                  ;
 46510                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 46511                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 46512                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 46513                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46514                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46515                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 46516                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 46517                                  ;
 46518                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46519                                  
 46520                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46521                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h

 46527 00007D67 E846FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path
 46528 00007D6A 59                      	pop	cx

 46531 00007D73 750E                    	JNZ	short NotFound

 46533 00007D76 1F                      	pop	ds

 46536 00007D79 E82E01                  	call	SetAttrib

 46538                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 46539                                  	; 17/12/2022
