 46685                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 46686                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46687                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry. Return a file handle if there
 46688                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 46689                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 46690                                  ;
 46691                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 46692                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 46693                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 46694                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 46695                                  ;		Carry Set:
 46696                                  ;		    AX has error code
 46697                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 46698                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46699                                  
 46700                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 46701 00007DFB 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 46702 00007DFC B9[D530]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 46703 00007DFF E9F1FE                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 46704                                  
 46705                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 46706                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46707                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 46708                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 46709                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 46710                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 46711                                  ;
 46712                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 46713                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 46714                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 46715                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 46716                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46717                                  
 46718                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 46719                                  ;BinToAscii:
 46720                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 46721                                  ;bta5:
 46722                                  ;	push    cx
 46723                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 46724                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 46725                                  ;	push    ax
 46726                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 46727                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 46728                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 46729                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 46730                                  ;	add     al,7
 46731                                  ;bta6: 
 46732                                  ;	stosb
 46733                                  ;	pop     ax
 46734                                  ;	pop     cx
 46735                                  ;	loop    bta5
 46736                                  ;	retn
 46737                                  
 46738                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46739                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 & Windows ME
 46740                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0B0D9h)
 46741                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0ABA4h)
 46742                                  %if 0
 46743                                  
 46744                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46745                                  BinToAscii:
 46746                                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 46747                                  bta5:	
 46748                                  	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 46749                                  	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 46750                                  	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 46751                                  	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 46752                                  	STOSB				; drop in the character
 46753                                  	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 46754                                  	dec	ch
 46755                                  	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 46756                                  	retn
 46757                                  %else
 46758                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46759                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C385h
 46760                                  
 46761                                  BinToAscii:
 46762 00007E02 50                      	push	ax		; convert a number to a string ; ax = value
 46763 00007E03 86C4                    	xchg	ah,al
 46764                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46765 00007E05 D410                    	aam	10h		; AH = AL / 16 and AL = remainder
 46766 00007E07 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; 'AA'
 46767 00007E0A AB                      	stosw
 46768 00007E0B 58                      	pop	ax
 46769                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 46770 00007E0C D410                    	aam	10h
 46771 00007E0E 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; add ax,'AA'
 46772 00007E11 AB                      	stosw
 46773 00007E12 C3                      	retn	
 46774                                  %endif
 46775                                  
 46776                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 46777                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46778                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 46779                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 46780                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 46781                                  ;
 46782                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 46783                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 46784                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 46785                                  ;		AX has handle
 46786                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 46787                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46788                                  
 46789                                  	; 10/07/2024
 46790                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46791                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46792                                  
 46793                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 46794                                  	;Enter
 46795 00007E13 55                      	push	bp
 46796 00007E14 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 46797                                  
 46798                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 46799                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 46800                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 46801                                  
 46802 00007E16 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 46803                                  
 46804                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 46805 00007E19 F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 46806 00007E1D 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 46807                                  
 46808                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 46809                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 46810                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 46811                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 46812                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 46813                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 46814                                  
 46815                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 46816 00007E1F B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 46817 00007E22 EB7A                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 46818                                  
 46819                                  OKatts:
 46820                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 46821 00007E24 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 46822                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 46823 00007E27 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 46824                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 46825 00007E2A 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 46826                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 46827 00007E2D 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 46828 00007E30 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 46829 00007E31 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 46830 00007E32 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 46831 00007E34 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 46832 00007E36 F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 46833                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46834 00007E38 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 46835 00007E3A 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 46836                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 46837                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46838                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46839 00007E3C 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 46840                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 46841                                  okok:					;AN000;
 46842 00007E3D 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 46843 00007E3F F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 46844                                  					;AN000;
 46845 00007E41 4F                      	DEC	DI			; point back to the null
 46846 00007E42 268A45FF                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI-1]		; Get char before the NUL
 46847 00007E46 E810DC                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; Is it a path separator?
 46848 00007E49 7403                    	JZ	short SETENDPTR		; Yes
 46849                                  STOREPTH:
 46850 00007E4B B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 46851 00007E4D AA                      	STOSB				; Add a path separator (and INC DI)
 46852                                  SETENDPTR:
 46853                                  	; 10/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 46854                                  	;MOV	EndPtrL,DI		; pointer to the tail
 46855                                  	; 09/07/2024 (Retro DOS v4 BugFix - Erdogan Tan - Istanbul)
 46856                                  	; (Note: I find this Retro DOS v4 Kernel bug while searching the reason
 46857                                  	;  of the AutoCAD R12 running/startup problem. Now it is solved here.)
 46858                                  	;mov	[bp-4],dl ; (Retro DOS v4 !Bug!)
 46859 00007E4E 897EFC                  	mov	[bp-4],di ; !Fix!
 46860                                  CreateLoop:
 46861 00007E51 16                      	push	ss			; let ReadTime see variables
 46862 00007E52 1F                      	pop	ds
 46863 00007E53 55                      	push	bp
 46864 00007E54 E8248D                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 46865 00007E57 5D                      	pop	bp
 46866                                  ;
 46867                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 46868                                  ;
 46869                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 46870 00007E58 C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]
 46871 00007E5B 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 46872 00007E5D E8A2FF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store upper word
 46873 00007E60 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 46874 00007E62 E89DFF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store lower word
 46875 00007E65 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 46876 00007E67 AA                      	STOSB				; nul terminate
 46877                                  	;LDS	DX,FilPtr		; get name
 46878 00007E68 C556F8                  	lds	dx,[bp-8]
 46879                                  	;MOV	CX,Attr 		; get attr
 46880 00007E6B 8B4EF6                  	mov	cx,[bp-10]
 46881 00007E6E 55                      	push	bp
 46882 00007E6F E889FF                  	CALL	_$CreateNewFile		; try to create a new file
 46883 00007E72 5D                      	pop	bp
 46884 00007E73 732A                    	JNC	short CreateDone	; failed, go try again
 46885                                  
 46886                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 46887                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 46888                                  
 46889                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 46890                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 46891                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists
 46892                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; file existed => try with new name
 46893                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_access_denied
 46894                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; access denied (attr mismatch)
 46895                                  
 46896                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46897                                  	;cmp	al,50h
 46898 00007E75 3C50                    	CMP	AL,error_file_exists	; Q: did file already exist
 46899 00007E77 74D8                    	JZ	short CreateLoop	; Y: try again
 46900                                  	;cmp	al,5
 46901 00007E79 3C05                    	CMP	AL,error_access_denied	; Q: was it access denied
 46902 00007E7B 7521                    	JNZ	short SETTMPERR		; N: Error out
 46903                                  					; Y: Check to see if we got this due
 46904                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 46905                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 46906                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 46907                                  					;    so.
 46908                                  ; 15/03/2024
 46909                                  %if 0
 46910                                  	CMP	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_net_access_denied ; M069
 46911                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 46912                                  	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 46913                                  ;M070
 46914                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 46915                                  ;
 46916                                  	cmp	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_FAIL_I24 ;User failed on I24? ;M070
 46917                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 46918                                  
 46919                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop	;attr mismatch, try again ;M070
 46920                                  	; 17/12/2022
 46921                                  	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 46922                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46923                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 46924                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 46925                                  %else
 46926                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46927                                  	;;;
 46928 00007E7D 36A0[2403]              	mov	al,[ss:EXTERR]
 46929 00007E81 3C41                    	cmp	al,41h			; error_net_access_denied
 46930 00007E83 7419                    	je	short SETTMPERR
 46931 00007E85 3C53                    	cmp	al,53h			; error_FAIL_I24
 46932 00007E87 7415                    	je	short SETTMPERR
 46933 00007E89 3C50                    	cmp	al,50h			; error_file_exists
 46934 00007E8B 74C4                    	je	short CreateLoop
 46935 00007E8D 36C43E[A205]            	les	di,[ss:THISCDS]
 46936 00007E92 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh ; -1
 46937 00007E95 74BA                    	je	short CreateLoop	; No CDS
 46938                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 46939                                  	;test	word [es:di+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 46940 00007E97 26F6454480              	test	byte [es:di+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 46941 00007E9C 75B3                    	jnz	short CreateLoop
 46942                                  	;;;
 46943                                  %endif
 46944                                  
 46945                                  ;;	MOV	AL,error_access_denied	; Return this "extended" error
 46946                                  					; M049 - end
 46947                                  SETTMPERR:
 46948 00007E9E F9                      	STC
 46949                                  CreateDone:
 46950                                  	;Leave
 46951 00007E9F 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 46952 00007EA1 5D                      	pop	bp
 46953 00007EA2 7203                    	JC	short CreateFail
 46954 00007EA4 E9D887                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; success!
 46955                                  CreateFail:
 46956 00007EA7 E9DF87                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 46957                                  
 46958                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 46959                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 46960                                  ;   serverdoscall.
 46961                                  ;
 46962                                  ;   Inputs:	fSharing == FALSE => set sattrib to CH
 46963                                  ;		fSharing == TRUE => set sattrib to CL
 46964                                  ;   Outputs:	none
 46965                                  ;   Registers changed:	CX
 46966                                  
 46967                                  SetAttrib:
 46968                                  	;test	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1		;smr;SS Override
 46969                                  	;jnz	short Set
 46970                                  	; 15/03/2024
 46971 00007EAA 36803E[7205]00          	cmp	byte [ss:FSHARING],0
 46972 00007EB0 7502                    	jnz	short Set
 46973                                  
 46974 00007EB2 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch
 46975                                  Set:
 46976 00007EB4 36880E[6D05]            	mov	byte [ss:SATTRIB],cl		;smr;SS Override
 46977 00007EB9 C3                      	retn
 46978

 46993                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 46994                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46995                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 46996                                  ;	 BX= mode
 46997                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 46998                                  ;	 DX= flag
 46999                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 47000                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 47001                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 47002                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 47003                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 47004                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE
 47005                                  ; Function: Extended Open
 47006                                  ; Output: carry clear
 47007                                  ;		     AX= handle
 47008                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened
 47009                                  ;			2 file created/opened
 47010                                  ;			3 file replaced/opened
 47011                                  ;	  carry set: AX has error code
 47012                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47013                                  
 47014                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47015                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47016                                  
 47017                                  _$Extended_Open:			  ;AN000;
 47018                                  	;ASSUME	CS:DOSCODE,SS:DOSDATA	  ;AN000;
 47019 00007EBE 368916[F405]            	MOV	[SS:EXTOPEN_FLAG],DX	  ;AN000;EO. save ext. open flag;smr;SS Override
 47020 00007EC3 36C706[F705]0000        	MOV	word [SS:EXTOPEN_IO_MODE],0 ;AN000;EO. initialize IO mode;smr;SS Override
 47021                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47022 00007ECA F6C6FE                  	test	dh,0FEh ; 04/12/2022 
 47023                                  	;;test	dx,0FE00h
 47024                                  	;TEST	DX,RESERVED_BITS_MASK	  ;AN000;EO. reserved bits 0 ?
 47025 00007ECD 75EB                    	JNZ	short ext_inval2	  ;AN000;EO. no
 47026 00007ECF 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL			  ;AN000;EO. make sure flag is right
 47027 00007ED1 80FA00                  	CMP	DL,0			  ;AN000;EO. all fail ?
 47028 00007ED4 74E4                    	JZ	short ext_inval2	  ;AN000;EO. yes, error
 47029                                  	;and	dl,0Fh
 47030 00007ED6 80E20F                  	AND	DL,EXISTS_MASK		  ;AN000;EO. get exists action byte
 47031 00007ED9 80FA02                  	CMP	DL,2			  ;AN000;EO, > 2
 47032 00007EDC 77DC                    	JA	short ext_inval2	  ;AN000;EO. yes, error
 47033                                  	;and	ah,0F0h
 47034 00007EDE 80E4F0                  	AND	AH,NOT_EXISTS_MASK	  ;AN000;EO. get no exists action byte
 47035 00007EE1 80FC10                  	CMP	AH,10H			  ;AN000;EO. > 10
 47036 00007EE4 77D4                    	JA	short ext_inval2	  ;AN000;EO. yes, error
 47037                                  
 47038 00007EE6 368C06[FB05]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_ES],ES		  ;AN000;EO. save API parms;smr;SS Override
 47039 00007EEB 36893E[F905]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_DI],DI		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47040 00007EF0 36FF36[F405]            	PUSH	word [SS:EXTOPEN_FLAG]	  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47041 00007EF5 368F06[FD05]            	POP	word [SS:SAVE_DX]	  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47042 00007EFA 36890E[FF05]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_CX],CX		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47043 00007EFF 36891E[0106]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_BX],BX		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47044 00007F04 368C1E[0506]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_DS],DS		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47045 00007F09 368936[0306]            	MOV	[SS:SAVE_SI],SI		  ;AN000;EO.;smr;SS Override
 47046 00007F0E 89F2                    	MOV	DX,SI			  ;AN000;EO. ds:dx points to file name
 47047 00007F10 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			  ;AN000;EO. ax= mode
 47048                                  ; 16/03/2024
 47049                                  %if 0
 47050                                  	JMP	SHORT goopen2		  ;AN000;;EO. do normal
 47051                                  ext_inval2:				  ;AN000;;EO.
 47052                                  	;mov	al,1
 47053                                  	mov	al,error_invalid_function ;AN000;EO.. invalid function
 47054                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47055                                  eo_err:
 47056                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 47057                                  	jmp	short CreateFail
 47058                                  %endif
 47059                                  
 47060                                  ; 16/03/2024
 47061                                  %if 0

 47236                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 47237                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47238                                  ;
 47239                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47240                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 47241                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 47242                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 47243                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 47244                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 47245                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 47246                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 47247                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47248                                  ;
 47249                                  ;   Error returns:
 47250                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47251                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47252                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47253                                  ;
 47254                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47255                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 47256                                  ;
 47257                                  ;				    0? lock all
 47258                                  ;				    8? lock write
 47259                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 47260                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 47261                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 47262                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 47263                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 47264                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 47265                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 47266                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 47267                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47268                                  ;
 47269                                  ;   Error returns:
 47270                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47271                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47272                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation

 47539 00008037 50                      	push	ax ; MSDOS 6.0
 47540

 47542                                  	;Call	far [ss:JShare+(8*4)]	; 8 = chk_block
 47543                                  	;MSDOS 6.0

 47727                                  sharev_2: 
 47728                                  	;;;
 47729 000080CD E8F3DB                  	call	HARDERR
 47730                                  ; 01/07/2024
 47731                                  %if 0
 47732                                  	POP	DI
 47733                                  	POP	ES
 47734                                  	POP	DS
 47735                                  	CMP	AL,1
 47736                                  	jz	short shchk_retn	; 1 = retry, carry clear
 47737                                  	STC
 47738                                  	retn
 47739                                  %else
 47740 000080D0 EBAD                    	jmp	short sharev_3
 47741                                  %endif
 47742                                  
 47743                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47744                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 47745                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 47746                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 47747                                  ;
 47748                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 47749                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 47750                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 47751                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47752                                  
 47753                                  ShareEnd:
 47754                                  	; 26/07/2019
 47755 000080D2 FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 47756 000080D6 C3                      	retn
 47757                                  
 47758                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 47759                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47760                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 47761                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 47762                                  ;
 47763                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 47764                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 47765                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 47766                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 47767                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 47768                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47769                                  
 47770                                  ShareEnter:
 47771 000080D7 51                      	push	cx
 47772                                  retry:
 47773 000080D8 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 47774                                  attempt:
 47775 000080DC C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 47776 000080E0 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 47777                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],ax
 47778 000080E2 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 47779 000080E6 51                      	push	cx
 47780 000080E7 E8ABFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 47781 000080EA 59                      	pop	cx
 47782 000080EB 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 47783 000080ED E8E596                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 47784 000080F0 E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 47785 000080F2 E8A5FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 47786 000080F5 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 47787                                  done:
 47788 000080F7 59                      	pop	cx
 47789 000080F8 C3                      	retn
 47790                                  
 47791                                  ;============================================================================
 47792                                  ; EXEPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 47793                                  ;============================================================================
 47794                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 47795                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 47796                                  
 47797                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 47798                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47799                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 47800                                  ;
 47801                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 47802                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 47803                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 47804                                  ;
 47805                                  ;	Revision history:
 47806                                  ;
 47807                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 47808                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47809                                  
 47810                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47811                                  ;
 47812                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 47813                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 47814                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 47815                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 47816                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 47817                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 47818                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 47819                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 47820                                  ;
 47821                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47822                                  
 47823                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH
 47824                                  PATCH1_OFFSET		EQU	028H
 47825                                  PATCH1_CHKSUM		EQU	0EF4EH
 47826                                  CHKSUM1_LEN		EQU	11CH/2 ; 142
 47827                                  
 47828                                  PATCH2_COM_OFFSET	EQU	076H
 47829                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47830                                  
 47831                                  	; The strings that start at offset 076h have two possible 
 47832                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 47833                                  
 47834                                  PATCH2_CHKSUM		EQU	78B2H
 47835                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2
 47836                                  PATCH2A_CHKSUM		EQU	1C47H		; M046
 47837                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046
 47838                                  
 47839                                  PATCH3_COM_OFFSET	EQU	074H
 47840                                  PATCH3_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 47841                                  PATCH3_CHKSUM		EQU	4EDEH
 47842                                  CHKSUM3_LEN		EQU	117H/2
 47843                                  
 47844                                  ;**	Data structure passed for ExecReady call
 47845                                  ;
 47846                                  ;struc ERStruc
 47847                                  ; .ER_Reserved:	resw	1	; reserved, should be zero
 47848                                  ; .ER_Flags:	resw	1
 47849                                  ; .ER_ProgName:	resd	1	; ptr to ASCIIZ str of prog name
 47850                                  ; .ER_PSP:	resw	1	; PSP of the program
 47851                                  ; .ER_StartAddr: resd	1	; Start CS:IP of the program
 47852                                  ; .ER_ProgSize:	resd	1	; Program size including PSP
 47853                                  ; .size:
 47854                                  ;endstruc
 47855                                  
 47856                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 47857                                  
 47858                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47859                                  	; DOSCODE:B3DDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 47860                                  
 47861                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47862                                  	; DOSCODE:B37Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47863                                  
 47864                                  	; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47865                                  	; DOSCODE:C697h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 47866                                  
 47867                                  ; M028 - BEGIN
 47868                                  
 47869                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47870                                  ;
 47871                                  ;	Procedure Name		: ExecReady
 47872                                  ;
 47873                                  ;	Input			: DS:DX -> ERStruc (see exe.inc)
 47874                                  ;
 47875                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47876                                  
 47877                                  ExecReady:
 47878 000080F9 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; move the pointer into a friendly one
 47879                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47880                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47881 000080FB F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47882                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; COM or EXE ?
 47883 000080FF 7418                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 47884                                  
 47885                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47886 00008101 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47887 00008104 83C010                  	add	ax,10h
 47888 00008107 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 47889                                  
 47890                                  	;mov	cx,[si+10]
 47891 00008109 8B4C0A                  	mov	cx,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr]   ; M030
 47892                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12]	; 11/04/2024
 47893 0000810C 8B440C                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr+2] ; M030
 47894                                  
 47895                                  	;call	[ss:FixExePatch]
 47896 0000810F 36FF16[670D]            	call	word [ss:FixExePatch] ; 28/12/2022
 47897                                  	
 47898                                  	; 20/03/2024
 47899                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47900 00008114 36FF16[4612]            	call	word [ss:Rational386PatchPtr]
 47901                                  
 47902                                  er_setver:
 47903                                  	;;test	word [si+2],2		; Q: is this an overlay
 47904                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47905 00008119 F6440202                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY ; 2
 47906                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY
 47907 0000811D 7518                    	jnz	short er_chkdoshi	; Y: set A20OFF_COUNT if DOS high
 47908                                  					; N: set up lie version first
 47909 0000811F 1E                      	push	ds
 47910 00008120 56                      	push	si
 47911                                  	;lds	si,[si+4]
 47912 00008121 C57404                  	lds	si,[si+ERStruc.ER_ProgName]
 47913 00008124 E8DCEC                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 47914 00008127 E8EDEC                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 47915 0000812A 5E                      	pop	si
 47916 0000812B 1F                      	pop	ds
 47917                                  	;mov	es,[si+8]
 47918 0000812C 8E4408                  	mov	es,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 47919 0000812F 36A1[BB0E]              	mov	ax,[ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 47920                                  	;mov	[es:40h],ax ; 11/04/2024
 47921 00008133 26A34000                	mov	[es:PDB.Version],ax
 47922                                  
 47923                                  er_chkdoshi:
 47924 00008137 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DosHasHMA],0	; M032: Q: is dos in HMA (M021)
 47925 0000813D 741E                    	je	short er_done		; M032: N: done
 47926                                  
 47927                                  					; M068 - Start
 47928                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 47929 0000813F 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]	; ax = PSP
 47930                                  
 47931                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],4
 47932 00008142 36800E[8600]04          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; Set bit to signal int 21
 47933                                  					; ah = 25 & ah= 49. See dossym.inc 
 47934                                  					; under TAG M003 & M009 for 
 47935                                  					; explanation
 47936                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 47937                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47938 00008148 F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 47939                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; Q: COM file
 47940 0000814C 7506                    	jnz	short er_setA20		; N: inc a20off_count, set 
 47941                                  					;    a20off_psp and ret
 47942                                     	; 07/03/2025
 47943                                  	;push	ds
 47944                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; DS = load segment of com file.
 47945                                  	;call	IsCopyProt ; !*!	; check if copy protected
 47946                                  	;pop	ds
 47947                                  
 47948                                  	; 07/03/2025 (MiniDOS 1.0)
 47949 0000814E 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; *!*
 47950                                  
 47951                                  er_setA20:
 47952                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 47953                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 47954                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 47955                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 47956                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 47957                                  
 47958 00008154 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 47959 00008159 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 47960                                  					; turned OFF.
 47961                                  er_done:				; M068 - End
 47962 0000815D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 47963 0000815F C3                      	retn
 47964

 47979                                  ; temp iret instruction

 47987 00008160 CF                      	iret
 47988                                  
 47989                                  ; 22/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 47990                                  
 47991                                  ; pointer to the BIOS data segment that will be available just to the
 47992                                  ; initialization code

 47994 00008161 7000                    InitBioDataSeg:	dw 70h ; KERNEL_SEGMENT = 0070h
 47995                                  
 47996                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47997                                  ; DOSCODE:B76Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 47998                                  
 47999                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48000                                  ; DOSCODE:CCE1h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48001                                  
 48002                                  ; Convert AX from a number of bytes to a number of paragraphs (round up).
 48003                                  
 48004                                  ParaRound:
 48005 00008163 83C00F                  	add	ax, 15
 48006 00008166 D1D8                    	rcr	ax, 1
 48007 00008168 D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48008 0000816A D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48009 0000816C D1E8                    	shr	ax, 1
 48010 0000816E C3                      	retn

 48018                                  
 48019                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48020                                  ;
 48021                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 48022                                  ;
 48023                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 48024                                  ;
 48025                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 48026                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 48027                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 48028                                  ;
 48029                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 48030                                  ;
 48031                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48032                                  
 48033                                  WhatCPUType:
 48034                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48035                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 48036                                  
 48037                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48038                                  
 48039                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 48040                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 48041                                  ;
 48042                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 48043                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 48044                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 48045                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 48046                                  
 48047                                  	; 04/11/2022
 48048                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 48049                                  
 48050                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48051                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 48052                                  
 48053                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 48054 0000816F 9C                      	pushf
 48055 00008170 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 48056 00008171 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 48057                                  
 48058 00008173 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 48059 00008175 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 48060 00008176 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 48061 00008177 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 48062 00008178 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 48063 00008179 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 48064 0000817C 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 48065 0000817F 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 48066                                  
 48067 00008181 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 48068 00008184 50                      	push	ax
 48069 00008185 9D                      	popf
 48070 00008186 9C                      	pushf
 48071 00008187 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 48072 00008188 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 48073 0000818B 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 48074                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 48075 0000818D 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 48076                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 48077 0000818E 43                      	inc	bx
 48078                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 48079 0000818F 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 48080 00008191 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 48081 00008192 9D                      	popf
 48082                                  	
 48083                                  	;endm
 48084                                  
 48085                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48086 00008193 C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 48087                                  
 48088                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48089                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022

 48101

 48108                                  	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 03/03/2018
 48109                                  	; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48110                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 79A9h
 48111                                  DOSINIT:
 48112                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS, offset 7C77h
 48113                                  	;
 48114                                  	; Far call from SYSINIT
 48115                                  	; DX = Memory size in paragraphs
 48116                                  	; DS:SI = [DEVICE_LIST] (SYSINIT.S) 
 48117                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v2.0, 16/03/2018)
 48118                                  	;
 48119                                  	; ES:DI = ptr to BIOS communication block (sysinit3.s)
 48120                                  	;	  (Retro DOS v4.0, 20/04/2019)
 48121                                  
 48122 00008194 FA                              CLI
 48123 00008195 FC                              CLD
 48124                                  
 48125                                  	; 03/11/2022
 48126                                  	;push	dx ; 30/05/2019		; save parameters from BIOS
 48127                                  	
 48128                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48129                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48130                                  	;push	dx ; =*=		; save parameters from BIOS
 48131                                  	
 48132 00008196 56                      	push	si
 48133 00008197 1E                      	push	ds
 48134 00008198 57                      	push	di			;save di (ptr to BiosComBlock)
 48135                                  
 48136 00008199 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			;bx:di = ptr to BiosComBlock
 48137                                  
 48138                                  ; First, move the DOS data segment to its final location in low memory
 48139                                  
 48140                                  	;;;mov	ax,0BF69h ; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 7C7Fh
 48141                                  	;;mov	ax,0BC77h ; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS, file offset 79B1h
 48142                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48143                                  	;mov	ax,0D20Fh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, file offset 92FFh
 48144 0000819B B8[0B86]                	mov	ax,MEMSTRT		; get offset of end of init code
 48145                                  
 48146                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48147 0000819E 83C00F                  	add	ax,15			; round to nearest paragraph
 48148                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; boundary
 48149                                  	; 12/04/2024
 48150 000081A1 24F0                    	and	al,0F0h
 48151                                  
 48152 000081A3 89C6                    	mov	si,ax			; si = offset of DOSDATA in current
 48153                                  					; code segment
 48154                                  	; 05/12/2022
 48155                                  	; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48156                                  	;xor	si,si
 48157                                  	
 48158                                  	;mov	ax,cs
 48159                                  	;mov	ds,ax			; ds = current code segment
 48160                                  					; DS:SI now points to dosdata
 48161                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48162 000081A5 0E                      	push	cs
 48163 000081A6 1F                      	pop	ds
 48164                                  
 48165                                  	;mov	es,[cs:0BA49h] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, offset 7C8Eh 
 48166                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]	; First access to DosDataSg in
 48167                                  					;  BData segment. Cannot use
 48168                                  					;  getdseg macro here!!!
 48169                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48170 000081A7 8E06[6181]              	mov	es,[InitBioDataSeg]
 48171                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48172                                  	;mov	es,[cs:InitBioDataSeg]  ; ds = cs !
 48173                                  
 48174                                  	;mov	es,[es:3]
 48175 000081AB 268E060300              	mov	es,[es:DosDataSg]	; Get free location in low memory
 48176                                  
 48177 000081B0 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; ES:DI now points to RAM data
 48178                                  
 48179                                  	;mov	cx,4970  ; Offset 0BA78h in MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 48180                                  	;mov	cx,4976  ; 25/05/2019
 48181                                  	; 22/03/2024
 48182                                  	;mov	cx,4934	 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 48183                                  	; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48184                                  	;mov	cx,4962
 48185                                  	;mov	cx,MSDAT001E		; get end of dosdata = size of dosdata
 48186 000081B2 B94812                  	mov	cx,DOSDATASIZE	; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 48187                                  				; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM ; 01/07/2024
 48188 000081B5 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; move data to final location
 48189                                  	
 48190 000081B7 5F                      	pop	di			; restore ptr to BiosComBlock
 48191 000081B8 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore parms from BIOS
 48192 000081B9 5E                      	pop	si
 48193                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48194                                  	;pop	dx ; 30/05/2019	
 48195                                  	; 05/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48196                                  	;pop	dx ; =*=
 48197                                  
 48198 000081BA 06                      	push	es

 49033                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49034                                  ;
 49035                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 49036                                  ;
 49037                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 49038                                  ;
 49039                                  ;	USED:	none
 49040                                  ;
 49041                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49042                                  
 49043                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 49044                                  ;
 49045                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 49046                                  ;
 49047 00008492 50                      	push	ax
 49048                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 49049 00008493 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 49050 00008496 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49051                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 49052                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 49053                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 49054 00008498 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 49055 0000849A 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 49056                                  ;
 49057                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 49058                                  ; need to call it later.
 49059                                  ;
 49060 0000849C 53                      	push	bx
 49061 0000849D 52                      	push	dx
 49062 0000849E 1E                      	push	ds
 49063 0000849F 06                      	push	es
 49064                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 49065 000084A0 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 49066 000084A3 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49067                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 49068                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 49069                                  
 49070 000084A5 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49071                                  
 49072 000084AA 891E[4D10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 49073 000084AE 8C06[4F10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 49074                                  cXMMexit:
 49075 000084B2 F8                      	clc
 49076 000084B3 07                      	pop	es
 49077 000084B4 1F                      	pop	ds
 49078 000084B5 5A                      	pop	dx
 49079 000084B6 5B                      	pop	bx
 49080 000084B7 58                      	pop	ax
 49081 000084B8 C3                      	retn				; done
 49082                                  ;
 49083                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 49084                                  ;
 49085                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 49086 000084B9 F9                      	stc
 49087 000084BA 58                      	pop	ax
 49088 000084BB C3                      	retn

 49090                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49091                                  ;
 49092                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 49093                                  ;
 49094                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 49095                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 49096                                  ;
 49097                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 49098                                  ;		   if AX =0
 49099                                  ;		      if first entry
 49100                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 49101                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 49102                                  ;		      else
 49103                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 49104                                  ;
 49105                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 49106                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 49107                                  ;
 49108                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 49109                                  ;
 49110                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 49111                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49112                                  
 49113 000084BC 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 49114                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 49115                                  
 49116                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 49117                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 49118                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 49119                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 49120                                  
 49121                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (ref: PCDOS 7.1)
 49122                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D07Eh

 49590                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49591                                  ;
 49592                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 49593                                  ;
 49594                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 49595                                  ;
 49596                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 49597                                  ;
 49598                                  ;	Description:
 49599                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 49600                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 49601                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 49602                                  ;
 49603                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49604                                  
 49605                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49606                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BC50h
 49607                                  
 49608                                  	; 23/03/2024
 49609                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BF42h
 49610                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 49611                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D1E9h
 49612                                  
 49613                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 49614                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 49615                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 49616                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 49617                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 49618                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch

 49858                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49859                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 49860                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49861                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 49862                                  ;;
 49863                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 49864                                  ;;
 49865                                  ;;	on return:
 49866                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 49867                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 49868                                  ;;
 49869                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 49870                                  ;;
 49871                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49872                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 49873                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 49874                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 49875                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 49876                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 49877                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 49878                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 49879                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 49880                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 49881                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 49882                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 49883                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 49884                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 49885                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 49886                                  ;;
 49887                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 49888

 50105                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 50106                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 50107                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 50108                                  ;
 50109                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 50110                                  ; describing that data item.
 50111                                  
 50112                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50113                                  
 50114                                  ;
 50115                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 50116                                  ;
 50117                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 50118                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 50119                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 50120                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 50121                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 50122                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 50123                                  ;
 50124                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 50125                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 50126                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 50127                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 50128                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 50129                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 50130                                  ;   as EOF).
 50131                                  
 50132                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 50133                                  
 50134                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 50135                                  
 50136                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 50137 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 50138 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 50139                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 50140 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 50141                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 50142 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 50143                                  
 50144                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 50145                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 50146                                  ; console.
 50147                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 50148 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 50149 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 50150                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 50151 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 50152 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 50153                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 50154 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 50155 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 50156 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 50157                                  switch_character:
 50158 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 50159 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 50160 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 50161 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 50162 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 50163

 50373                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)

 50375                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50376                                  
 50377                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 50378                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 50379                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 50380                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 50381                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 50382                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 50383                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 50384                                  ; **********************************************************
 50385                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 50386                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 50387                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 50388                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 50389                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 50390                                  ; **********************************************************	
 50391                                  
 50392                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 50393                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50394                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50395                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 50396                                  
 50397                                  ; 	ORG     0
 50398                                  
 50399                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 50400                                  
 50401                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 50402                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 50403 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 50404 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 50405                                  
 50406                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 50407                                  
 50408                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 50409                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 50410 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 50411                                  RENBUF:	
 50412 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 50413                                  
 50414                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 50415                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 50416 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 50417                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 50418 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 50419                                  
 50420                                  ; End of contiguous buffer

 50423                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.

 50431                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.

 50987                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:0CF5h
 50988                                  ; 24/03/2024
 50989                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 50990                                  
 50991                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50992                                  ;
 50993                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 50994                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 50995                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 50996                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 50997                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 50998                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50999                                  ; Example:
 51000                                  
 51001                                  MAP_CASE:
 51002                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 51003                                  
 51004 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 51005                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51006                                  	;RETF
 51007                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 51008                                  	;;;
 51009 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51010                                  	;;;
 51011                                  Map1:
 51012 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 51013 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 51014 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 51015 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 51016                                  FINISH:
 51017 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 51018 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 51019 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 51020 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 51021 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 51022                                  L_RET:	
 51023 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 51024                                  
 51025                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 51026                                  
 51027                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51028
