 51371                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 51372                                  
 51373                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51374                                  ; 24/03/2024
 51375                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 51376                                  
 51377                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51378                                  ;
 51379                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 51380                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 51381                                  ;
 51382                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 51383                                  ;
 51384                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51385                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51386                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 51387                                  ;
 51388                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51389                                  
 51390                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 51391                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 51392                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 51393                                  ;ELSE
 51394                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 51395                                  ;ENDIF
 51396                                  ;ENDM
 51397

 51474                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:

 51478                                  ; A Locus value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51479                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51480                                  ; THE END.

 51815                                  
 51816                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51817                                  ;
 51818                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 51819                                  ;
 51820                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 51821                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 51822                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 51823                                  ;
 51824                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 51825                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 51826                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 51827                                  ;	   4. else 
 51828                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 51829                                  ;	   6. endif
 51830                                  ;	7. else
 51831                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 51832                                  ;	9. endif
 51833                                  ;
 51834                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51835                                  
 51836                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51837                                  
 51838                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51839                                  
 51840                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 51841                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 51842                                  
 51843                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51844                                  ;
 51845                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 51846                                  ;
 51847                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51848                                  
 51849                                  ldivov:
 51850                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51851                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51852                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51853                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51854                                  i0patch:
 51855 00000F70 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 51856                                  
 51857 00000F72 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51858                                  divov_cont:
 51859 00000F75 2EFF2E[4C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 51860                                  
 51861                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51862                                  ;
 51863                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 51864                                  ;
 51865                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 51866                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 51867                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 51868                                  ; will be restored then.
 51869                                  ;
 51870                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51871                                  
 51872                                  lquit:
 51873                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51874                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51875                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51876                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51877                                  i20patch:
 51878 00000F7A EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 51879                                  
 51880 00000F7C E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51881                                  quit_cont:
 51882 00000F7F 2EFF2E[500F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 51883                                  
 51884                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51885                                  ;
 51886                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 51887                                  ;
 51888                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51889                                  
 51890                                  lcommand:
 51891                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51892                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51893                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51894                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51895                                  i21patch:
 51896 00000F84 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 51897                                  
 51898 00000F86 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51899                                  command_cont:
 51900 00000F89 2EFF2E[540F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 51901                                  
 51902                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51903                                  ;
 51904                                  ; INT 25h
 51905                                  ;
 51906                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51907                                  
 51908                                  labsdrd:
 51909                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51910                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51911                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51912                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51913                                  i25patch:
 51914 00000F8E EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 51915                                  
 51916 00000F90 E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51917                                  absdrd_cont:
 51918 00000F93 2EFF2E[580F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 51919                                  
 51920                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51921                                  ;
 51922                                  ; INT 26h
 51923                                  ;
 51924                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51925                                  
 51926                                  labsdwrt:
 51927                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51928                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51929                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51930                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51931                                  i26patch:
 51932 00000F98 EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 51933                                  
 51934 00000F9A E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51935                                  absdwrt_cont:
 51936 00000F9D 2EFF2E[5C0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 51937                                  
 51938                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51939                                  ;
 51940                                  ; INT 27h
 51941                                  ;
 51942                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51943                                  
 51944                                  lstay_resident:
 51945                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51946                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51947                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51948                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51949                                  i27patch:
 51950 00000FA2 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont
 51951                                  
 51952 00000FA4 E8B000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51953                                  sr_cont:
 51954 00000FA7 2EFF2E[600F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 51955                                  
 51956                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51957                                  ;
 51958                                  ; INT 2Fh
 51959                                  ;
 51960                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51961                                  
 51962                                  lint2f:
 51963                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 51964                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51965                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51966                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51967                                  i2fpatch:
 51968 00000FAC EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont
 51969                                  
 51970 00000FAE E8A600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51971                                  int2f_cont:
 51972 00000FB1 2EFF2E[640F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+24]	; jmp to DOS
 51973

 51982                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51983                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51984                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51985                                  cpmpatch:

 51987

 51989                                  callentry_cont:

 51998                                  lirett:
 51999                                  	iret
 52000                                  
 52001                                  %endif
 52002                                  
 52003                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52004                                  ;
 52005                                  ; LowIntXX:
 52006                                  ;
 52007                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 52008                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 52009                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 52010                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 52011                                  ;
 52012                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 52013                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 52014                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 52015                                  ;
 52016                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 52017                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 52018                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 52019                                  ;
 52020                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52021                                  
 52022                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52023                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 52024                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 52025                                  
 52026 00000FC0 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 52027 00000FC4 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 52028                                  
 52029                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52030                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52031                                  %if 0
 52032                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 52033                                  %endif
 52034                                  
 52035                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 52036                                  LowInt23:
 52037                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52038                                  					; the stack
 52039 00000FC8 2E8F06[C00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 52040 00000FCD 2E8F06[C20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 52041                                  
 52042 00000FD2 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 52043                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52044                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52045                                  
 52046 00000FD4 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52047                                  
 52048 00000FD7 2EFF2E[C00F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 52049                                  
 52050                                  
 52051                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 52052                                  LowInt24:
 52053                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52054                                  					; the stack
 52055 00000FDC 2E8F06[C40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 52056 00000FE1 2E8F06[C60F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 52057                                  
 52058 00000FE6 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 52059                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52060                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52061                                  
 52062 00000FE8 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52063                                  
 52064 00000FEB 2EFF2E[C40F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 52065                                  
 52066                                  
 52067                                   
 52068                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 52069                                  LowInt28:
 52070 00000FF0 CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 52071                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52072                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52073                                  
 52074 00000FF2 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52075                                  
 52076 00000FF5 CB                      	retf
 52077                                  
 52078                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52079                                  
 52080                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52081                                  ;
 52082                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 52083                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 52084                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 52085                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 52086                                  ;
 52087                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 52088                                  
 52089                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52090                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 52091                                  
 52092                                  disa20_xfer:
 52093 00000FF6 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 52094                                  
 52095                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 52096                                  
 52097                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 52098                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 52099                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 52100                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 52101                                  
 52102 00000FF9 FA                      	cli
 52103 00000FFA 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 52104                                  
 52105                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52106                                  	;;;
 52107 00001000 36C606[C011]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 52108                                  	;;;
 52109                                  
 52110 00001006 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 52111 00001008 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 52112 0000100A FB                      	sti
 52113                                  
 52114 0000100B 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 52115 0000100C 56                      	push	SI
 52116 0000100D 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 52117 0000100F 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 52118 00001011 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 52119 00001013 CB                      	retf
 52120                                  
 52121                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52122                                  ;
 52123                                  ; M003:
 52124                                  ;
 52125                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 52126                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 52127                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 52128                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 52129                                  ; more info.
 52130                                  ;
 52131                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 52132                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 52133                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 52134                                  ;
 52135                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52136                                  
 52137                                  disa20_iret:
 52138 00001014 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 52139 00001017 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 52140                                  
 52141                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52142                                  	;;;
 52143 0000101B FE0E[C011]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 52144                                  	;;;
 52145                                  
 52146 0000101F 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 52147 00001023 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 52148 00001027 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 52149                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 52150 00001029 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 52151                                  	
 52152                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52153                                  %if 0
 52154                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 52155                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 52156                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 52157                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 52158                                  %else
 52159                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52160                                  	;;;
 52161                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 52162 0000102C C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 52163 00001030 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 52164 00001034 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 52165                                  	;;;
 52166                                  %endif
 52167 00001037 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 52168 00001038 5B                      	pop	BX
 52169 00001039 59                      	pop	CX
 52170 0000103A 5A                      	pop	DX
 52171 0000103B 5E                      	pop	SI
 52172 0000103C 5F                      	pop	DI
 52173 0000103D 5D                      	pop	BP
 52174 0000103E 1F                      	pop	DS
 52175 0000103F 07                      	pop	ES
 52176                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52177 00001040 CF                      	iret
 52178                                  
 52179                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52180                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 52181                                  ;
 52182                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 52183                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52184                                  ;
 52185                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 52186                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 52187                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 52188                                  ;
 52189                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52190                                  
 52191                                  XMMDisableA20:
 52192 00001041 53                      	push	bx
 52193 00001042 50                      	push	ax
 52194                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 52195 00001043 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 52196 00001045 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52197 0000104A 58                      	pop	ax
 52198 0000104B 5B                      	pop	bx
 52199 0000104C C3                      	retn
 52200                                  
 52201                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 52202                                  
 52203                                  XMMcontrol:
 52204 0000104D 00000000                	dd	0
 52205                                  
 52206                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52207                                  ; 24/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52208                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:107Fh
 52209                                  ;;;
 52210 00001051 00000000                	dd	0
 52211                                  SC_STATUS:
 52212 00001055 0000                    	dw	0
 52213                                  ;;;
 52214                                  
 52215                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52216                                  ;
 52217                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 52218                                  ;
 52219                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 52220                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52221                                  ;
 52222                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 52223                                  ;
 52224                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 52225                                  ;		
 52226                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 52227                                  ;
 52228                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52229                                  
 52230                                  ; 19/09/2023
 52231                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 52232                                  ;	dw	00080h
 52233                                  ;	dw	00000h
 52234                                  ;
 52235                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 52236                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 52237                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 52238                                  
 52239                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52240                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 52241                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 52242                                  
 52243                                  EnsureA20ON:
 52244 00001057 9C                      	pushf
 52245 00001058 1E                      	push    ds
 52246 00001059 06                      	push	es
 52247 0000105A 51                      	push	cx
 52248 0000105B 56                      	push	si
 52249 0000105C 57                      	push	di
 52250                                  
 52251                                  	; 19/09/2023
 52252                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 52253                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 52254                                  
 52255                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 52256                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 52257                                  	;;;
 52258 0000105D 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 52259 0000105F 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 52260 00001061 4E                      	dec	si
 52261 00001062 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 52262 00001065 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 52263 00001067 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 52264                                  	;;;	
 52265                                  
 52266 0000106A B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 52267 0000106D FC                      	cld
 52268 0000106E F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 52269                                  
 52270 00001070 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 52271                                  EA20_RET:
 52272 00001072 5F                      	pop	di
 52273 00001073 5E                      	pop	si
 52274 00001074 59                      	pop	cx
 52275 00001075 07                      	pop	es
 52276 00001076 1F                      	pop	ds
 52277 00001077 9D                      	popf
 52278 00001078 C3                      	retn
 52279                                  
 52280                                  EA20_OFF:
 52281                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 52282                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 52283                                  
 52284 00001079 53                      	push	bx
 52285 0000107A 50                      	push	ax
 52286                                  
 52287                                  ; 25/03/2024
 52288                                  %if 0
 52289                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 52290                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 52291                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52292                                  	mov	ax,cs
 52293                                  	mov	ss,ax
 52294                                  %else
 52295                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52296                                  	;;;
 52297 0000107B 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 52298 0000107D 2E8C16[6C0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 52299 00001082 2E8926[6E0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52300 00001087 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52301                                  	;;;
 52302                                  %endif
 52303 00001089 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 52304                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 52305                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 52306 0000108C B405                    	mov	ah,5
 52307 0000108E 2EFF1E[4D10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52308 00001093 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 52309 00001095 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 52310                                  
 52311                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 52312                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 52313                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52314                                  	;;;
 52315 00001097 2E8E16[6C0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 52316                                  	;;;
 52317 0000109C 2E8B26[6E0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 52318                                  
 52319 000010A1 58                      	pop	ax
 52320 000010A2 5B                      	pop	bx
 52321                                  
 52322 000010A3 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 52323                                  
 52324                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 52325 000010A5 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 52326 000010A7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52327 000010A9 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 52328 000010AB 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 52329                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 52330                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 52331                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52332                                  	;;;
 52333 000010AD B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 52334                                  	;;;
 52335 000010B0 CD10                    	int	10h
 52336                                  XMMcont:
 52337                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 52338                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 52339                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 52340                                  	;;;
 52341 000010B2 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 52342                                  	;;;
 52343 000010B5 CD10                    	int	10h
 52344                                  	
 52345 000010B7 BE[1911]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 52346 000010BA 0E                      	push	cs
 52347 000010BB 1F                      	pop	ds
 52348 000010BC FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 52349                                  XMMprnt:
 52350 000010BD AC                      	lodsb
 52351 000010BE 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 52352 000010C0 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 52353 000010C2 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 52354 000010C4 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 52355 000010C7 CD10                    	int	10h
 52356 000010C9 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 52357                                  
 52358                                  XMMStall:
 52359 000010CB FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 52360 000010CC EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 52361

 52539                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 52540                                  
 52541                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 52542                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 52543                                  ;
 52544                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 52545                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 52546                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 52547                                  ;
 52548                                  ;
 52549                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 52550                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 52551                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 52552                                  
 52553                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52554                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52555                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52556                                  
 52557                                  		db	90h, 90h
 52558                                  
 52559                                  DOSP12_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52560                                  DOSP12_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52561                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52562                                  
 52563                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 52564                                  
 52565                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 52566                                  ;
 52567                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52568                                  ;	GETBUF:
 52569                                  ;
 52570                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 52571                                  ;	push	es
 52572                                  ;	push	di
 52573                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 52574                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 52575                                  ;	pop	di
 52576                                  ;	pop	es
 52577                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 52578                                  
 52579                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 52580                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 52581                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 52582                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 52583                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 52584                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 52585                                  	
 52586                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 52587                                  
 52588                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 52589                                  ;
 52590                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52591                                  ;
 52592                                  ;		push	cx
 52593                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 52594                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 52595                                  ;		jz	????
 52596                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 52597                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 52598                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 52599                                  
 52600                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 52601                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 52602                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 52603                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 52604                                  
 52605                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 52606                                  
 52607                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 52608                                  ;
 52609                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 52610                                  ;
 52611                                  ;
 52612                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 52613                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 52614                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 52615                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 52616                                  ;	inc [indos]
 52617                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 52618                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 52619                                  
 52620                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 52621                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 52622                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 52623                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 52624                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 52625                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 52626                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 52627                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 52628                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 52629                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 52630                                  
 52631                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 52632                                  
 52633                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 52634                                  ;
 52635                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 52636                                  ;
 52637                                  ;
 52638                                  ;
 52639                                  ;	push	ax
 52640                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 52641                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 52642                                  ;	pop	ax
 52643                                  ;	jz	????
 52644                                  
 52645                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 52646                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 52647                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 52648                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 52649                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 52650                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 52651                                  
 52652                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 52653                                  
 52654                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 52655                                  ;
 52656                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 52657                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 52658                                  ;
 52659                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 52660                                  ;
 52661                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 52662                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 52663                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52664                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 52665                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 52666                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 52667                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 52668                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 52669                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 52670                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 52671                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 52672                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 52673                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 52674                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 52675                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 52676                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52677                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 52678                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52679                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 52680                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 52681                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 52682                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 52683                                  ;	    POP     DS
 52684                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 52685                                  ;
 52686                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 52687                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 52688                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 52689                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 52690                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 52691                                  ;
 52692                                  ;   CRDROK:
 52693                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 52694                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 52695                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 52696                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 52697                                  
 52698                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 52699                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52700                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 52701                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52702                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 52703                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52704                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 52705                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52706                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 52707                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 52708                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52709                                  			db	009H,003H
 52710                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 52711                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 52712                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 52713                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52714                                  			db	05FH
 52715                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 52716                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 52717                                  
 52718                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 52719                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 52720                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 52721                                  
 52722                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 52723                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 52724                                  ;
 52725                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 52726                                  ;
 52727                                  ;
 52728                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 52729                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 52730                                  ;	    je l1
 52731                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 52732                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 52733                                  ;	    int 10h
 52734                                  ;	    jmp l0
 52735                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 52736                                  
 52737                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 52738                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 52739                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 52740                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 52741                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 52742                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 52743                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 52744                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 52745                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID

 52802                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 52803                                  ;
 52804                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 52805                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 52806                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can. 
 52807                                  ;

 52820

 52822                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52823                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52824                                  ; 09/03/2024
 52825                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 52826                                  
 52827                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 52828                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 52829                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 52830                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 52831                                  
 52832                                  ; country and code page information
 52833                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52834                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 52835 00001132 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 52836 0000113A 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 52836 00001143 53595300           
 52837                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 52838 00001147 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 52839                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52840                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 52841                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 52842                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 52843                                  ;  endif
 52844                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 52845                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 52846                                  ;  endif
 52847                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 52848                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 52849                                  ;  endif
 52850                                  ;else
 52851 0000117A B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 52852                                  ;endif
 52853                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 52854 0000117C 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 52855                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 52856 0000117E 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 52857 0000117F [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 52858 00001181 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52859 00001183 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 52860 00001184 [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 52861 00001186 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52862 00001188 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 52863 00001189 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 52864 0000118B 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 52865 0000118D 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 52866 0000118E [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 52867 00001190 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter

 52869 00001193 [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 52870 00001195 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 52871 00001197 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 52872 00001198 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size

 52875                                  ;	......

 52885 000011A5 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator

 52893 000011B2 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of entry point

 52976                                  ;	db	'A20 Hardware Error',0Dh,0Ah,'$'
 52977                                  
 52978                                  ; DOSDATA ends
 52979                                  
 52980                                  ; 05/11/2022
 52981                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 52984                                  
 52985                                  ;============================================================================
 52986                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 52987                                  ;============================================================================
 52988                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 52989                                  
 52990                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 52991                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 52992                                  ;
 52993                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 52994                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 52995                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 52996                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 52997                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 52998                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 52999                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 53000                                  ; to call out here.
 53001                                  ;
 53002                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 53003                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 53004                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 53005                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 53006                                  ;
 53007                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 53008                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 53009                                  ;
 53010                                  ;Exported Functions
 53011                                  ;==================
 53012                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 53013                                  
 53014                                  ; DosData Segment
 53015                                  
 53016                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53017                                  
 53018                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53019                                  
 53020                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 53021                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 53022                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 53023                                  ; 'patch' related.
 53024                                  
 53025                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 53026 00001246 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 53027                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53028                                  
 53029                                  ; 25/03/2024
 53030                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 53031                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 53032                                  
 53033                                  ; 07/03/2025
 53034                                  %if 0
 53035                                  MagicPatch:
 53036                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 53037                                          retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 53038                                          nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 53039                                          nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 53040                                          nop             ; call far ?:?     
 53041                                          nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 53042                                          nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 53043                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 53044                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 53045                                  %endif
 53046                                  
 53047                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53048                                  
 53049                                  ;DosData Ends
 53050                                  
 53051                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 53052                                  ;
 53053                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 53054                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 53055                                  
 53056                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 53057                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 53058                                  
 53059                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:1344h)
 53060                                  
 53061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53062

 53064                                  
 53065                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 53066

 53069

 53071                                  
 53072                                  ;align 16
 53073                                  
 53074                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!

 53079                                  ;%endif	; 05/11/2022

 53082                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 53083                                  
 53084                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53085                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 53086                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 53087                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 53088                                  					; = 4970 for MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS
 53089                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 53090                                  					; (= 4944 for Windows ME IO.SYS)
